In 2009, Merlita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services. Merlita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Merlita is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP for the same purpose. This loan will be her fourth loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children's tuition fees. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Mirna Cristabel

texts.es:
Mirna, reside en Corinto departamento de Morazán, tiene 22 años y vive con sus dos hijos Luis Enrique de 6 años y Yesica de 4 años de edad, ella es madre soltera y se dedica a la venta de ropa como su fuente principal de ingreso para llevar a su hogar el alimento para sus hijos. El negocio tiene un año de administrarlo y su madre fue su principal apoyo para iniciarlo.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de ropa ya que en esta temporada ella prevé un aumento en sus ventas por lo que quiere prepararse surtiendo el negocio con prendas de vestir de moda, este préstamo la ayudara a disponer de mercadería y ofrecer a los clientes.
Con el apoyo del préstamo ella espera crecer su micro negocio y así fortalecer sus ingresos para darles a sus hijos la alimentación, salud y educación necesaria.
texts.en:
Mirna lives in the Corinto department of Morazán.  She is 22 years old, and she lives with her two children.  Luis Enrique is six years old, and Yesica is four years old.  She is a single mother.

She sells clothes as her primary source of income for feeding her children.  She has been running her business for one year.  Her mother was her primary support for starting the business.

She is requesting a loan to buy clothes.  She foresees an increase in sales this season, and she wants to be prepared by stocking her business with fashionable clothes.  This loan will help her to have merchandise to sell to the customers.

With the support from the loan she hopes to grow her small business.  That way she will strengthen her income in order to give her children food, health, and the necessary education.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Tsogtbayar

texts.en: Tsogtbayar is 24 years old, single, and lives in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. He lives with his mom and niece in a ger, which is a traditional nomadic tent. His mother is retired. Tsogtbayar is a professional producer and used to work for national broadcasting television as a producer for six years. He is currently employed with “Bolovsrol” television, as a producer as well. Tsogtbayar is an artistic and very hardworking person, and this is the only income for his family. He is planning to make movies and do advertising. Therefore, he is requesting 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase a new professional video camera.

loans.use: To purchase a new professional video camera

loans.name: Jose Juan

texts.es:
El señor José Juan M. tiene ya mas once años dedicándose a la reparación de autos, este negocio es la fuente de ingresos de su familia. 
Don José Juan ya ha tenido tres créditos con kiva los cuales ha utilizado para invertir en su taller, esta nuevamente solicitando un préstamo ya que necesita comprar herramientas mas modernas y partes eléctricas para autos, pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para invertir en la negocio. 
Es por eso que esta solicitando su cooperación en este préstamo y así tener lo necesario en su negocio, para darle a sus clientes un buen servicio.
texts.en:
Mr. José Juan M. has been repairing automobiles for over eleven years.  This business is the only source of income for his family.  José Juan has already had three loans through Kiva which he has invested in his workshop.  He plans to use this new loan to buy more advanced tools and electric auto repair parts, since he does not have the money to do this himself right now. 

He kindly requests your help so he can obtain what he needs for his business and provide his customers with the best service possible.

loans.use: To buy tools and auto repair parts

loans.name: Haider

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 41 years old, married and has six children. In 2008, H. opened his own food market because the competition in his area is minimal. He is well known and has a good reputation.

H. is requesting a $1500 loan to buy two refrigerators and increase his inventory. He is planning to develop his business and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: To buy two refrigerators and increase his inventory

loans.name: Mayra Alexandra

texts.es:
La Señora Mayra T. es socia del banco comunal Sol Naciente, vive por el sector de Miraflores en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es admirada por su belleza arquitectónica la misma que le permitió ser nombrada como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su belleza natural, su gastronomía muy variada y su gente amable y cordial hacen de Cuenca una ciudad hermosa.

Doña Mayra tiene 32 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos  de 14, 13 y 9 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos estudian en el colegio y su ultimo hijo en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo tiene un taller propio en donde  realiza de estucos (cielos rasos), no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de un familiar.

La Señora. Mayra realiza los quehaceres domésticos de varias casas, actividad que realiza hace mucho tiempo, labora de lunes a viernes en distintos horarios. Los fines de semana tiene un pequeño negocio de comida rápida.
 
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en su negocio comprando: víveres, gaseosas, aguas, papas, etc. Se encuentra en el banco comunal hace dos años y medio, tiempo en el que los prestamos le ha permitido crecer poco a poco en su negocio. Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Sra. Mayra T. is a member of the Communal Bank “Sol Naciente” (Rising Sun). She lives in the sector of Miraflores in the city of Cuenca. This city is admired for its architectural beauty, which contributed toward its recognition as a World Heritage Site. The natural beauty, different cuisines, and the kind friendly people are all characteristics that make Cuenca a lovely city.

Doña Mayra is 32 years old, married, and has three children (ages 14, 13, and 9). Her first two children are in high school while the youngest child attends a school in the city. Her husband works in his own shop where he makes stucco (used for installing raised ceilings). They do not own a home, so they live at the house of a relative.

Doña Mayra provides housekeeping services to different families. She has held this job for a long time and works Monday through Friday on a specified schedule. On the weekends, she manages a small business selling fast food.

The money from her loan will be invested in her business. She will buy groceries, sodas, water, potatoes, and other items. Mayra joined the Communal Bank two and a half years ago. Throughout that time, the loans have enabled her to grow her business gradually. Her goal is to have a house of her own.

loans.use: Purchase groceries, sodas, water, potatoes, and other items for her fast food business

loans.name: Mayela Del Carmen

texts.es:
Máyela de 35 años de edad, reside en San Rafael Oriente, departamento de San Miguel, vive con sus cinco hijos, es madre soltera y se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, este negocio lo inicio con el apoyo de su madre, ya que tiene experiencia en el negocio.
Ella solicita un préstamo para la compra de cerdos para engorde, esta compra le permitirá crecer y ampliar la granja de cerdos los cuales al crecer y engordar serán comercializados a buen precio.
Las aspiraciones de Máyela son ampliar el negocio y mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Mayela is 35 years old, and lives in San Rafael Oriente in the department of San Miguel.  She is a single mother who lives with her 5 children, and has a business raising pigs.  She started this business with the help of her mother, who already had experience in this line of work.

Mayela requests a loan to buy pigs to fatten.  This purchase would allow her to grow her business and expand her pig farm, where she raises and fattens pigs that she later sells at a good price.

Mayela hopes to expand her business and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Jun

texts.en:
Jun F. is from the village of Arwas Diadi, Nueva Vizcaya. He is 48 years old. Jun is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, Jun raises pigs for fattening and sale. Jun has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately 2,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Jun joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jun is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase feed & other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jun from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase pig feed & other supplies

loans.name: Enhbaigalmaa

texts.en: Enhbaigalmaa is 47 years old and lives with her husband and three children in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in the Arhangai province of Mongolia. Her husband, age 46, works as a guard for a private company. Her oldest son and daughter go to college while the youngest helps with the family business. Enhbaigalmaa operates a clothing sewing business in her town. She started her business in a rented booth in 2007, with working capital of 80,000 MNT. Now her working capital exceeds 400,000 MNT. She is planning to expand her business in the future. She is a hardworking and open-minded person who says, " I want to own my working place in the future." She is requesting a 800,000 MNT loan to purchase fabric and materials for her business.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and materials.

loans.name: Asha

texts.en: Asha is currently in the business of selling sugar. She is 42 years old, married, with six children, all of whom go to school. Asha has requested a loan to buy more sugar for her stock. She hopes to expand her business with the extra profits.

loans.use: to buy more sugar to sell.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi, composé de femmes mariées et de veuve, ont en moyenne 42 ans, 6 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Nalla, sous préfecture de Fana ; Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le commerce de condiments alimentaires, de galettes et font de la restauration.                                                                                                                             
Les femmes du groupe Benkadi sont à leur premier prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter des condiments, des céréales pour la préparation des galettes et du riz pour la restauration.                                                                        
YOROBO D. compte acheter  quelques colis de condiments alimentaires avec les revendeurs de Fana. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 12.500F CFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les échéances du prêt, payer les contributions des cérémonies sociales et le reste sera  réinvesti dans son activité de commerce.
texts.en:
The members of the Benkadi group, all married women or widows, are on the average 42 years old with six children. They all live in traditional extended family in the village of Nalla, sub-prefecture of Fana, Koulikoro Region (the second administrative region of Mali). They know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends. They sell food condiments and cookies and cook food for sale. 

The members of the Benkadi group are on their first solidarity laon, which will be used to buy condiments, cereals for baking cookies and rice for preparing dishes for sale.Yorobo D. plans to purchase several packs of food condiments from resellers in Fana. She sells daily for cash and on credit, to a customer base composed of men and women. She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 12,500 West African francs, which will be used to pay off the loan and cover her costs of participating in major social events, with the rest reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to buy food condiments

loans.name: Edgar

texts.es: El sr. Edgar, vive en alquiler  en la zona del  abra, es casado tiene 1 hijo, el Sr. Se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir como pantalones, camisas, el lleva su mercadería a santa cruz y sucre los fines de semana, su esposa realiza también la  costura de los pantalones con dos ayudantes que tienen, trabajan juntos en la confección de prendas de vestir, el préstamo lo invertirán para la compra de telas ya que tienen un pedido que entregar, es una familia muy trabajadora con el deseo de poder tener su propia casa, ese es el deseo del Sr. Edgar para así brindar mayor comodidad a su familia, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Edgar is married with one son and rents in the town of Abra. He works making items of clothing such as pants and shirts, and on weekends he takes his clothing to Santa Cruz and Sucre. His wife also helps to sew the pants together with two assistants who work alongside the family to make the clothing.
 
Edgar will use this loan to puchase fabric since he already has an order pending. Edgar's family are very hard working and they would like to own their own house so they could live more comfortably. Edgar is grateful to Kiva for their support.

loans.use: to purchase fabric to make jeans

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a Rwandan entrepreneur that owns a shop.  She has been running it for two years and so far the profits from her successful business have allowed her to pay the school fees for her children.

Ruth is married to a beer salesman and together they have four children between the ages of 8 and 18 years old.  

She will use this loan to buy a refrigerator, as well as rice, sugar, cooking oil, and soap that she can sell in her store. 

She plans to use the future profits of her business to help with the purchase of a house.

Ruth hopes to expand her business so that it will be two times bigger, allowing her to continue to provide for herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for her business as well as rice, sugar, cooking oil, and soap that she can sell in her store

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 40 years old and married to Cicilia . He supports five people in his family.  He has run a transport business for two years.

He has applied for his second loan of KES.25,000 from KADET LTD.   He intends to use the loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts. 

His dream is to own many motorbikes and to lease them to support his family.  He hopes to help his children go to higher learning institutions.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts

loans.name: Rodah

texts.en: Rodah is a 59 year-old married lady. She owns a retail shop in Kilifi. Her business has been in operation for the last 10 years. Rodah is a KADET client and this marks her third borrowing cycle to finance her business. With this loan she plans to purchase corn flour, sugar, rice, cooking oil and margarine to sell. The anticipated profits will be used to repay the loan. Rodah's dream is to become a successful business lady.

loans.use: to purchase corn flour, sugar, rice, cooking oil, and margarine

loans.name: Teddy

texts.en:
Teddy is 50 years old and lives in the town of Gaba in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is widowed and has no children. Teddy has a poultry firm business, which she has had for 2 years.         

To help expand her business, Teddy has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase chicken for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Teddy hopes to generate greater profits and take care of herself.  In the future, Teddy hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicken for resale

loans.name: Khive

texts.en:
Mrs. Khive is a widow, age 54, living in Baray district, Kompong Tom Province, Cambodia. Although she hasn’t a husband to help her, she is the main breadwinner in her family.

Mrs. Khive is the mother of three kids and is a vermicelli seller in her village. Seeing the hardships of their mother, all three kids have found suitable work to do in Phnom Penh. With their help it makes it easier for Mrs. Khive to live than in the past. 

After she discussed it with all her children, Mrs. Khive wishes to borrow  the amount of $1,100 in order to expand her business and purchase goods to sell at her own house.

loans.use: To purchase goods and rice to sell at her own house.

loans.name: Zoila Emperatriz

texts.es:
Zoila, vive con sus tres hijos, administra una tienda en la cual ofrece artículos de primera necesidad, este negocio surgió gracias a su madre quien la apoyo para instalarlo en su vivienda, no tiene horario fijo para atender a sus clientes.
Ella esta solicitando un préstamo para la compra de gaseosas, frijol, arroz, aceite, jabón, frutas, verduras y mas mercadería que es demanda por sus clientes, esta compra le ayudara a aumentar tanto su inventario como sus ventas.
Su mayor sueño es seguir trabajando para mejorar sus ingresos y poder darles el estudio a sus hijos hasta terminar su carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Zoila lives with her three children and manages a store where she sells basic staples. This business came about thanks to her mother who supported her in starting it up in her living quarters. She has no fixed schedule for waiting on her customers. 

She is seeking a loan to purchase soft drinks, beans, rice, oil, soap, fruits, vegetables and other merchandise requested by her customers. This purchase will allow her to increase in her inventory along with her sales. 

Her greatest dream is to keep working in order to increase her income, and be able provide schooling for her children through the completion of a university degree.

loans.use: ro purchase soft drinks, beans, rice, oil, soap, fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr:
Marie est née au Rwanda et a 57 ans. Elle est veuve et elle a 4 enfants de 16 à 28 ans, dont 4 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de primaire. 
Marie est agricultrice de manioc, d’haricots et de sorghos. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit pour acheter des fertilisants pour l’agriculture de manioc. . 
Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d‘utiliser les anglais chimiques et cultiver de façon moderne. Dans les prochaines années, Marie voudrait se développer elle même et contribuer au développement de la région où elle habite. Avec les profits, elle prévoit de payer les frais scolaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Marie is born on Rwanda and is 57 year old. She is a widow, with four children ranging from 16 to 28 years of age, and all four of them study. He educational level is six  years of primary school.

Marie grows manioc [cassava], beans and sorghum. This is her second loan cycle with ACB. She will use her loan to buy fertilizers to grow manioc. Her business strategy is to use chemical fertilizers and farm the modern way. In the future, she would like to grow her business and contribute to the development of the region she lives in. With her revenues, she plans to pay the tuition of her children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for growing manioc

loans.name: So

texts.en:
Mrs. So, 47, is a cheerful and hardworking woman who lives in her own home with her husband and their two children. Her children are still economically dependent on her. What she most wants is to offer her family a better quality of life. Since she was very young, Mrs. So has worked selling Khmer traditional medicines. From this business, Mrs. So earns about $3 each day. To supplement her income, her husband works as a firewood seller in front of the house. 

Mrs. So and her husband want to have a horse carriage for transporting their firewood but lack the money. Therefore, they wish to request a loan through HKL, a Kiva partner. She and her husband will use this loan to purchase a horse carriage. She hopes to be able to depend on the support of her financiers. In the future, she hopes that this loan will make her financially stable. This is Mrs. So’s first loan with Kiva, and she is very happy to know that she can count on the support of her financiers.

loans.use: to purchase a horse carriage.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien, 33, is married and has been supporting her family by operating a beauty shop in the local community. Her husband is a driver. She lives with her 2 children and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City. 

Lien has been in business since 2008. She plans to use this loan to buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and materials such as shampoo, dyes, and nail-polish. In the future, she would like to expand her business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy new hairdressing tools, cosmetics, and materials for hairdressing services.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay her graduation expenses

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios is 40 years old and married. She has 3 children. Remedios has had a sari-sari store business for 4 years. She sells various items such as spices, soft drinks, and purified water. Each month, Remedios earns 5000 PHP from her business.

Remedios has requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, spices and softdrinks. Remedios hopes that through her business, her children will be able to finish school and their living situation will improve.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as canned goods, spices, and softdrinks

loans.name: Noemi Elvira

texts.es:
Noemí de 53 años, vive en una zona suburbana llamada “Durán”, una mujer que tiene aspiraciones de crecimiento de negocio.
Su negocio es la venta de comida que empezó hace 5 años, inicio esta actividad en la parte delantera de su vivienda vendiendo tortilla de verde, café, etc.
Ella escogió esta actividad ya que se dio cuenta que tenía el arte de la cocina en las manos, que decidió ponerse una local de ventas de comidas.
Su actividad la realiza sola, en vez en cuando con su esposo, su horario es de 8:00am hasta las 12:00am, de lunes a domingo.
Está casada, su esposo trabaja para una empresa pública.
Tienen un hijo de 12 años, estudia en escuela pública.
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de  mercadería como: carne, queso, huevos, etc.
Su sueño es incrementar su negocio y ponerse un local mas grande.
texts.en:
Noemí is 53 years old and lives in a suburban area called Durán. She is a woman with aspirations to grow her business. Noemí started selling food five years ago. Her business is located in front of her home and she sells green tortillas, coffee, and other items.

Noemí chose this business because she possesses the art of cooking in her hands. Therefore, she elected to set up a food stall. Noemí operates her business alone, but sometimes her husband is with her. Her schedule is from 8am to midnight, Monday through Sunday. Noemí is married and her husband works for a public company. They have a 12-year-old son who attends public school.

She is requesting a loan to buy supplies such as meat, cheese, eggs, and other items. Her dream is to increase her business so that she can have a larger location.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as meat, cheese, eggs, and other items.

loans.name: Sandra Carolina

texts.es:
La señora Sandra tiene 26 años y vive en la aldea de Quimistan. Junto con su esposo Milton, tienen dos hijos, uno de 8 y el otro de 1 año de edad. Milton trabaja de operador en una maquila. 

Sandra decidió convertirse en micro-empresaria debido a la necesidad de aumentar el ingreso familiar y obtener una mejor calidad de vida. Inició un negocio de venta de ropa usada con un pequeño ahorro que tenía y con el apoyo de su esposo. Sin embargo, había mucha competencia en este sector y doña Sandra cambió su actividad a la elaboración de papitas y chicharrones para poder sacar más ganancias. Solicitó un préstamo anterior para invertir en el negocio y logró aumentar las ventas y ganar mejores ganancias. Ella trabaja duro todo el día elaborando y vendiendo su producto. 

Con este préstamo actual de L10,000, Sandra comprará papitas y chicharrones para la venta. Ella espera seguir trabajando en su negocio para seguir apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra is 26 years old, and she lives in the village of Quimistan.  She lives with her husband, Milton, and their two children, ages eight and one.  Milton works in a factory.

Sandra decided to become a small businesswoman due to the necessity of increasing the family income and obtaining a better quality of life.  She started a business, selling used clothes, with a little savings that she had and with her husband’s support.  However, there was a lot of competition in this area, and Sandra changed her business activity to making potato chips and “chicharrones” (fried pork rinds).  She did this in order to be able to get more income.

She previously requested a loan to invest in the business.  She managed to increase sales and to get better income.  She works hard all day making and selling her product.

Sandra will use this loan for 10,000 lempiras to buy potato chips and chicharrones to sell.  She hopes to continue working in her business in order to continue supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy potato chips and chicharrones.

loans.name: Las Luchadoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se formó con 11 amigas y vecinas D. la ciudad D. Santaní. Ellas tienen el objetivo D. trabajar juntas y por medio D. ese trabajo salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias e hijos, dándoles un estilo D. vida digno y decoroso.
Maria trabaja en la cría y venta D. cerdos, trabajo que le ayuda a mantener a su familia. Comenta que tiene una buena cantidad D. animales, los cuales cría y luego venD.. Dice que tiene buena clientela y que gracias a eso tiene buenos ingresos por lo que le gustaría poder seguir con su microempresa. Ella se define como una mujer trabajadora, luchadora y emprendedora, ya que su trabajo no es nada fácil.
Ella solicita la ayuda D. la fundación y D. Kiva para la compra D. cerdos pequeños para la cría y posterior venta.  Agradece a la fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, pues el crédito le será D. mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
This group consists of 11 friends and neighbors in the city of Santaní.  Their goal is to work together and by means of that work get ahead and help their families and children, giving them a dignified and proper lifestyle.

Maria works raising and selling animals, a job that helps support her family.  She says that she has a lot of animals which she raises and then sells.  She says that she has good customers and that, thanks to this, she has good earnings.  That’s why she would like to be able to continue with this microenterprise.  

She views herself as a hardworking, fighting, and enterprising woman since there is nothing easy about her job.  She is applying for help from the foundation and Kiva in order to purchase animals to raise and later sell.  She is thankful to the foundation for the opportunity that this gives her since the loan will be a big help.

loans.use: to buy small bigs to raise and then sell.

loans.name: Shamshad's Group

texts.en:
Shamshad is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She doesn’t have any technical skills to financially contribute to the family but she plays her role very well by excellently managing her household expenses. 

She is the mother of a son and a daughter. Both of them left their education after matriculation (final examination) and started work. Her son operates an auto workshop. Her daughter operates a beauty salon and is an expert in bridal makeup; her clients are very satisfied with her services.

Shamshad has applied for a loan from KIVA partner Asasah for the further improvement of her son’s auto workshop business. With the loan investment, he will purchase latest repairing tools and spare parts to offer better quality services to his clients and increase his profits. He is very experienced in his business and has been operating it for the past many years. Shamshad is confident that her son will successfully be able to improve his business after this investment and she will be able to collect some dowry with increased profits for her daughter’s marriage in the near future.

loans.use: To buy repairing tools and spare parts for her son's auto workshop business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy school supplies and Christmas products.

loans.name: Eduard

texts.ru:
Эдуард – из Ивано-Франковска. Он работает на дому, предоставляя видеоуслуги, а именно видеосъемку, монтаж роликов и т.п. У Эдуарда огромный опыт работы на нескольких телестудиях. Он уже в этом бизнесе 11 лет. Отзывы о его работы – положительные – и со стороны клиентов, и со стороны специалистов. На данный момент его чистая прибыль составляет 3 000 гривен. 

Эдуард получает много заказов, но ему часто приходится отказывать потенциальным клиентам, так как он не может выполнить достаточно качественные видеоролики на имеющемся у него на данный момент оборудовании. Поэтому Эдуард планирует на полученные от КИВА средства приобрести профессиональную видеокамеру Panasonic HDC-MDH-1. Она ему необходима для записи видеороликов высокого качества. Имея эту профессиональную видеокамеру, Эдуард сможет не терять хорошие заказы, тем самым принося дополнительный доход в свою семью и дальше развивая свой бизнес. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en: Eduard is from Ivano-Frankivsk. He works from home, providing video services, such as making videos, editing clips etc... Eduard has extensive experience working in several  TV studios. He has been in this business for 11 years. He has received positive reviews for his work, both from customers and from experts in the field.  His current net profit is 3,000 hryvnia.   Eduard receives a lot of orders, but he often has to turn down potential customers because he cannot make high-quality videos with the equipment he owns at the moment.  With the funds that he will receive from Kiva, Eduard is planning to purchase a professional Panasonic HDC-MDH-1 camcorder which he needs to make high-quality videos.  With this professional camcorder, Eduard will no longer lose good orders.  He will also bring additional income to his family and further develop his business.

loans.use: Purchase a professional Panasonic HDC-MDH-1 camcorder.

loans.name: Thinh

texts.en: Mrs. Thinh is taking out loan for her daughter,student Nhung. Since she was a child, Nhung has wanted to be a nurse to care for the poor people in her community. Currently, she is studying at a medical treatment college. The course lasts three years; she will graduate in 2014. She hopes that she can work for a  local hospital near her house after graduation. Currently, she is studying hard to absorb knowledge. Her goal is to be a professional nurse in two years. Currently, she needs a loan of 14,580,000 VND to pay for tuition fees and to buy books and other supplies.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees and to buy books and other supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seasonal fruit to sell.

loans.name: Tuyen

texts.en: Ms Tuyen is 31 years old with 2 children who are at Primary school. Being a farmer,she grows rice and raises chickens. This activities started for long times. Participating in our program in 2005, she has used loans effectively in expanding her cultivation  and raising. For new loan cycle, she  requires  a loan of 8,502,000 Vietnam dong to buy food for chickens

loans.use: to buy food for chickens

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a 50-year-old widow who is a mother of four children. She lives in Idon, Irbid, Jordan.

Aisha is looking to have a loan of 500 JOD so she can improve her project by buying more material to make accessories. She will buy more beads and strings to make accessories.

loans.use: to buy beads and string to make accessories

loans.name: Julius  Ogutu

texts.en:
Julius was born in  Homa Bay District County, He is married with children and is engaged in retail small scale business. Julius says at his age of 55 he wants to make a difference in his community by supporting community health outreach programme run by a Community Based Organization CBO in his county. 

He has committed to spend most of the time with the CHW counseling the youth on reproductive health issues. Julius is happy to own his own motorcycle and would like to make a difference in his community by supporting the community health work  He  will support  the CHW undertake his normal routine once a week by providing transportation for visits to patients, and other hygiene camps. 

Julius will also use the income generated from his motorcycle taxi business to support his family he plans to buy another motorcycle and support two CHWs in 12 months time.

loans.use: To buy Motorcycle to Support Community Health Work and Livelihoods

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita is a loving mother of her three children.Meanwhile,two of them had settled for marriage and the other one is still studying.Anita is a rolling vendor within her local community.Her husband is a farmer and at the same times a tricycle driver.Piggery has been Anita's first business involvement.She and her husband still working hard for their future emergency purposes.They don’t want to ask money or depend on their children help because they have their own families. Anita wants to generate her own money that's why she keeps on selling fish,vegetable and meat within her village.With her aim to have stable source of income,she is asking for additional capital of PHP50,000.She will invest this amount in buying fish,vegetable and meat to sell.She knows that this amount will help her much in running her food vending business and in sustaining her family basic necessities.

loans.use: to buy fish,vegetable and meat for her food vending business

loans.name: Laureen

texts.en:
I am in a group of 25 widows who have been contracted to supply fertilized eggs to a hatching project in Ugunja. If we succesfully supply the eggs, we will be loaned chicks to rear and supply eggs to the same project.

The loan will be used to purchase five fowls: 1 cock and 4 hens. This will enable me to supply fertilized eggs to the hatching project after 21 days at a cost of 0.45 USD per day. Apart from supplyings eggs, fertilised eggs are recommended for people living with HIV /AIDS and all of the group members are living positively.  This loan will ensure that I meet my basic needs.

loans.use: To purchase five fowls.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.en:
Ivan has a store in the small town of Baba where he sells all kinds of snacks and beverages. He also makes different types of fast foods to sell to the people of the town. This loan will allow him to fix up his store. He is hoping to make the storefront more attractive to clients by putting in a gate and also by buying a glass display case. He used to be a farm worker, but decided to move to town after suffering through a bad crop year. He still has some land with some family members, but he would prefer to invest the money in his small store.

Communal Banking in Baba

This borrower is part of the newest and largest Communal Bank in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Centro Agricola de Baba Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in the county of Baba in rural Ecuador. Their association works cooperatively to cultivate rice and commercialize the product after it has grown. As an association, Centro Agricola helps the farmers by providing access to machinery and training services. The farmers from Centro Agricola have received special instruction on financial responsibility and accounting from Codemicro, an organization that specializes in training programs geared towards the rural sector.

The members of Centro Agricola de Baba will use the micro-loans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others' guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Centro Agricola de Baba Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many micro-finance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about Santa Lucia compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program.

Economy of Baba

The people of Baba have been organized since the days of Gran Colombia when Ecuador was yet to be a country. The area has always been popular because of the extremely productive lands that gave way to cultivation of cacao for decades. Now Baba is a county in the province of Los Rios in the coastal region of Ecuador. For most of the latter part of the 20th Century it was a cacao and banana-producing sector. Most of the surrounding areas of Baba in Los Rios are owned by large multinational companies such as Dole, but Baba is a sector characterized by small and informal farms.

Rice production has now turned into the main economic activity of the sector as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Cacao is still very popular in the area, but because of the long cultivation cycle people prefer to invest in rice. The lands in Baba are very fertile though, and most farmers in the sector often grow other crops, such as plantains and soybeans as secondary sources of income. Many farmers also keep livestock as emergency sources of food and income, commonly resorting to selling a chicken or pig if they are in need of cash.

Rice Farming in Baba

Most of the people in the Baba area are small farmers. They produce about 80 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds, plowing and leveling the lands. This is the most difficult part for the farmers in Baba, who often lack the necessary machinery to properly plow the lands for rice production. After appropriately preparing the lands, the farmers fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water-intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them gather their production.

Access to Credit

One of the biggest struggles in the area has been the lack of credit due to the absence of any type of financial institution. Because people do not count on formal financial finance, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also lack skills and knowledge to commercialize their products and pay fair prices for their crops.

Risks

The largest risk in the sector is due to absence of watering systems. Although Baba is in the province “Los Rios” (the rivers) there is severe problem with access to water. The lack of infrastructure in the sector does not allow the small farmers to benefit from the presence of the many rivers in the area. If the winter season is too dry, it is likely that the lands will not be sufficiently fertile for rice production in the summer. On the other hand, if there is too much rain, there are not any drainage systems to prevent flooding and the crops are often ruined. Generally speaking though, Baba is a very productive sector where the lands yield all types of crops including rice, cacao, corn, watermelons, plantains, and soybeans.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will mostly be used to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. Many clients will use the capital towards renting machinery and equipment necessary to effectively work and prepare the fields. Clients also typically use a part of the loan to buy livestock in order to raise and have as reserves. The loan repayment schedule is different from the typical micro-entrepreneur because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures. Mifex asks our rural clients only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Invest in products for his store and physical improvements to the shop

loans.name: Semendar

texts.en: N. Semendar lives and runs his small business in Saatli. He has one cow. His family consists of 4 children. To feed such a big family he needs one more cow and a calf. Therefore, to achieve better living conditions for his family, he has applied for a loan of 1200USD.

loans.use: To purchase 1 cow and 1 calf

loans.name: Sin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sin S. is 45 years old and mother to one child, who is employed by a nearby garment factory. She owns a stall selling porridge to the people in her community, while her husband is self-employed as a tuk tuk (a passenger cart attached to a motorcycle) driver.
Together, Sin S. and her husband can typically make up to $20 each day. They will use this loan to purchase some equipment for their stall and a motorbike for transportation.

loans.use: To purchase some equipment for her stall and a motorcycle for her family's transportation.

loans.name: Iokapeta

texts.en: “…I believed that it is a very fast and easy business to run, and I can use my knowledge from school in calculating my profits...” That’s what Iokapeta said on her business interview. She is a young lady of twenty four years of age who just finished school, and she is currently running a bingo business. Her first loan of $300 was used to buy the start-up supplies, and to set up the prize structure of the games. She is very interested in it because she knows how to calculate her expenses and her profits, which was her major in school and she wants to apply it to her work. She wishes that her next loan will be used to improve and maintain her business. Iokapeta is very happy with the SPBD program.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for her Bingo business

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
María is a woman who works hard to succeed and do her best. Thanks to her persistence she has made progress that has filled her with satisfaction. Today she has grand aspirations in mind, that her small children will have a prominent future. Five years ago María’s siblings supported her and encouraged her to open in her house a garment workshop, they taught her this noble trade, and today she works in the most efficient manner. With time and the quality works that she produces, she has acquired many tools that permit her to produce the orders in the greatest quantity and in a very rapid manner, moving what she produces daily through continuous trips to other cities. Later she returns with profit to obtain premium materials in order to continue the manufacture of garments that are in the highest demand. At the present time she aspires to grow her workshop in order to continue producing profits not only for her but also for young people. She wishes to equip her workshop with a small number of semi-industrial overlockers so that she can fulfill her wishes. We support María in continuing on the road to victory.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Huddleston, Princeton University Language Project.

María, es una mujer que se esfuerza por seguir adelante y dar de ella lo mejor; su empeño la ha ayudado a conseguir logros que la llenan de satisfacción y hoy tiene grandes aspiraciones en mente para que sus pequeños hijos tengan un futuro prominente.Hace cinco años los hermanos de Maria la apoyaron y la animaron a aperturar en su casa un taller de confecciones de prendas de vestir, le enseñaron este noble oficio y hoy se desempeña de la manera más eficiente y con el tiempo y los trabajos de calidad que produce ha adquirido muchas herramientas que le permiten producir los pedidos en mayor cantidad y de manera muy rápida; trasladando lo que produce diariamente mediante viajes continuos a otras ciudades y luego regresa con la ganancia para obtener materia prima para continuar con la fabricación de las prendas de mayor demanda.En la actualidad tiene muchas aspiraciones de acrecentar su taller para seguir produciendo beneficios no sólo para ella sino también para más jóvenes. Desea equipar su taller con un pequeño número de remalladotas semi industriales para que pueda cumplir sus deseos.Apoyemos a Maria a continuar por el camino del triunfo.

loans.use: Purchase of a small number of semi-industrial overlockers in order to increase her production and the number of employees in her small workshop.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary owns the Sunrise Medical Service, a dispensary of over-the-counter pharmaceuticals. She has operated the dispensary for 9 years and been a member of her lending group for the past four years. She is 50 years old, widowed, and looks after her own 5 children as well as 3 orphans.

Her dream is to one day open a larger clinic where she can tend to people who are ill and to open a nursing home. She is a very caring, compassionate and hardworking individual. People in this business often do it out of a labor or love. With her loan she plans to purchase more over-the-counter medicines for her clients.

loans.use: Mary plans to use her loan to purchase more over-the-counter medicines for her clients.

loans.name: Peculiar

texts.en: Peculiar O. is married with 4 children, is 42 years old and comes from Ajamgbadi in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells foodstuffs and has been in her business since 2003. She need a loan of $450 to enable her buy more foodstuffs for sale.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs

loans.name: Muguluka West B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is K. Rebecca. She is currently in the business of operating a hotel and is requesting a loan to purchase more hotel equipment. K. is 38 years old and is divorced. She has 4 children ranging from age 6 to 18 and her children go to school. Each week, K. makes approximately UGX 31000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to invest more in her business. K. has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 350000 in order to add to her business and the loan was paid back on time.

K. is joined in her small group by Doreen K., Suzan M., Ruth N., and Zirab M.. Doreen K. has a business selling sugar wax and wants to boost business. Suzan M. is currently operating a retail shop business and wants a loan to increase stock. Ruth N. operates a business of used clothing sales and wants to add capital. Zirab M. is currently a bar attendant and is requesting a loan to start another business.

loans.use: To add to hotel business and improve it

loans.name: Reveca's Group

texts.es:
Dorotea, Reveca, and Gertrudes have belonged to the communal bank Tarpuy, which means "Sowing" in Quechua, for 8 months, 1 year, and 1 year respectively.

Dorotea is married, 52 years old and has 6 children, 4 of whom still live with her. Dorotea has a store where she sells groceries, vegetables, fruit. In addition, Dorotea sells salchipollo (traditional Peruvian dish based on roasted chicken) and hamburgers outsiD. of her home.

Reveca is married, 32 years old, and has 4 children. Reveca grows flowers in her land located in San Miguel D. Ayacucho, 20 minutes way from Ayacucho, and sells them to flower shops wholesale.

Gertrudes is married, 38 years old, and has 5 children. She lives in the community of Satica, district Pampa Cangallo where she has a general store. In addition, Gertrudes buys cheeses in her hometown and sells them wholesale at the markets of the city of Ayacucho.

Dorotea, Reveca, and Gertrudes need loans for 600 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles, money which will be invested buying sugar, rice, oil, soap, cheese, and products to cure flower pests.

Dorotea, Reveca, and Gertrudes dream that their children will become professionals, their business grows, and to build a house in the city of Ayacucho.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer

Dorotea, Reveca y Gertrudes pertenecen al Banco Comunal Tarpuy que significa “Siembra” en quechua hace 8 meses, 1 año, 1 año respectivamente.

Dorotea es casada, tiene 52 años y 6 hijos D. los cuales 4 viven con ella, Dorotea tiene una tienda donD. venD. abarrotes, verduras, frutas. Además Dorotea por las noches venD. salchipollo y hamburguesas en la puerta D. su casa.

Por otro lado Reveca es casada, tiene 32 años y 4 hijos, Reveca se dedica al cultivo D. flores en sus terrenos ubicados en San Miguel D. Ayacucho a 20 minutos D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho, sus ventas lo realiza a las florerías al por mayor.

Mientras que Gertrudes es casada, tiene 38 años y 5 hijos, Gertrudes vive en la comunidad D. Satica, distrito D. Pampa Cangallo donD. tiene una tienda surtida D. abarrotes. Además Gertrudes compra quesos en su pueblo y lo venD. al por mayor en los mercados D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

Dorotea, Reveca y Gertrudes necesitan préstamos D. 600 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. azúcar, arroz, aceite, jabón, queso y remedios para controlar las enfermedades D. las flores.

Los sueños D. Dorotea, Reveca y Gertrudes son que sus hijos sean profesionales, su negocio sea más granD. y construir su casa en la ciudad D. Ayacucho.

loans.use: Dorotea, Reveca, and Gertrudes need loans for 600 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles, money which will be invested buying sugar, rice, oil, soap, cheese, and products to cure flower pests. (Dorotea, Rebeca y Gertrudes necesitan préstamos de 600 soles, 600 soles, 1000 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, arroz, aceite, jabón, queso y remedios para controlar las enfermedades de las flores.)

loans.name: Nasreen's Group

texts.en: My name is Nasreen K.. I am married and mother of five: four boys and one girl. Three of my sons are currently working while one boy and one girl attend school. I sell clothing to people in my neighborhood. I buy from the clothing from a market in Faisalabad, a mid size city in Pakistan. My loan will allow me to buy summer suiting in bulk. I have been joined in my loan group by Shahnaz B. (who wants to buy tires for her tire store), Saima S. (who will buy auto spare parts), Talat Y. (who wants to expand her telephone and mobile calling card business), and Nasreen K. (who will buy crockery for her husband's business).

loans.use: to expand clothing sales

loans.name: Koffi Agouda

texts.fr:
Mr. Koffi Agouda K. was born April 20, 1984 and is single. His business consists of dying traditional African Bazin cloth. He started this business in 2000 in the Tokoin neighborhood in Lomé. His potential customers include dressmakers and those who resell cloth. He would like to sell his cloth on the international market, and after quickly repaying his first loan, he is requesting this second one to purchase 12 boxes of dye in various colors.

Translated from French by Kristina Jackson, Kiva Volunteer.

Né le 20 avril 1984, Monsieur K. Koffi Agouda est célibataire. Il a pour activité principale la teinture de pagne bazin. Commencé depuis l’année 2000, il exerce cette activité dans le quartier de Tokoin à Lomé. Il a pour clients potentiels, les revendeuses de pagne et les couturiers. Il désire rendre son activité internationale et sollicite ce 2ème crédit après un prompt remboursement du premier pour acheter douze (12) boîtes de teinture de couleurs différentes.

loans.use: Purchase of 12 boxes of dye

loans.name: Ritha

texts.en: Mambo from Dar es Salaam, Tanzania! This is 36-year-old Ritha Mwema.  She is married, and has four children aged between 2 and 11. In 2007, Ritha  established her cosmetics business. Working 6 days a week, and 12 hours a day, she earns about US $170 every month from this business. Ritha requests a loan to purchase additional stock of  cosmetics so she can improve her sales. In the future, Ritha  plans to open another business to increase her income even more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of cosmetics.

loans.name: Darlin Del Socorro

texts.es:
In the town of Nagarote, which is part of the city of León, Darlin M. works very hard in her home business of raising pigs. She has been working at this for the past three years and she does it in order to maintain her humble one-room house.

Darlin is seeking support from Ceprodel, with the goal of obtaining credit with which to purchase pigs. It is for this reason that she has turned to the institution hoping that her loan will be approved. That way she will be able to keep up with the maintenance of her home. She has had three loans and paid them all back on time, according to the policies of the institution.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

En el municipio de Nagarote de la ciudad de León, la señora Darling M. se dedica muy esforzadamente a su negocio de crianza de cerdos en su propia casa de habitación. Se dedica a esta labor desde hace 3 años y hoy lo hace para mantener su humilde hogar de habitación que tanto necesita de su apoyo.

Hoy en día, la señora Darling busca el apoyo en Ceprodel con el propósito único de obtener un crédito para la compra de los cerdos. Es por esta razón que acude a la institución esperando que su crédito le sea otorgado y de esta manera salir adelante con el mantenimiento de su hogar de habitación en su sector. Actualmente ella posee un total de tres créditos habiéndolos cancelado todos en tiempo y forma de acuerdo a lo establecido en la institución.

loans.use: To buy pigs

loans.name: Gulnora

texts.en: Gulnora S. is 39 years old, married and has three children, all of whom are in school. Gulnora makes a living selling children's clothing in the local market. She started her business eight years ago, with some help from her husband, who provided start-up funds. Gradually, Gulnora's business has expanded. Because she is hard-working and polite by nature, she has managed to obtain a devoted clientel that is happy with the goods and services she provides, and her business generates a stable income for the family. Gulnora loves her children very much and wants all of them to be well-educated. This year her daughter finished secondary school, and Gulnora wants her to enter university. To be able to do that, Gulnora has applied for a loan of $600, which she will pay back in 12 months. She will use the loan to buy additional clothing and increase the range of items she has for sale. Gulnora is hoping for your support, and she deeply appreciates any assistance you may choose to give her.

loans.use: To buy additional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Thuok

texts.en:
Mrs. Thuok P. is a villager in Preak Thom Village in Kandal Province and she is a vegetable farmer. Since her field is too far from irrigation, she decided to ask for a loan to buy a pump in order to generate water to support her field.

Her husband, Mr. Chea Phat, is a construction worker who can make only a small income to support his family. Mrs. Thuok P. is 54 years old and the mother of seven children. Six of them are employed in different businesses, while the youngest one is attending school. Her husband is shown on the right in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a pump to generate water to support her field

loans.name: Emanuel Group

texts.es:
Hola nosotros somos el Grupo EMANUEL estamos ubicados en el Barrio Los Arcos de la ciudad de Danli, nosotros nos conocemos muy bien y siempre hemos trabajado juntos, somos muy unidos como si fueramos familiares.
el grupo se conforma de esta manera:)
Juan Elias G.; soy el coordinador de mi grupo, mi actividad principal es el transporte de pasajeros (Taxi No.81) cuento con muchos años de experiencia en este tipo de actividad. soy casado tengo una hija la que esta cursando primaria, gracias a los ingresos que recibo del taxi puedo cubrir con los gastos de mi familia, actualmente necesito comprar unos repuestos para arreglar mi vehiculo ya que es mi unica fuente de trabajo.  
Norma Iris C.: ella es comerciante se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, cuenta con una pequeña pulperia ubicada en su casa de habitacion, actividad que realiza hace 3 años, con los ingresos que le genera su negocio ella puede contribuir a los gastos del hogar, tiene 3 hijos los cuales dos de ellos estan estudiando, uno esta en secundaria y el otro esta en la universidad. 
Karla Suyapa T.: ella se dedica a la venta de chicharrones y chicharras las que distribuye en el mercado municipal, ella es casada y tiene 2 hijos, uno de 2 y el otro de 4 años de edad,  
actualmente todos necesitamos una inversion en nuestras fuentes de trabajo es por tal razon que estamos solicitando un credito para poder salir adelante con nuestros negocios y por consiguiente mejorar nuestra calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Hello. We are the EMANUEL Group, located in the Los Arcos neighborhood in the city of Danli. We know each other very well, and have always worked together. We are very united, as if we were related.

The group is comprised as follows:

Juan Elias G.. I am the coordinator of my group. My principal activity is passenger transportation (Taxi #81), and I have many years of experience with this type of occupation. I am married, and have a daughter in primary school. Thanks to the income which I receive from my taxi service, I can support my family’s household expenses. Currently, I need to buy some parts to repair my vehicle given that it is my only means of work.

Norma Iris C.: she is a merchant who dedicates herself to selling common household goods. She has a small grocery store which is located in her house. This is an activity which she has conducted for three years, and which provides the income to pay for her family’s living expenses. She has three children, two of whom are still in school – one in secondary school and one at the university.

Karla Suyapa T.: She is dedicated to the sale of chicharrones and chicharras (pork rinds) which she sells at the municipal market. She is married and has two children ages two and four.

Currently, we all need an infusion of capital to invest in our enterprises. This is the reason we are soliciting a loan, so we can get ahead with our expenses and concurrently improve our standard of living.


Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase parts for vehicle repairs and products to supply grocery store.

loans.name: Jaqueline Maritza

texts.es:
La señora Jaqueline Maritza tiene 31 años de edad, pertenece al Banco comunal Mujeres Emprendedoras II  y vive en la calle Pedro R. Gallo 278 balneario de Buenos Aires Norte del distrito de Víctor Larco provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad Perú.
Jaqueline terminó secundaria y continuó estudiando un ciclo de secretariado, pero no le gustaba y ya no continuó estudiando.
Tiene 2 hijos, un varón de 6 años y una niña de 12 años.
Empezó con un locutorio, pero no era rentable y cambió a vender hamburguesas, salchipollo y salchipapas. Vende en la puerta de su casa durante las noches.
Con el primer préstamo de 300 soles devueltos en 4 cuotas compró tarjetas para el locutorio.
Con este crédito de 500 soles que será cancelado en 4 cuotas invertirá en el actual negocio, comprará pollo, mayonesa, par y otros.
Su sueño es tener un local de venta ya no un carrito.
texts.en:
Jacqueline Maritza is 31 years old and belongs to the community bank "Women Entrepreneurs II". She lives at Pedro R. Gallo 278, North Buenos Aires neighborhood, Victor Larco district, Trujillo province, La Libertad department, Peru. Jacqueline graduated high school and continued to study to become a secretary, but she did not like it and did not complete the program. She has two children, a 6 year old boy and a 12 year old girl. She started a telephone booth, but it was not profitable so she began to sell hamburgers, chicken, and potatoes. She sells these items at her door step at night. With her first loan of 300 soles, repaid in 4 payments, she bought calling cards for her telephone booth. With this loan of 500 soles, to be repaid in 4 payments, she will invest in her current business and buy chicken, mayonnaise, and other items. Her dream is to have a small market, not a portable cart.

Translated from Spanish by Brittany Thatcher, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase condiments for sandwiches

loans.name: Khiev

texts.en: Mr. Khiev N., 30, is a rice farmer who lives in the Batchenhchean commune in Pursat Province. His wife, Mrs. Touch Sokhom, 25, is a local farmer.  She is a mother of two children, who are both still too young to attend primary school. They have both been farmers since 1990 and have much experience in this occupation.  They are widely known as skilled rice cultivators. Khiev requests a $400 loan to buy a buffalo to help plow his field.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: 2 scroll saws, 3 dozen, large padlocks, 1 dozen jeans, 1 dozen camouflage pants, and 1 dozen large files.

loans.name: Sadith

texts.es: Sadith vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos en su casa propia. Se dedica a prestar servicios de lavandería a toda persona que lo solicite, sus primeros clientes fueron sus vecinos quienes la fueron recomendando a otras personas y así creció su clientela, esta labor la viene ejerciendo desde hace 7 años en su propia casa con una lavadora automática y con varios lavatorios caseros, Sadith se esfuerza para que sus clientes se sientan satisfechos por su buena labor y le sigan confiando sus prendas. Además de trabajar independientemente tiene un contrato para lavar la ropa para un puesto de salud, y le va muy bien. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP, con el dinero solicitado quiere mandar a construir en su casa unos lavaderos de cemento para no seguir lavando en lavatorios de plástico.
texts.en:
Sadith lives in her own house with her husband and their two children. She earns her living by providing laundry services for anyone who needs them. Her first clients were her neighbors, and business grew as they recomended her to other people. She's been runninger her business in her own home for 7 years with one washing machine and a variety of makeshift washbasins. Sadith strives to satisfy her clients with quality work so they will continue to trust her with their garments. In addition to her individual clientele, she also has a laundry contract with a health clinic, which is going very well. This will be her 4th loan with MFP. She plans to use the money to have some cement sinks installed in her house so she doesn't have to keep using plastic washbasins.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build some cement sinks

loans.name: Khaiy

texts.en:
Khaiy S. is 50 years old. She lives with her husband in Bait district, Takeo province. She is a local teacher at state school and sometimes she buys and sells silk scarves to market-wholesaler at Phnom Penh city. On average, she makes a combined income around US$6 per day, while her husband earns about US$7 a day by working as construction foreman. This couple has six children, two of whom are employed and four who are in school.

Mrs. Khaiy is asking for a loan to purchase more scarves to sell at Phnom Penh.

loans.use: To purchase more scarves to sell.

loans.name: Neba Zipporah

texts.en:
Zipporah is a mother of five children who runs a sewing business, as well as selling beans and oil. She lives outside of GHAPE headquarters in Ntasen, where she also runs her business. She will use this loan to purchase sewing materials and foods such as conki beans, banket beans, palm oil, rice and fertilizer.

This is Zipporah’s fourth loan from GHAPE since she became a beneficiary in 2006. This loan would help bring more food to her community because she is closer to them than the market is. She believes that under these conditions her business will succeed.

Since her first loan, Zipporah has been able to buy a sewing machine and help pay for her children’s school fees. Now, with the profit from this loan, Zipporah intends to buy a plot of land. She appreciates receiving a loan from GHAPE, especially because it helps pay for things her family needs.

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase sewing materials and produce

loans.name: Muaau

texts.en: Muaau E., 35, is married with five children.  She has many years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the village people and the public one day per week. She has no previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala (~ 80 USD).  SPBD loans are Muaau’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her husband does all the work while she helps him with other tasks. The loan will be used purchase sacks of fertilizer and gromozones for the plantation.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer and gromozones

loans.name: Marcos Herminio

texts.es:
El señor Marcos R. se dedica a laborar vendiendo ambulantemente en el Mercado Mayoreo en la ciudad de Managua ofertando gafas, lentes y relojes dedicándose a esta actividad desde hace 15 años.

Actualmente requiere invertir en la compra de los productos para ofertarlos debido a que al estar en verano, las ventas de las gafas se aumenta porque muchas personas las adquieren para realizar sus visitas al mar. Es por esta razón que él ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de dichos productos y así proceder a su venta en el mercado Mayoreo.
texts.en:
Mr. Marcos R. works as a street vendor in the Mayoreo Market in the city of Managua. He has sold sunglasses, glasses and watches for 15 years. Now he needs to invest in buying more products to resell because in the summertime, many people need sunglasses when they go to the beach. For this reason he has turned to Ceprodel to ask for a loan to buy these products and continue to sell in the Mayoreo market.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Chong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying sunglasses

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet K. is a 45-year-old trader, who is married and has a child. Her son, Stephen K., is currently in senior high school and writing his final year examination. Her husband is a cocoa farmer and crop farmer. She sells yam tubers on a tabletop in the local market of Oda, in the eastern region of Ghana where she lives. She says that through this business, she has endeavored to support her child, who is almost finished with senior high school. She cooks some of the yams in stew, but her current challenge is finding enough funds to upgrade her inventory. Janet requests the loan to enable her to buy more yams and other vegetables to sell.  This will allow her business to grow and progress. She hopes to increase her savings to support her son's education and provide hope for his future. Janet belongs to the village bank called ‘Nkwa Nsuo,’ which means "living waters." She would be grateful for the assistance.

loans.use: To buy increased stock of yam tubers

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is a married mother of an 8-year-old child. She also cares for two additional dependents. Rehema has been a bites seller in the Kihesa neighborhood of Iringa for past three years. She belongs to Dodoma road C group loan (Group code 2030). She currently earns an average monthly profit of ~$100.Every day she works at her business for 12 hours. 

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and charcoal for her business. She is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

loans.use: To buy more wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar and charcoal for her business

loans.name: Maria Elva

texts.es:
La señora Maria Elva, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Violetas  II”, vive en el Jr. Nicaragua Cuadra 1, Barrio Santa Isabel, Distrito de Nueva Cajamarca, Provincia de Rioja, Departamento de San Martín. Es casada, tiene 52 años y 03 hijos todos  independientes.

Desde hace muchos años Maria Elva se dedica al lavado de ropa, en sus inicio lo hacia manualmente  pero sus usuarios  fueron  aumentando. dado  el servicio  de calidad que realizaba a sus clientes estos quedaban satisfechos, por lo que con el préstamo inicial de S/. 300.00 que obtuvo adquirió una lavadora eléctrica de segunda mano, pero esto tampoco fue suficiente porque entre sus clientes también ya cuenta con instituciones privadas que envían gran cantidad  de ropa para lavar, actualmente cuenta con otra lavadora digital que le es de muchísima ayuda.  

Uno de sus sueños y metas por lograr, es implementar una lavandería mas grande con lavadoras y secadoras industriales y así pueda expandir mas su cartera de clientes. 

Con el préstamo de S/ 2000.00, cancelará el costo  de su actual lavadora. Además comprara  detergente en cajas, jabón en barras y suavizantes en frascos  para así seguir dando un servicio de calidad.  

Maria Elva, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas de alcanzar y hacer realidad sus sueños. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Maria Elva belongs to the Community Bank "Las Violetas II". She lives in Jr. Nicaragua Cuadra 1, in the Santa Isabel region of the Cajamarca district, located in Rioja, San Martin. She is married, 52 years old and has 3 children, all of whom are independent.

For the past many years Maria Elva has been providing laundry services. When she just started she washed clothes by hand but her customers soon started to multiply. Given the high quality of service she provides her clients were also very satisfied. With the first loan of S/.300 nuevos soles she purchased a second-hand washing machine. But this soon was not enough either because she soon started providing her services to private organizations that sent her large volumes of washing to do. Currently she has a digital washing machine that has been enormous help to her.

One of her dreams and a goal to strive for is the establishment of a larger laundry shop, set up with industrial washers and dryers, so that she might expand her roster of clients.

With the requested loan of S/2000 she will completely pay off the washer she currently has. And she will purchase boxes of detergent and fabric softener, to keep up the level of service she has been providing.

Maria Elva feels like a very accomplished woman, and now more than ever she has the drive to make her dreams a reality. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) to having helped her start up her business, as it has been done for so many other women entrepreneurs.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To complete payment on a washer and to purchase laundry products (soaps and detergents).

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
La señora Modesta pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Poderosas D. Santa Rosa”  que esta ubicado en el distrito D. Azangaro, Provincia D. Azangaro, Departamento D. Puno, ella tiene 89 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, es madre D. 02 hijos y no tiene estudios,  vive en el Barrio Revolución.

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 02 años, su primer préstamo fue D. S/. 500.00 nuevos soles el cual utilizó para la compra D. abarrotes. 

Con este préstamo D. S/. 1000.00 Nuevos soles, comprará arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos, conservas, etc.

Su deseo es seguir trabajando, mientras tenga fuerzas.

A ella le gustan los ahorros, los encuentros del Banco Comunal.
texts.en:
Modesta belongs to the Las Poderosas D. Santa Rosa Community Bank, which is located in the Azangaro district, Azangaro province, Puno department. She is 89, married, and she has two children. She did not go to school. She lives in the Revolución neighborhood. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years. Her first loan was for 500 PEN, which she used to buy groceries. With this loan for 1,000 PEN, she will buy rice, sugar, milk, noodles, and canned goods, etc. Her wish is to keep working while she has the strength. She likes her community bank’s savings and the meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sugar, milk, noodles, and canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Bethy

texts.es: Bethy tiene 34 años, vive con sus 2 hijos de 12 y 8 años en su casa propia. Desde hace 5 años produce papa y granos, también cría ganado vacuno, ella vende sus toros cuando están grandes y con buen peso y con luego compra pequeños para volver a criar. Por otro lado, las cosechas que tiene, las vende en el mercado principal de su ciudad los días miércoles y domingo, cuando es la feria comercial, y cada 2 meses aproximadamente vende sus animales en la feria ganadera. Durante estos años le han resultado beneficiosos sus negocios por lo que se anima a continuar con este esfuerzo en bienestar de la educación de sus hijos menores. Esta es la 12ava vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, es admirable su perseverancia, ya que es una de las socias más antiguas de su grupo. Para esta ocasión sigue renovando su compromiso y actitud positiva. El dinero que viene solicitando será destinado a la compra de más abono orgánico (guano de animales) y fertilizantes para preparar sus tierras de cultivo.
texts.en:
Bethy is 34 years old, and lives in a house she owns with her 2 children who are 12 and 8 years old. For 5 years, she has dedicated herself to farming potatoes and grains as well as raising livestock. She sells her bulls when they are grown and heavy, using those proceeds to buy young ones to raise. On the other hand, she sells her harvests on Wednesdays and Sundays at the commercial market of her city. Additionally, every 2 months approximately she sells her animals at the cattle market. Her businesses have greatly helped her over these past years, which is why she is enthusiastic to continue in her efforts for the benefit of her children’s educations. This is the 12th time that she has credit with MFP, and she is admirable in her perseverance as she is one of the oldest members of the group. For this loan, she continues to renew her commitment and positive attitude. The funds she is requesting will be destined for the purchase of more organic fertilizers (animal guano) for her farmlands.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Benkadi 3  De (Benkadi B Tingolé) Group

texts.fr:
Les deux  membres du groupe BENKADI 3 de l’association BENKADI B sont toutes des femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 41,  5 enfants et  vivant (toutes les deux) dans des familles polygames à TINGOLE  un chef lieu de commune de la sous préfecture de FANA, 2ème région administrative de la république du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but d’avoir un soutien financier pour la réalisation de leurs activités hivernales. Leurs activités sont axées sur la culture du sorgho et de l’arachide. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt avec l’institution. Tous les prêts précédents ont été remboursés à temps.
Ce nouveau prêt sera utilisé pour  acheter, de l’engrais, de l’herbicide, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 4 hectares.
Après la récolte, une partie de leur production est auto consommée et l’autre partie est vendue, sur place au village, dans le marché de Marka-Coungo et à Fana, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 25 000FCFA après la campagne.
texts.en:
The two members of the group BENKADI 3 of the association BENKADI B are both married women with an average age of 41 years old and 5 children. Both are in polygamous marriages and live in Tingole, the head town of a region within the FANA prefecture, the second administrative region of the Mali republic. Both work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order get financial support for their winter labors. Their primary work is the cultivation of sorgho and peanuts. This is their fifth loan through the institution, and all priors loans were fully repaid on time. This new loan will be used to buy fertilizer, pesticides, basic agriculture tools and to pay the hoeing and labor fees to cultivate 4 hectares. After the harvest, part of their crop is consumed by the members of the group and the rest is sold from their home, in the village, and at the Marka-Coungo and Fana markets to both male and female customers. They expect to make an average profit of 25 000 FCFA after the harvest and sale of their crops.

Translated from French by Chloe Mark Translator, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, fertilizer, pesticides, hoeing and basic tools

loans.name: Rhoda

texts.en: Rhoda is 32 years old and married with 2 children. She has a salon and also sells cosmetics.
