Manuela is originally from the city of Riobamba.  She arrived in Cuenca 15 years ago, since she married.  She’s a seasonal fruit vendor.

She will use the loan to buy fruit to stay in business.  She is in her 4th loan with the communal bank where she has made many friends with whom she shares at each meeting.  Her dream is to own a house.

loans.use: To buy fruit.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es:
Don Concepción tiene 53 años de edad, reside en Cacaopera departamento de Morazán, vive con su esposa doña María y cuatro hijos Deysi de 16 años, Marina de 15, Miguel de 10 y Vilma de 8 años de edad, todos dependen económicamente de él.
Don Concepción se dedica al cultivo de la caña de azúcar, ganado y cerdos, inicio hace 12 años a trabajar en sus propias parcelas en un horario de 6:00am a 4:00pm, su dificultad es el traslado de la producción para el mercado, ya que debe cargar el producto y cruzar un rio, para llegar al transporte. Él está solicitando un préstamo para el proceso de molienda, ya que este trabajo se hace con varios empleados, es un trabajo fuerte que requiere desvelos pues deben triturar toda la caña para transformarla en miel y dulce de panela.
Este dinero del préstamo le ayudara para pagar empleados y realizar el trabajo, incrementando la producción y continuando en el comercio de miel y dulce, aunque siempre tiene riesgos pues la zona donde vive muchos agricultores hacen esta misma actividad, lo que dificulta vender rápidamente los productos.
Él aspira el reconocimiento de nuevos mercados, trasladar su producción a otras zonas y crecer como microempresario.
texts.en:
Don Concepción is 53 years old, he lives in Cacaopera in the department of Morazán with his wife Doña María and four children, Deysi, 16 years old, Marina, 15 years old, Miguel is 10 and Vilma is 8 years old. They are all economically dependent on him. 

Don Concepción grows sugar cane and raises cows and pigs. He began working his own plots of land twelve years ago, working from 6:00am until 4:00pm. A difficulty is transporting the production to the market because he has to carry his products accross a river to get to transportation. He is seeking a loan to cover the cost of milling the sugar cane and the work requires the help of a number of employees. It is hard work that requires a lot of labor to crush the cane to produce honey and brown sugar. 

The loan will help him to pay employees to complete the work, to increase production and to continue selling honey and sugar. While there are always risks in the area where he lives because many farmers perform the same work, the challenge is to sell his products quickly. 

He hopes to get to know new markets and to bring his products to new areas and to grow as a microbusiness.

loans.use: To cover the cost of milling sugar cane.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen K. is 26 years old.  She lives in the province of Siem Reap and earns a living by selling ice blocks. Yen K. is married to Tim Sarith, age 25, who helps her in the same business. They are blessed with four children, three of whom are attending school while one is still too young.

Yen K. is having financial difficulty with rebuilding her old house.   She is lacking the funds needed to continue with the building process. Yen K. has decided to request a loan from Kiva to buy additional timber planks to continue building her house.

loans.use: buy the timber needed to finish rebuilding her house

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 31 years old and married with two children.  For four years, he has been operating an automotive spare parts shop.  He gained experience for running the business when he was previously employed in an automotive spare parts shop.  

Through Faulu Kenya, he has been economically empowered.   He hopes to expand his shop within five years.  He needs 20,000 Kes to buy synchronizer rings.

loans.use: to buy synchronizer rings

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes, age 40, has operated a general store business for about one year. Her store offers such items as rice, sugar, soap, cooking oil, water, juice, and cosmetics. She and her husband have no children but support one dependent relative. Her business is open from 6 a.m. until 8 p.m. every day.

Agnes has requested a loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more products to offer for sale in her store. With the profits, she plans to save money for her future and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more products to offer for sale in her store

loans.name: Yelna Isabel

texts.es: La señora Yelna, tiene la edad de 44 años , habita en el municipio de la concepción , junto a su esposo el cual trabaja como comerciante de frutas y verduras para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar , ellos tienen cinco hijos todos ya independientes , los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida y poder compra un camioneta para no tener que estar pagando transporte cada vez que sale la producción y se tiene que llevar al mercado para realizar su venta de piña , doña Yelna desde hace quince años se dedica al cultivo de piña , la mayor afectación son las cenizas del volcán que le ocasiona  pérdidas  ya que esta quema las plantas de piña por falta de exfoliación , fertilizantes e insumos. El financiamiento lo quiere para la compra de fertilizantes e insumos para poder realizar aplicación al cultivo.
texts.en:
Sra. Yelna is 44 years old and resides in the town of Concepción.  She and her husband work together as fruit and vegetable merchants in order to cover their household expenses.  They have five children, all of whom are independent.  

Her plans for her family are to improve the living conditions and to buy a truck so that she does not have to pay transportation costs for each harvest.  Yelna transports pineapples to the market so that she can sell them.  

Doña Yelna has been cultivating pineapple for fifteen years.  The greatest challenge she faces is dealing with ash from a volcano that has resulted in occasional crop loss.  The chemicals from the volcanic ash cause the leaves of her pineapple plants to fall off.  

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy fertilizers and supplies that she needs to maintain her crops.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and supplies to maintain her pineapple crop.

loans.name: Yesenia Paulina

texts.es:
En la reunión del banco comunal conocimos a la señora Yesenia que pertenece al banco comunal María Auxiliadora de la Asociación Arariwa que cada treinta días se reúnen con sus compañeras en la casa de una de las socias en el distrito de San Jerónimo de la ciudad del Cusco. Yesenia nació en el Cusco (Perú), tiene 20 años edad y vive en la ciudad del Cusco, ella está feliz porque están sacando adelante a su único hijo. (Cusco se caracteriza por tener hermosos paisajes y por ser una zona turística y comercio).

Yesenia nos cuenta que se dedica a la venta de cosméticos de Esika y Oriflame. Desde hace varios años que ella se dedica  a este negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias al esfuerzo que pone en su trabajo. En esta oportunidad la socia necesita el préstamo para comprar productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes y colonias para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, talcos, loción de cuerpo, desodorantes, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas, asimismo zapatos y sandalias.
texts.en:
During the communal bank’s meeting we met Yesenia, who is a member of Asociación Arariwa’s “María Auxiliadora” communal bank, and who meets with her fellow members every thirty day in the house of one of the members in Cusco’s San Jerónimo neighborhood.  

Yesenia was born in Cusco, Perú.  She is 20 years old and lives in Cusco.  She is happy because she is successfully raising her only son.  (Cusco is noted for having beautiful scenic spots and for being a center of tourism and commerce).

Yesenia tells us that she’s been selling Esika and Oriflame cosmetics for several years; she’s done very well thanks to the effort she puts into her work.

On this occasion she needs a loan to buy beauty products to stock her business like: women’s and men’s perfume and cologne, creams, compact powder, talc, body lotion, deodorant, lipstick, nail polish as well as shoes and sandals.

loans.use: to buy beauty supplies.

loans.name: Mengly

texts.en:
Mengly, 57 years old, is a goldsmith, and his income is $15 per day. His wife takes care of their children at home. They have two children who are  working as construction workers. 

Every month, he has to spend $90 on food, $10 on electricity, and $15 for other expenses. 

He would like to request a loan of $700 to buy a motorbike for his son to go to work. He plans to repair his shop and house to look better than now if he has enough money.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for his son to go to work.

loans.name: Duhorimbere Ii Group

texts.fr:
Louise est une commerçante âgée de 31ans qui habite au Quartier Gatumba en Mairie de Bujumbura. Elle  fait le commerce de riz  depuis 6ans. C’est un métier qu’elle commence juste après sa sortie d’école en tant qu’élève. C’est une mère célibataire avec 2 enfants âgés de 13ans et 11ans qui étudient. Elle est détentrice du Diplôme de fin des études secondaires en sciences de l’éducation.

 Son crédit de 170,000francs burundais va contribuer à augmenter son capital et agrandir la quantité de riz à vendre afin de réaliser de grands bénéfices. 

Elle est membre  du groupe  Communautaire« DUHORIMBERE II».
texts.en:
Louise is a 31-year-old retailer who lives in Gatumba neighborhood in the Mairie district of Bujumbura. She has been selling rice for six years. This is a trade she took up right after leaving school. She is a single mother of two children, aged 13 and 11, who are enrolled in school. She has a secondary school Leaving Certificate in education. 

Her loan of 170,000 Burundi francs will contribute to growing her working capital and thus the quantity of rice she can stock in order to make more profit. 

She is a member of the community group « DUHORIMBERE II».

loans.use: to grow her working capital so as to be able to stock more rice.

loans.name: Melany Dahan

texts.es: Melany: es casada tiene 4 hijos ya mayores de edadtiene 40 años de edad hace 6 años inicio vendiendo comida en su casa alquilo un local para vender refacciones desayunos y almuerzo, despues decidio vender productos comestibles de primera nececidad,ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de productos comestibles de primera nececidad,el sueño de ella es darles un mejor futuro  a sus hijos y estar bien economicamente.
texts.en: Melany is married and has 4 adult children.  She is 40 years old.  Six years ago she began selling food from her home.  She then rented space to sell snacks, breakfast, and lunch, and later decided to sell basic foodstuffs as well.  She requests this loan to buy basic foodstuffs.  Her dream is to give her children a better future and be financially well off.

loans.use: to buy food products.

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en: Immaculate lives in Uganda. She is married and has three children, all of whom are in school. Immaculate has a beauty salon. She has been in this business for eight years and she works seven days out of every week. Immaculate sells her products in a shop, by means of retail. Immaculate has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cream relaxers and braids. The main business challenges for Immaculate include defaulters, the ever-increasing price of cream relaxers and braids, and seasonality.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling at wholesale only and to educate her children up to university. Immaculate lives in a home that she rents. She has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent, school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cream relaxers, braids and weaves

loans.name: Olimpia Venesuela

texts.es:
La señora Olimpia Venesuela está casada, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, tiene actualmente 47 años de edad, tiene 7 hijos los cuales tan estudiando, se dedica a la venta de ropa para mujeres, inicio este trabajo cuando era pequeña y hasta el momento lleva 13 años de experiencia, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es maestro de enseñanza.

Decide solicitar un préstamo para invertirlo en capital de negocio y poder comprar más mercadería: cortes, güipiles, fajas, pañuelos, suéteres, etc. En el futuro espera que su negocio en una tienda formal y más grande  y mejorar así su condición de vida.
texts.en: Olimpia is married and never had the opportunity to go to school. She is 47 years old and has seven children who all go to school. She makes a living selling women's clothing. She started working when she was young and at the moment has 13 years of experience. She is supported by her husband, who is a teacher. She is requesting the loan to invest in capital for her business so she can purchase more products, such as shorts, blouses, belts, scarves, sweaters, etc. In the future she hopes to have her business in a formal and bigger store and in this way improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise to sell, such as shorts, blouses, belts, scarves, sweaters, etc.

loans.name: Saranchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Saranchimeg is a shoe seller in the bazaar. She is 30 years old and lives with her husband and two daughters, of whom one is a half-year old. She has been running her business since 2000 at an international market called “Narantuul”.  The main process of her business is she purchases shoes from boot-makers wholesale and then sells them retail. 

She has requested a loan to raise her purchasing from boot-makers and increase her business turnover. It is a beneficial to her business and she can sell more.  In a week, she buys only 15-18 pairs of handmade shoes from shoemakers. Now she plans to increase this number.

loans.use: To raise her purchasing from boot-makers and increase her business turnover.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a 54-year-old married woman. She has a sari-sari store business. She sells items like noodles, diapers, and soap. Elma struggles but through her store, she is able to provide for her family’s basic needs.

Elma requested this loan to buy more items to sell such as noodles, canned goods, and soft drinks. She hopes to start another business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as noodles, canned goods, and soft drinks

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga lives in the village of Kutiri, Khoni District, West Georgia. She is 52 years old and lives with her family: her husband Valerian, 34 years old, her son and mother-in-law (retired). The only source of income for the family is their agricultural business. They have three milk cows. Olga produces and sells on average 100 kg of cheese at the local market. Along with the dairy farm, the family has two pigs and they sell approximately 24 piglets during the year. The total monthly income of the family is 900 Laris, including the pensions of Valerian and his mother. 

Olga requested credit for construction of a greenhouse. Her family members will grow various vegetables during winter in the greenhouse. It will be used in the summer for growing tomatoes.  Her new business initiative will give additional income to the family. Olga plans to reinvest it in the same business for the first couple of years, to expand it.

loans.use: to purchase materials to construct a greenhouse

loans.name: Alexis Jose

texts.es: Alexis José tiene 37 años, su actividad es la venta de ropa y cosméticos. Hace más de 3 años que tiene este medio de vida. Él es una persona responsable por lo que disfruta de realiza esta actividad todos los días. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos por lo que siente muy satisfecho con esta experiencia. Él solicita este crédito para la compra de bolsos, tratamientos, lápiz labial, polvos, cremas, shampoo entre otros productos.
texts.en: Alexis José is 37 years old.  His business is selling clothes and cosmetics.  He has been in this line of work for more than three years.  Alexis is a responsible person and he enjoys carrying out this business every day.  This is not the first time that he has taken out a loan and he feels very satisfied with this experience.  He is requesting this loan to buy bags, treatments, lipsticks, powders, creams, shampoo and other products.

loans.use: to buy bags, treatments, lipsticks, powders, creams, shampoo and other products

loans.name: Putheavy

texts.en: Putheavy, 39 years old, is a motor taxi driver who earns $3 per day. His wife is a grocery seller earning $4 per day. They have two children, one is studying and one is too small to go to school. Every month, Putheavy has to spend $99 on food, $10 on electricity, $15 on school fees, and $10 on other expenses. He would like to request a loan of $1000 to buy a car for traveling to visit his plantation which is far from home. He also wants to boost his wife's career by buying more groceries to sell. He hopes to have enough money to support his children to at least finish high school.

loans.use: To buy a car for traveling to visit his plantation

loans.name: Eusebia

texts.es: Eusebia tiene 31 años, esta divorciada, pero tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito D. Pichari. Eusebia nos comenta que desD. muy joven se dedico a laborar como negociante D. prendas D. vestir, siendo sus puntos D. ventas las diversas ferias que se presentaban en los caseríos del distrito D. Pichari. Tiempo después decidió comprarse una movilidad, con que transportar sus productos, pero le vio que le era mñas rentable el servicio D. transporte. Anteriormente su trabajo empezaba muy temprano para lograr una prenda, pero en cambio con el servicio que ahora ofrece obtiene más ganancias, solo que cuando su vehículo se malogre debe recurrir al mecánico lo cual le genera gastos. ElL. siempre cuenta con el apoyo D. sus menores hijos quienes después D. volver del colegio deben realizan las labores domesticas, mientras que elL. trabaja junto a su vehiculo transportando gente. Este será su segundo crédito con MFP, por lo se compromete una vez más en realizar puntualmente el pago D. sus cuotas. Con los 2,000 soles que solicita lo invertirá en el repintado del vehiculo y comprarle algunos accesorios.
texts.en:
Eusebia is 31 years old. She is divorced and has 3 children who live with her in her own home located in the district of Pichari. Eusebia tells us that since she was very young she has worked as a businesswoman in the traD. of clothing, selling in the various village market places in Pichari. After some time, she decided to buy a vehicle in order to transport her products, but she saw that it was more cost effective to have a transport service. 

Previously, working in the clothing industry, she had to start work very early, but with the change of vocation she now earns more income. Only when her vehicle malfunctions does she have to resort to calling a mechanic, which costs money.

She always has the help of her children who return home after school and take care of the household chores while she works in her vehicle transporting people.

This will be her second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and once again she promises to make her payments on time. She will use the loan of 2000 soles to repaint the vehicle and to buy some accessories.

loans.use: to repaint her vehicle and to buy accessories

loans.name: Betty Maryuri

texts.es:
Betty Maryuri tiene 37 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos vive en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar
LA VRC SAN JOSE, está conformada por 21 socios y socias se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia San José del Tambo a 60 minutos de la oficina. Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, plátano, cacao.

Betty se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, plátano, cacao las compras y las ventas las realiza en la Parroquia San José del Tambo. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, insumos agrícolas como urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.

El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá mejorar la calidad de vida y el producto.
 Los desafíos que se le presenta  son los intermediarios.  El sueño es ofertar productos que le generen ganancias para  comprarse una finca.

En los tiempos libres le gusta  escuchar música.
texts.en:
Betty Maryuri, 37, is single and has no children.  She lives with her family in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

The “San José” communal bank consists of 21 members, both men and women, and is located in San José del Tambo Parish sixty minutes from the office.  This communal bank is involved in short cycle corn, banana and cocoa bean farming.

Betty is a corn, banana and cocoa bean farmer.  Her purchases and her sales take place in San José del Tambo Parish.  She asked for the loan to buy seeds and farming supplies like urea, Matamonte [herbicide], fertilizer and weed killer to maintain her crops in good conditions.

The loan will be very helpful because she will be able to improve the quality of the product.  The challenges she faces are very frequent: competition and pests.  Her dream is to sell products that will produce profits so she can buy a farm.  She enjoys listening to music in her free time.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farming supplies.

loans.name: Bolorerdene

texts.en: Bolorerdene is 30 years old and lives with her husband and daughter in ger (Mongoian yurt) in Govi-sumber province, Mongolia. Her husband is a fireman and her daughter goes to kindergarten. She started her sewing business in 2010 when she finished her sewing training. She is an incredibly talented seamstress; however, her sewing machine is not a professional one so she needs to purchase one. She is a sharp and hardworking woman who says, "I need to change my sewing machine in order to be more efficient and fast; if I had a better machine, I would have a lot more customers". She is requesting 500,000 MNT to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is 35 years old. He is married with five sons and three daughters. Mahmoud is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. He wants to improve his family's living conditions by purchasing necessary home furniture such as: bedroom furniture for his children, living room furniture, etc. He doesn't have enough money to pay, so he needs to take a loan in the amount of $1,500 from FATEN. When Mahmoud gets the loan, he will be able to purchase the home furniture that his family needs,providing better home living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to purchase new furniture for his home.

loans.name: Rosa Elena

texts.es:
Desde hace varios años Rosa se dedica a prestar servicios de belleza a sus cliente y con su negocios a podido sacar a delante a sus hijos y les a permitido tener una buena calidad de vida.

Ella tiene su propia sala de belleza, sin embargo necesita adecuarla mejor con sillas, tocadores y demás mobiliario que le permita prestar un mejor servicio y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa has for several years offered beauty treatments to her clients. With her business she has been able to raise her children and allowed them to have a good standard of living.

She has her own beauty salon, however, she needs to fit it out better with chairs, dressers and other furniture which will allow her to give a better service and thus improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy dressers, chairs and hairwashers.

loans.name: Anifel

texts.en:
Anifel is 29 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Anifel runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari (variety) store.

Anifel has been in this business for six years, and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, snack foods, noodles, and other groceries. 

Anifel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Anabelle is 46 years old with three adult children. Her husband works as a security guard. Anabelle’s first Kiva loan helped her to purchase seed and fertilizer for her farm business. Today, she works cultivating a two-hectare plot of land.  

Anabelle is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan to purchase rice and corn seed as well as fertilizer. She hopes to broaden business activities by cultivating more land.

loans.use: to buy seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Angeles

texts.en:
Angeles is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with five children. Angeles has a retail shop that buys and sells coconuts for copra [dried coconut meat used for oil production]. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos to buy coconuts to sell.

Angeles is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Angeles hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts to sell

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: El Sr. Miguel se dedica a prestar sus servicios como Docente guía y al mismo tiempo dicta la materia de Ingeniería Química hace más de dos años, por otro lado tiene un vehículo que lo utiliza para alquilarlo a cualquier persona, por ello le urge seguir trabajando con su movilidad ya que por ahora está en reparación la parte del motor, para ello necesita el crédito que solicita para poder refaccionar el motor de su vehículo, de esa manera podrá percibir sus ingresos, además quiere ahorrar para poder comprar un lote para que pueda vivir junto a su familia más cómodamente ya que ahora no tiene un espacio muy amplio para que puedan estar más cómodos, especialmente su madre quien necesita un espacio amplio para poder seguir desarrollando su actividad que es la Elaboración de Masitas. El Sr. Miguel es soltero y aun no tiene hijos solo vive junto a su madre en la casa de sus tías.
texts.en: Miguel works offering his services as a teacher and guide, and he has also taught chemical engineering for over two years. He also has a car that he rents out to people. It is very important for him to continue working in transport, and at the moment, his car is undergoing repairs. He needs the loan he is applying for to repair his car's motor. This way, he will receive his income. He also wants to save so that he can buy a lot in order to live more comfortably together with his family. Currently, they don't have a very large space where they can be more comfortable, in particular his mother, who needs more space for her work, which is pastry-making. Miguel is single and does not have children. He lives together with his mother in his aunts' house.

loans.use: to repair a motor

loans.name: Kenia Patricia

texts.es: Kenia es una mujer trabajadora de  31 años de edad, casada y madre de un hijo de diez años, por quien trabaja fuertemente para darle una mejor educación y encaminarlo por el buen camino, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace siete años, una de sus metas es expandir su negocio y surtirlo por medio de la oferta de nuevos productos que le han demandado sus clientes, por tanto solicita por séptima vez el financiamiento de la institución para la compra de blusas, pantalones, faldas y chores.

loans.use: para la compra de blusas, pantalones, faldas y chores.

loans.name: Sakena

texts.en:
Sakena was born in 1986 in Kabul City, Afghanistan. Right now she is single, living with her 6 family members.

Sakena is working together with her brother, weaving carpets, but her family income is rather limited. She decided to take a loan through AFSG so she can buy thread and weave the carpets. Then her brother can sell them in the bazaar at a high prize.

loans.use: To buy thread

loans.name: Evanel

texts.en:
Evanel has one child, whom she supports through her small business selling vegetables, seasonings, peanuts and various other snacks and ingredients that are popular in the village markets. Evanel has established herself as a very determined and organized entrepreneur, but her goal is to expand by improving the location where she works as well as the quantity and selection of the goods she sells. This loan will give her the capital necessary to increase inventory and invest in the long-term for her business and her child at home.

NOTE: Evanel is a member of an Esperanza solidarity group. She and her business represent nine other micro-entrepreneurs who are members of the same solidarity group. Each members will receive a share of this $1,200 loan to develop their respective businesses. The cost of living in Haiti is such that Esperanza is able to fund 10 entrepreneurs who must make each payment together. If one person is unable to pay, the other members must make up the difference before any payment will be excepted. The community of 10 entrepreneurs have gone through Esperanza´s business training courses and have demonstrated their commitment and aptitude for receiving a loan to expand their business. Ivonne and the other members are responsible for working with one another as a social support network throughout the loan repayment and business development processes.

loans.use: Increase inventory and develop her place of business

loans.name: Maricela

texts.en:
Maricela is married, 32 years old and has four children. Together with her husband, they sell fruits and vegetables door to door in their neighborhood. With the loan, they are planning to put up a small sales stand at their house so they can spend more time taking care of their kids.

They belong to the Maria del Carmen group along with the other women - Patricia Ruiz Gomez (who buys and sells calves), Victoria Hernandez Gomez (who has a grocery store). Both will invest the part of the loan pertaining to them. Patricia will buy more animals to raise and increase her sales, and Victoria is planning to buy canned goods, pastas, frozen foods, and drinks, to keep her store stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

MARICELA ES CASADA TIENE 32 AÑOS Y CUATRO HIJOS. JUNTO CON SU ESPOSO VENDEN FRUTAS Y VERDURAS PUERTA A PUERTA EN LAS CASAS DE LAS COMUNIDADES CERCANAS A SU HOGAR CON EL PRESTAMO QUIERE PONER UN PEQUEÑO LOCAL DE VENTA EN SU CASA Y ASI PODER DEDICAR MAS TIEMPO AL CUIDADO DE SUS HIJOS.PERTENECE AL GRUPO MARIA DEL CARMEN 3 JUNTO CON LAS SEÑORAS : PATRICIA RUIZ GOMEZ ( TRABAJA EN LA COMPRA Y VENTA DE BECERROS ) VICTORIA HERNANDEZ GOMEZ ( TIENE UNA TIENDA DE ABARROTES ) AMBAS CON LA PARTE QUE LES CORRESPONDE DEL PRESTAMO VAN A INVERTIR ; PATRICIA COMPRANDO MAS ANIMALES PARA CRIAR Y AUMENTAR SUS VENTAS Y A SU VEZ VICTORIA PIENSA COMPRAR ALIMENTOS ENLATADOS, PASTAS,ALIMENTOS CONGELADOS, BEBIDAS, PARA MANTENER MAS SURTIDO SU LOCAL

loans.use: Buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en:
Fotima is a teacher of literature and worked at the school for 8 years. She is married and has two children. In 1990 she decided to start a business and opened her own shop. She sells pillows, towels and bedclothes. She travels herself to buy her goods from Bishkek, Kirgizistan.

Fotima became a client of Microinvest in 2003. Her first loan was $500, which she spent to purchase the goods to sell. Today she has many clients and her shop is one of the well known shops in the area.

In the autumn, she wants to purchase warm modern bedclothes to sell, and she requests $550 for this purpose.

loans.use: Purchasing warm bedclothes to sell

loans.name: Gatiba

texts.en: Gatiba is 54 and a mother of three. She lives in the village of Garadag-Budug in the Khachmaz region of Azerbaijan. Gatiba has a pomegranate orchard which she runs with her husband (you can see her and her husband in the picture). They have been in the farming business for seven years and now need a loan of $825 to buy pesticides and fertilizer to improve their orchard.

loans.use: To buy pesticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria S. is a woman who likes to fight for her three small children so they can get ahead in spite of the adversities that they are presently living. This is why Gloria tries to earn money to be able to pay their school expenses, so they don't start to work. After a child starts to earn money, he/she doesn't care anymore about doing better in school and little by little he/she stops studying. This is why Gloria doesn't let her children work like other families do, without worrying that their children won't amount to be anybody in the world. Gloria sells clothes among her family members and neighbors in addition to offering them naturist products. She started this business five years ago, when her children started to grow up.

Nevertheless, the fight continues to get more clientele that buy from her and that don't go to the competition. This is why she is requesting a loan of $925, to be repaid in 6 months. With this money, she will be able to buy the merchandise that her clients are asking her for a lot and to buy a better assortment for the winter season so her clients don't go to the competition. With your help, Gloria will be able to help her children get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva volunteer.

Gloria S. es una mujer, que le gusta luchar por sus tres pequeños hijos para que salgan adelante a pesar de las adversidades con las que viven actualmente. Es por eso que Gloria trata de sacar dinero para poder pagar los gastos de sus escuelas, y que no empiecen a trabajar, puesto que después de que un niño comienza a ganar dinero, no les importa superarse en la escuela y poco a poco dejan de estudiar. Por eso Gloria no permite que sus hijos trabajen como otras familias lo hacen, sin importarles que un niño sin educación no llegará a ser nadie en el mundo. Gloria se dedica a vender ropa entre sus familiares y vecinos, además de ofrecerles productos naturistas. Hace cinco años que comenzó en este negocio, desde que sus hijos comenzaron a crecer.

Sin embargo la lucha sigue por conseguir más clientela que le compre a ella y no se vaya con la competencia es por esto que está solicitando un crédito de US $925 para pagarlos en un plazo de 6 meses y con este dinero poder comprar la mercancía que tanto le están pidiendo unas clientas, y comprar más surtido para la temporada de invierno y que sus clientas no se vayan con la competencia. Con tu ayuda Gloria podrá sacar a sus hijos adelante.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to supply her business

loans.name: Inviolata

texts.en:
This is 51 year-old Mama K..  In 2006, she established a brick-making business to supplement her teacher’s salary.  Mama K. doesn’t actually make the bricks herself.  It’s heavy and time-consuming work, so she has one employee who takes care of the production side of the business.  She requires a loan to expand production and possibly hire another employee.  Mama K. is a widow with three children, and cares for her granddaughter Emilian, who is 15 years-old.

SELFINA is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facilities as a practical way to achieve economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro Leasing.  Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; thus, they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets.  This leads to poor financial support, which in turn leads to poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys from and leases equipment to women.  Where a client needs working capital, SELFINA buys equipment from the said client extending a loan to her, and then leases back the same equipment – a process called a "sale and leaseback arrangement".

loans.use: To expand production of her brick-making business.

loans.name: Jam Bougoum Group

texts.fr:
We are a village of almost 400 people who are fishermen and farmers. Our area enjoys a flood-retarding basin that allows us from now on to cultivate the land year round. Since we live around the basin, we would like to take advantage of the water’s proximity to generate and commercialize market gardening produce that are farmed all around. The financing will be used to buy watering cans, gardening tool, seeds, fertilizers and pesticides. We will also buy what others produce to go and sell them in Mbour, a big town and a seaside town full of hotels. The population wants to take advantage of the proximity of the basin to really fight poverty.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva volunteer.

Nous sommes un village de près de 400 habitants qui sont des pêcheurs et agriculteurs. Notre zone bénéficie d'un bassin de rétention qui nous permet désormais de faire de l'agriculture durant toute l'année. Puisque nous habitons autour du bassin, nous voulons profiter de la proximité de l'eau pour faire de la production et la commercialisation de des produits maraîchers qui se cultivent tout autour. Le financement nous servira à nous équiper en arrosoirs, matériels de jardinage, semences, engrais et pesticides et aussi à acheter ce que les autres personnes produisent pour aller les vendre à Mbour qui une station balnéaire plein d'hôtels et qui est une très grande ville. les population veulent profiter de la proximité du bassin pour vraiment lutter contre la pauvreté.

loans.use:
Purchase of seeds and other market gardening tools. Purchase of produce for resale.

Achat de semences et autres matériels de maraîchage. Achat de produits maraîchers pour revendre.

loans.name: Brok

texts.en: Mrs. Brok S., 36, is married and has three children.  She works selling rice and porridge in Srass Chor commune in the city of Phnom Penh.  She earns around $10 of profit per day. Her husband, Mr. Chan Seng, is a motor-taxi driver and makes on average $10 of income daily. Three of their children are students. This couple needs a loan of $1200 as a capital to purchase a new car.  Their current car is too old and uses a lot of gas.

loans.use: to change a new motor

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en: M. Nasiba was born in 1977 in the Spitamen region of Tajikistan and is married and has 2 children. She works on a collective farm but because it is seasonal work, she essentially depends on the income she takes from the family business of raising and selling livestock. She has great experience in the livestock business and has many of the appropriate skills.  She is also engaged in milk production, and is applying to Kiva for a loan of $475 to build a new barn that will allow her to to increase the number of livestock in their business.

loans.use: To build a new barn.

loans.name: Mary Nora

texts.es:
Following her divorce from her husband, Mary realized that she needed to work to support herself. Despite receiving maintenance from her ex-husband, she no longer wants to rely on anyone else. This is what prompted her to look for different ways to earn money. She began selling clothes and dairy products, going from house to house, however it was not enough to rent a premises and open a shop or even to become a traveling seller. These days she has a secure client base, but she wants to invest more money in stock to sell to even more people. On the other hand, for two years now, Mary has been working together with a group of female friends preparing snacks and dinners for large events. This extra income has enabled her to support her two young children, aged eleven and nine. In the future, she plans to open a clothes shop and create a secure job for herself.

Translated from Spanish by Lucy Williams, Kiva volunteer

Una vez que se divorció de su esposo, Mary se vio en la necesidad de trabajar por cuenta propia. A pesar de que recibía la pensión de su ex esposo ya no quiso depender de nadie. Fue así que se animó a buscar diversas formas de cómo ganarse algún dinero. Empezó vendiendo ropa y productos lácteos ofreciéndolos casa por casa, pues no tenia lo suficiente como para alquilar un local para tienda o incluso para vender como ambulante. Hoy cuenta con un numero seguro de clientes, pero asegura que le gustaría invertir más en mercadería para vender a mas personas. Por otro lado, Mary, desde hace dos años, trabaja junto con un grupo de amigas preparando almuerzos o cenas para eventos grandes. Gracias a este trabajo a podido seguir manteniendo a sus hijos menores de once y nueve años. Mas adelante, ella planea poner una tienda de ropa y tener un trabajo estable.

loans.use: To buy stock for her business, selling clothes and dairy products.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth A. is a baker and has been managing her own business for several years. She is not yet married because she is so focused on developing herself and her business.  Currently, her business is doing very well but she wishes to further increase her sales of baked goods.  Her major challenge, however,  is the increase in the prices of ingredients, especially flour for baking.  Therefore, Ruth is asking for a loan of $525 to buy more flour and other ingredients for the production and sale of baked goods.

loans.use: To buy more flour and other ingredients for the production and sale of baked goods.

loans.name: Demecio

texts.es:
Demecio’s family is comprised of his wife and three children, ages 20, 19 and 11, and they own the home in which they reside. Demecio dedicates himself to transporting passengers in his vehicle, and is an active member of the Warnes transportation cooperative. His wife runs a neighborhood general store from their home, where they also want to be able to offer telephone services to customers. They do have some competition given that other people provide services similar to theirs, but Demecio stands out for his punctuality as well as his membership in the cooperative which offers him some competitive advantages. The current loan is so they can develop and provide VIVA communications. Their prior loans are in good standing, given that they always paid their installments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Demecio tiene una familia que está compuesta por su esposa y sus tres hijos de 20, 19 y 11 años de edad, todos viven en domicilio propio. Demecio se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en su vehículo, es socio activo de la Cooperativa de transportes Warnes. Su esposa cuenta con una tienda de barrio ubicada en el mismo domicilio y donde implementará un punto de llamadas. La competencia es media ya que existen personas que desarrollan las mismas actividades comerciales, pero el servicio que ofrece Demecio es puntual, además que el pertenecer a una cooperativa le permite contar con una ventaja ante la competencia. La presente solicitud es para la implementación de un punto de llamadas VIVA. Sus antecedentes crediticios son buenos ya que siempre cumplió de manera puntual con sus cuotas.

loans.use: Purchase and install a communications/telephone station in their store.

loans.name: Geysi

texts.es:
Geysi has a small glass shop. She began selling paintings and now she has her own business, which makes her feel happy and proud. Geysi is 26 years old and has three children. Her husband is a carpenter and together they take care of their family's needs. She thinks that this project of helping people get ahead is a great idea: If there were more groups around the world working so that others can progress, the world would be a better place. She is thankful for the assistance that you can provide and feels emotional to think that, of all the people in the world, she may receive a friendly helping hand. Geysi promises to be punctual and responsible with her payments. The money that she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of materials for her glass shop and to improve the space that she uses.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer.

Geysi tiene una pequeña vidriería, ella empezó vendiendo cuadros y ahora ha logrado tener su propio negocio por el que se siente muy feliz y orgullosa. Geysi tiene 26 años y 3 hijos, su esposo es maderero y juntos sostienen las necesidades familiares. Ella considera que este proyecto donde personas ayudan a otras a salir adelante es una gran idea, ya que si hubieran más grupos trabajando para que otros progresen el mundo sería un lugar mejor. Por ello que agradece el apoyo que le puedan brindar y se siente emocionada al pensar en la gente en todo el mundo, que como ella puede recibir una mano amiga.Ella promete ser puntual y responsable en sus pagos, y el dinero solicitado será invertido en la compra de materiales para su vidriería y para la mejora del espacio que utiliza.

loans.use: Investment capital for her glass business.

loans.name: Quyen

texts.vi:
Chị Trương Thi Quyền 54 tuổi, kinh tế gia đình chị thuộc hộ khá tại địa phương vợ chồng chị có 6 người con, đã có 5 người con có việc làm và lập gia đình, 1con hiện đang học  lớp 12 và sống cùng vợ chồng chị. Chị tham gia Quỹ năm 1999 vốn vay ban đầu chị vay 1.000.000đ  chị đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn. Các vòng vốn sau chị kết hợp đầu tư nuôi lợn và nuôi vịt, hàng tháng thu nhập từ chăn nuôi vịt là 3000.000đ. Kết quả từ việc chăn nuôi được chị đầu tư xây dựng gia đình và kiến thiết nhà cửa cho các con chị. Chồng chị mặc dù tuổi đã cao nhưng anh vẫn đi làm cho thu nhập hàng tháng 1.500.000đ. Vòng vốn này gia đình chị xin vay 10.000.000đ đầu tư vào chăn nuôi lợn và trâu.
Thu nhập binh quân. 5.000.000đ/ tháng.
texts.en:
Ms T. Thi Quyen is 54 years old. Her family's income is considered fair for the local area. She and her husband have 6 children, 5 are married with family and employed. 1 child is in the 12th grade and lives with her and her husband. She joined TYM fund in 1999. Her first loan was 60.00 USD which she invested in raising pigs. Later loans were used in raising pigs and ducks. They make about 187.00 USD per month from raising ducks. She was able to use profits from her animal farming business to take care of her family, and help build homes for her children. Her husband, even though up in age, is still working and makes 93.00 USD per month. For this loan, she wishes to borrow 625.00 USD to invest in raising pigs and water buffaloes. Her average monthly income is 312.50 USD

Translated from Vietnamese by Thu Ostrander, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is married with 7 children between the ages of 29 and 12 years old. She has been selling charcoal and food since 1998. She works everyday and can earn a monthly profit of about $40 from her sales.

Mariam is now requesting a loan to expand her business by adding to her current stock.

loans.use: To expand her business by adding to her current stock.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
Doña María Teresa Yucutè I.  tiene una tienda, donde vende productos de primera necesidad desde hace 8 años.

Actualmente tiene pocos productos de consumo diario pero ella quiere un crédito para comprar más productos como aceite, café, azúcar, arroz, fideos, etc. Ella dice que desde que abrió esta tienda poco a poco ha tratado de hacer crecer su negocio, pero con el crédito lo podrá hacer de una forma más eficiente ya que podrá tener disponible lo que sus clientes piden, especialmente en estos meses que es cuando la gente compra más, ella tiene el deseo de poder después, abrir otro negocio que le ayude a mejorar sus ingresos ya que tiene 8 hijos y 3 de ellos están estudiando, ella quiere que su familia pueda tener lo necesario para vivir.
texts.en:
Mrs. Teresa Yucutè I. has had a store where she sells everyday products for the past 8 years. She currently has few products for daily consumption but she wants a loan to buy more products like oil, sugar, rice, noodles, etc. She says that since she opened this store little by little she has tried to make her business grow, but with the loan she will be able to do it more efficiently as she will be able to have what her clients request available, especially in those months when people buy more. She has the desire to later open another business which will help her to improve her income as she has 8 children, 3 of whom are students. She wants her family to have what it needs to live.

Translated from Spanish by Aimee Sostowski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products to vary her store.

loans.name: Yoli

texts.es:
La señora Yoli, socia del Banco Comunal Las Trabajadoras, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de Mariscal Cáceres, distrito de Juanjui.

Tiene 32 años de edad, vive con su esposo y con su hijo. Su esposo es chofer y se dedica al servicio de transporte interprovincial y ella se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir para damas, caballeros y niños.

Con este préstamo de S/.3,000, el cual será cancelado en 6 meses, invertirá en la compra de ropa para niñas como blusitas, shorts, pantalones jean de diferentes marcas, polos, camisas para niños y caballeros. Esta inversión le permitirán satisfacer los gustos muy exigentes de sus clientes, así como también le dará mantenimiento a su carro para asegurar la tranquilidad de los pasajeros y del tipo de servicio que ofrece.

La señora Yoli ya tiene 3 años trabajando con el banco y esta muy contenta de haber logrado crecer en su negocio, agradece el apoyo de Manuela Ramos. Más adelante quiere comprar su casa.
texts.en:
Yoli, a member of “Las Trabajadoras” (“Workers”) Community Bank, lives in the Juanjui district of Mariscal Cáceres province in the San Martín region. She is 32 years old and lives with her husband and son. Her husband is a driver on routes throughout the region and she sells clothing for women, men, and children. With this loan of S/3,000 (approximately US $975), which will be repaid in six months, Yoli will invest in clothing for girls (blouses, shorts, various brands of jeans, polo shirts, etc.) as well as shirts for men and boys. This investment will enable her to satisfy the demands of her clients and will also provide for the maintenance of her car to ensure good service and calm for her passengers. Yoli has been working with the bank for three years and is very happy to have been successful in developing her business. She is grateful for the support of Manuela Ramos. In the future she would like to buy her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Kris Vickery, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy blouses, shorts, jeans, polo shirts, and shirts for children and men.

loans.name: Ari Mpya Group

texts.en:
Rehema Hassan, age 47, is married with four children ages 22, 20, 18 and 15. She also takes care of her mother. She has a fish business which she started four years ago and works daily from 6am until 2pm. She is able to earn a monthly profit of around $375.

This will be Rehema’s fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the stock of fish and she repaid the loans successfully. She now hopes for the fourth loan to buy more stock of fish as she is now having more orders and she is going to pay her child’s school fees as well.

Rehema will share this loan with her loan group, Ari Mpya, which totals 17 members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back their loans. In the picture, Rehema is to the left of the person in red in the front row.

loans.use: To buy more fish and pay children's school fees.

loans.name: Mrs. Sahun Chhor Village Bank Group

texts.en: This loan goes to nine people in Phum Ty village, in Kampong Chhnang province, who formed a village bank loan group. They will each use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sahun C. is the village bank president, selected by the members. She and her husband, Mr. C. Sahun, are construction workers. Since their work place is far from home, they spend a lot of money on transportation. In order to reduce these expenses, Mrs. Sahun C. decided to ask for a loan to buy a bike to go to work. She will use the rest of the loan to buy chickens for breeding. Mrs. Sahun C. is 28 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom attends the local school while the younger one, at age five, is too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy a bike to get to work

loans.name: Bobomurod

texts.en:
For the past 2 years, Bobomurod has worked in agriculture, raising animals. He raises sheep which he cares for greatly since thanks to them, he can cover his household expenses. Bobomurod showed us his animals with great happiness as his sheep were about to be vaccinated against the various sickness that affect that type of livestock.

For Bobomurod, it is very important to work raising his animals which is why he is currently seeking a loan in order to purchase additional sheep so that in future he can earn more money. That will help his family to generate additional income. We appreciate your support for Bobomurod’s projects.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing sheep to expand his business

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan K. of Battambang province is 25 years old and has a business as a tailor. She is also a wedding planner. She is a widow who lives with her young child. On average, she makes around $6 a day. She would like to take out a loan to purchase cosmetic products and clothes for her tailoring business.

loans.use: clothes and cosmetics

loans.name: Nicoline

texts.en:
Nicoline is a mother of two children. She runs a hair dressing salon at Mile 3 where Nicoline lives. She will use this loan to purchase a hair-drying machine and hair treatment, and use it to cover her transportation and rent costs.   
 
This is Nicoline’s second loan from GHAPE since she became a beneficiary in 2007. Nicoline trusts that her business will be a successful one because she thinks she her salon is in a good location. Her customer base is also consistent and Nicoline is very skilled at styling hair. 

Like most entrepreneurial mothers, Nicoline plans to use the profits from the loans to pay for her children’s school fees. The profits will also go towards purchasing food and clothing for the family. Nicoline enjoys being a GHAPE member and likes the group of entrepreneurs with whom she works. 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase a hair drier and hair treatment lotion

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 61-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon with his wife and their five children. Mahmoud owns a bookstore. He also sells stationery and has a printing machine.

Mahmoud requested a loan of 3,000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his bookstore and to repay his debts. Mahmoud has been a microcredit client for eight years now and has always paid on time. His previous loans helped him improve his bookstore business. His clients can be anybody. In the future, he plans on improving his bookstore.

loans.use: Mahmoud will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his bookstore and reimburse his debts.

loans.name: Silvino

texts.es: Silvino, de 35 años de edad, es casado hace 8 años, tiene dos hijos que viven con en su casa. De niño vivía en las alturas de su pueblo donde sus padres cultivaban en tierras temporales, ellos esperaban la lluvia para que la tierra se deje cultivar. Ahora con su propia familia migró al pueblo  de su esposa donde siembra en terrenos de regadío en la parte baja del pueblo. Desde entonces ya no espera los meses de septiembre a octubre para la siembra, sino que cada vez que cosecha papa, siembra alverjas, y en otras chacras ya está preparando para la siembra siguiente de papa. Aunque hay temporadas que el precio de este producto baja en el mercado, cuando sube es muy rentable, por eso Silvino es fiel a este tubérculo y con ello sostiene las necesidades de su familia. Silvino es un cliente muy gracioso cada vez que se reúne con sus compañeros del banco comunal, este es su 7mo préstamo con MFP, donde siempre ha sido un buen pagador. El dinero que solicita es esta ocasión es para la compra de fertilizantes químicos, para abonar sus próximas siembras de papa.
texts.en:
Silvino is 35 years old, has been married for 8 years, and has two children. When he was a boy he lived near a village where his parents were dryland farmers—they would wait for the rain in order to cultivate the land. Once he had his own family Silvino moved to his wife’s village, where he farms on irrigated land below the village. Ever since then he no longer has to wait until the months of September or October to plant (as is the case for dryland farming). Every time Silvino harvests potatoes, he plants peas, and in other fields he is preparing to plant the next crop of potatoes. Although there are times when the price of potatoes is lower at the market, it is very profitable when the price goes up. It is for this reason that Silvino is loyal to this tuber, as growing potatoes enables him to meet the needs of his family. Silvino is a very gracious customer every time he meets with the other members of his communal bank. This is his 7th loan with Kiva partner MFP, and he has always been good in making his payments. The money that Silvino is asking for this time will be used to purchase chemical fertilizers so that he can fertilize his next crop of potatoes.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing fertilizer

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth O. started her fish sales four years ago at Oda, where she lives. Elizabeth serves her customers with very tasty and good quality fish and because of that many customers buy from her stand. She is now 36 years old and married with three children, who are currently in school.

Elizabeth belongs to the village bank called ‘Nokwarefo’ which literally means 'trust'. She wants to use this loan to buy increased stock of assorted fishes to make increased sales and income to support her children's education and business growth. She would be grateful for the assistance.

loans.use: To buy more stock of smoked fishes.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen baji is the wife of A. A. who owns a two-room brick house in Kasur city and has been living in it with her family for the last 14 years. Kasur city is famous for its shrines and for its sweetmeats. She is the mother of two daughters. Currently, they are enrolled in school and are getting an education.

Nasreen baji and her husband run a decorative embroidery business. Her husband collects orders from the clothes shops and helps Nasreen baji in her decorative embroidery business. They both prepare embroidered dresses and complete one dress in 15 days and earn 13,000 To 15,000 Pak rupees.

Nasreen baji is applying for a loan to buy material (colored thread, beads and clothes) to complete the orders for preparing embroidered dresses.

loans.use: To buy material for her decorative embroidery business

loans.name: Dy

texts.en:
Dy L. is 53-year-old and lives in Kompong Cham, Cambodia. She is married to Sorn Chean, 56, (pictured) and blessed with five children.

Since 1980, Dy L. and her husband have grown rice and vegetables on their farmland. Dy L. will use her loan to grow cabbage, morning glory, spring onions, etc. This will allow their family to attain a better standard of living.

loans.use: Grow cabbages, morning glory, and spring onions.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca B. is from the village of Kinangay Norte, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old, married, and has six adult children. Francisca owns and operates a sari-sari or general store, selling daily-use products such as soap, shampoo, toothpaste, etc., in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 1,500 PHP a month. In 2007, Francisca joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Francisca is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional items to expand her product offering. This loan will be her third from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Hermanas Group

texts.es: El grupo Hermanas está conformado por las sras. Rosalia y Virginia G., ambas se dedican al tejido de chompas de alpaca, tienen sus maquinas tejedoras y hacen las chompas para exportación, ya que trabajan con un taller, ambas casadas, tiene tres niños en edad escolar su esposo le apoya con los gastos de la casa. Doña Virginia vive en Pampahasi, tiene dos niños en edad escolar y us esposo que es taxista le apoya con los gastos en su casa.Ambas invertiran en la compra de lana, ya que tienen pedidos en el taller. Son clientes puntuales y responsables.
texts.en:
The "Hermanas" group is made up of señoras Rosalia and Virginia G., who both make a living by weaving sweaters out of alpaca wool. They have looms and make their sweaters in their shop to export. Both of them are married. Doña Rosalia has three school-aged children. Her husband helps her with their home's expenses. Doña Virginia lives in Pampahasi and has two school-aged children. Her husband is a taxi driver and helps her with their home's expenses. Both of them will invest in the purchase of wool since they have orders in their shop. Both are punctual and responsible customers.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: They will invest in the purchase of alpaca wool

loans.name: Abdurashit

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
    Абдурашиту 35 года. Он женат и отец 3-х детей. Его жена нигде не работает. Она сидит дома и делает домашнюю работу, кормит скот. Абдурашит занимается откормом и продажей скота. Наступление лета для Абдурашита – это сезон закупа скота, потому, что летом скот и его корм стоит дешево. И для откорма скота не надо много тратиться. Скот ест горную траву, и Абдурашит экономит на корме скота. С наступлением зимы Абдурашит продает часть откормившегося скота. Но он не покупает скот. Он покупает корм, для откорма оставшегося скота.
texts.en:
Abdurashit is 35 years old. He is married and is a father of 3 children. His wife is not employed. She stays at home, does domestic work and feeds livestock. Abdurashit is involved in raising and selling livestock. Beginning of summer for Abdurashit is the season to purchase livestock because livestock and feed are cheap during the summer. And he does not have to spend much on the feed either because livestock eats mountain grass; thus, Abdurashit saves on animal feed. With the onset of winter, Abdurashit sells some of the grown livestock, but does not buy any new livestock. Instead he buys livestock feed for the remaining livestock.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Phun

texts.en:
Phun L. is forty-nine years old and married with one school-age child. She lives with her husband in Takeo Province. She is engaged in a business of selling fish in a local market, typically earning an income of $3 a day. Her husband also plays a major role in generating a source of income for their family. To make a living, he is engaged in a business as a motor-taxi driver, providing his services to people in the town, earning $3 a day.

The world's financial crisis has been difficult for businesses in Cambodia this past year. This factor has played into a difficult economic year for much of the country, Phun included. The country's economic struggles always seem to affect the poor the most. In light of the country's economic difficulties, Phun is seeking to increase her income. She is asking for a loan of $1000 to purchase a plot of farmland, a purchase that she sees as offering a great opportunity for producing more income.

loans.use: farmland purchase

loans.name: Daryika's Group

texts.en:
Daryika, the leader of this group, is 47 years old. She is divorced and has raised four children. Her eldest son works as a builder while her daughter works in a café. Daryika's other two sons, 11 and 10, are still at school. For last two years Daryika has been earning a living by manufacturing traditional articles for sale, mainly blankets and bedding. Her mother used to make traditional products and taught Daryika the secrets of her profession. Daryika spent $70 USD to purchase thread, needles and fabric to start work. Now, her craft earns her $190 USD a month. She has been able to buy herself a sewing machine and a brand new fridge. Her future plans include marrying her son and helping him buy a new flat. Daryika needs a loan to have cosmetic alterations in her kitchen and also purchase materials and furniture for sewing traditional articles.

Daryika’s partners are Abjapar, Jumagul and Jamiyla. Abjapar, 47, is a father of four children. He works in the market selling milk and eggs. Prior to this occupation he served in the military. After retirement, he decided to take up a trade to keep active. Abjapar needs a loan to buy a cow. He wants to sell sour cream and cottage cheese.

Jumagul, 36, is divorced and is raising a son. In spite of being a servicewoman, she manages to find time to sell writing materials. In this way, she earns a pretty decent income. Jumagul needs a loan to pay for a repair at her house and to purchase more stationery materials to sell.

Jamiyla, 40, is married to a taxi driver and has two children. She works as a jurist in frontier troops. As Jamiyla’s son goes to one of the best private high schools in the country, she needs a loan to pay for his tuition. Her plan is to send her son abroad to pursue his career.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and to view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team, Supporters of Kyrgyzstan, at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: To purchase materials and furniture for sewing traditional items; to make cosmetic alterations in the kitchen

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel K. is a married businessman, age 37, and the father of one daughter. He sells shoes at Uthiru Center where most of his clients are. He brings in a monthly profit of approximately 30,000 KES. He has been in this business for about 14 years.

Samuel has never borrowed from any financial institution. This loan from KADET will be used to expand his business. His intention is to expand his business to a level where he can be an importer of secondhand shoes from other countries. He also hopes to buy land and build his own house.

About KADET: The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients. KADET provides financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is a microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke/.

loans.use: To expanding a shoe business

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 53-year-old Joyce K. from Mbozi  She is married and has five children between the ages of 12 and 24. Joyce has been running a crops business since 2005. She purchases and sells crops. She works at her business for 9-12 hours a day, 6 days a week. Joyce currently earns about $100 a month from her business. She is requesting a loan in order to purchase crops in bulk. In the future, she plans to improve the quality and range of the crops she sells. Joyce thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback micro-finance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of micro-leasing is that it allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk

loans.name: Ronel

texts.en:
Ronel A. is from the village of Tipolohon, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. He is 43 years old. Ronel is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Ronel runs a sari-sari (variety) retail store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Ronel has been engaged in his business for over nine years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Ronel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ronel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. Ronel is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional inventory & for working capital. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Ronel from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory

loans.name: Mom

texts.en:
Mrs. Mom H. lives in Ping Pong village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice. On this plantation she earns less income than needed to support her family. In order to reach their living requirements, she decided to ask for a loan to add her saving to buy a plot of land. She will use the land to cultivate rice to earn more income.

Mrs. Mom H. is 36 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school and the youngest one is too young to work or study. Her husband, Mr. Brok Sokhorn, is a blacksmith.

loans.use: To add to her savings to buy a plot of land to cultivate more rice

loans.name: Sarin

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarin N. lives in Chong Angkar village in Takeo province. She is a farmer who owns a 2.5 hectare field to cultivate rice. She faces an obstacle with her plantation because she does not have enough money to buy fertilizers and pesticides to support the crop. She decided to ask for a loan to buy these for her farm. Her husband, Mr. Pin Sophat, helps her with the farming. Mrs. Sarin N. has two children who are also farmers. 
Her husband is present on the left in the photo.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a young Palestinian man living in Zieta village. He owns a greenhouse where he grows many vegetables. His monthly average income is around 600 USD, which is considered around average, especially as he is living in a village instead of a city (where the cost of living is higher). Mohammad is planning to get married, so he is in the process of building his own house. The house is built, but he hasn't finalized the finishings so he has requested 2,000 USD from FATEN to finish preparing his house.

Mohammad appears in this picture taken at the FATEN office.

loans.use: To finish constructing his house

loans.name: Bayardo Francisco

texts.es: Bayardo Francisco tiene 37 años el tiene 2 hijos a su cargo que para él son lo más importante. Su actividad económica es la venta de ferretería ya que hace mas de 6 años que se dedica a este negocio, poco a poco inicio este negocio ya que anteriormente el no poseía muchos productos para ofrecerles a sus clientes y fue con el paso del tiempo y con la ayuda de los financiamientos logro salir adelante pues han sido de gran apoyo para su familia. Actualmente el solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de llaves, candados, cadenas, cuerdas entre otros productos. Su deseo es remodelar las condiciones de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Bayardo Franscisco is 37 years old and has two children, who are the most important things in his life. He sells hardware, and has already been doing this for 6 years. He started this business up little by little. In the past, he did not have many products to offer his customers, but with time and financing, he has moved forward, to great benefit to his family. He currently asks for financing to pay for labor, keys, padlocks, chains and string, amongst other products. His goal is to remodel the conditions of his housing.

Translated from Spanish by Caitlin Brooks, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: capital of labor

loans.name: Nelson Yobany

texts.es:
el señor Nelson Yobany C. A. tiene 36 años de edad, vive en union libre, su casa de habitacion esta en la colonia la Nueva Caucara en la ciudad de San Lorenzo, Nelson se dedica a la compra y venta de articulos personales, sus ventas las realiza en la frontera del Amatillo. muchos viajates necesitan comprar este tipo de productos. 
ahora el necesita el credito para poder surtir mas su negocio, comprando al por mayor obtiene mayores ganancias pero no tiene capital suficiente para poder comprar variedad de productos al por mayor.
Nelson necesita el credito para poder salir adelante con su familia y darles una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Nelson Yobany C. A. is 36 years old. He lives in a common-law relationship. His house is in the suburb of Nueva Caucara in the city of San Lorenzo. Nelson works in the purchase and sale of personal items. His sales take place on the border of Amatillo. A lot of travelling is necessary to purchase these types of products. Now he needs a loan in order to supply his business; buying wholesale gets greater profits, but he doesn't have sufficient capital to be able to buy a variety of products wholesale. Nelson needs the load in order to do well for his family and to give them a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Heidi Petersen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of toothpastes, soaps, toothbrushes, flashlights, nail clippers, batteries.

loans.name: Rachaelanne

texts.en:
Rachaelanne L. is 23 years old, single, and from the village of Kinoguitan , Misamis Oriental Province.  To make a living, Rachaelanne owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from selling food and daily use products to members of the local community. Rachaelanne has had business for over two years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos a month from it.

In 2009, Rachaelanne joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rachaelanne is requesting a new loan of 4,000 Philippine pesos which she plans to use to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be her first from HSPFI.
