She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory for a "sari sari" (variety) shop.

loans.name: Zahi

texts.en: Zahi is a 29-year-old single man who lives with his three brothers and sisters. After the death of his parents, he became the sole provider for his family. He has worked as a farmer for the past 15 years. Zahi is collaborating with an agriculturA. market to which he distributes his harvested vegetables. Today, Zahi is requesting to borrow $1,000 USD to buy seeds and fertilizers that he needs for the summer cultivation.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is a 41-year-old widow with three children, ages 10, 18, and 20. All her children go to school. She rents a one-room house, living with four people. There is neither electricity nor water. She takes care of two orphans and is self-reliant. The family gets three meals a day.

Alice buys fish from Gaba landing site, one of the biggest sites in the city centre of Kampala. She uses public transportation to get back to her business place. She resides and works in a semi-urban and slum area, which is on the outskirts of Kampala. Alice works seven days a week and also rents her business premises. She gets an average of twenty customers per day and sells to all categories of people on a retail basis. She has been running this business for the last six years, and she has been with MCDT and the same group mates for six years. This is her thirteenth loan. Alice's major challenge is the rainy season, as her customers are inconvenienced and, at times, halt going to her for a drink. This is so, because her place of business is covered with mud and water during the rains. Thieves also break into her business and go away with her brew.

Alice is boastful of her improved standard of living and her business's progress. She is aspiring to buy some land for herself in order to construct a commercial house and earn some money from tenants.

loans.use: To buy more baskets of smoked fish

loans.name: Gladys' Group

texts.en:
Gladys R. is from the village of Villa Nueva. She is 23 years old. Gladys is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Gladys R.' Group.

Gladys is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Gladys owns & operates a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Gladys has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Gladys joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gladys has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Gladys is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand product offering. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Gladys from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand it.

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en:
Epiphanie is 37 years old and is married with three children who are 2, 5 and 7 years old. She also takes care of two relatives who are 11 and 14 years old.

Epiphanie is a self-employed businesswoman selling a variety of goods, as her photo indicates. Those goods include cosmetics products like body lotion and toothpaste as well as foodstuffs like rice, sugar, flour and cooking oil. Her shop is open from 6 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Epiphanie is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her shop by purchasing a large quantity of sugar and rice, as they are in high demand.

With this large quantity, she will also start wholesaling. In doing so, she hopes to earn more profits which, in turn, will allow her to renovate her house, continue paying school fees for her two relatives, as well as build a secure future for her three children.

loans.use: To expand her shop by purchasing a large quantity of sugar and rice

loans.name: Mukama Mwesiga Group Of Kampala

texts.en:
In business, first impressions mean everything. That is one adage that never slips K. Flora’s mind. In her seven years doing business, this mother of two has been brought to terms with this fact. Her commitment, friendly nature and hard work have brought her dividends in her tailoring business in Nankulabye, Kampala.

K. Flora is a 36-year-old happily-married go-getter businesswoman. Her business, since its inception, has steadily been bringing her profits to the tune of 70,000 weekly. With this loan she is gleefully upbeat that her business will gain further ground. By and large, she intends to buy more sewing machines.

loans.use: To buy new sewing machines

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is the mother of two young children and her eldest is only aged three. Victoria is 39 years old and married to Edgardo. She dreams that her children will someday go to school and finish college. She and her husband work hard to supply food for their family and they’re also trying to save up for their children’s future.

Victoria and her husband both till a rice farm of their own. The farm currently needs inputs so she applied for a loan of Php 6,000. She will buy seed, fertilizer and other farm inputs once she receives the loan.

loans.use: To buy seed, fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Eveneser Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama Evenecer, que significa “Hasta Aquí dios te ayudo”. Está ubicado en el Estado D.  México.  El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes.
Brisa Elena R. Jiménez es el la presidenta  D. grupo. Tiene 19 años, estudió hasta el 1  año D. preparatoria, es comerciante D. Resina y no tiene  hijos.  Ella se dedica a realizar figuras D. resina que inició hace 2 años. Solicita el préstamo para comprar material y poder realizar sus figuras. Sus clientes algunos son turistas y otros son personas D. la república a las que les lleva sus figuras.  Al momento D. solicitar este préstamo se siente contenta. Quiere este crédito invertir en material.   También espera ir comprando poco a poco muebles para su casa.
Los otros integrantes D. grupo son:
-F. M. MICAELINA MOLINO
-G. M. REBECA               VENTA D. ZAPATOS POR CATALOGO
-D. R. M. NOEMI               VENTA D. ROPA
-H. M. ANCELMA ALEJANDRA VENTA D. RECINA
-T. G. LUZ MARIA              VENTA D. TORTILLAS
-H. V. JUANA              VENTA D. RECINA
-A. G. TRINIDAD                VENTA D. PERFUMES
-M. MORALES MARIA LEONOR        VENTA D. TAPETES
-H. G. CONSTANTINA         VENTA D. CERAMICA.
texts.en:
This group is called Evenecer, which means God helped you so far. The group is in Mexico, and it is comprised of ten members. Brisa Elena R. Jiménez is the president of the group. She is 19, and she went to school up to her first year in high school. She is a resin merchant, and she has no children. She makes figures from resin; she started two years ago. She is requesting a loan to buy material to be able to make her figures. Some of her customers are tourists, and others are from the republic where she takes the figures. She is happy at the time she requests the loan. She wants the loan to buy material. She also plans to, little by little, buy furniture for her house. The other members of the group are: - M. Micaelina: Food mill - G. M. Rebeca: Sells shoes by catalog - D. R. M. Noemí: Sells clothes - H. M. Ancelma Alejandra: Sells resin - T. G. Luz Maria: Sells tortillas - H. V. Juana: Sells resin - A. G. Trinidad: Sells perfume - M. Morales Maria Leonor: Sells mats - H. G. Constantina: Sells ceramics

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy material

loans.name: Ruth Del Socorro

texts.es:
Doña Ruth es una mujer trabajadora, que a mucho esfuerzo logro poner su propio negocio, una pequeña pulpería en donde vende variedades, lo inicio con ayuda de su esposo, que se dedica a la agricultura, pues son de pocos recursos económicos. 
Pero que se esfuerzan para sobresalir adelante, las ventas han estado bajas y tiene poco inventario lo que requiere de capital para poder comprar productos de consumo diario. 
La dificultad que tiene es el techo que se le pasa el agua, es por eso desea comprar zinc nuevo para poder hacer la mejora a su casa.
Y poder invertir un poco en el negocio para lograr equilibrar las ventas. Lo que seria de muchas utilidades y ganancias.
texts.en:
Ruth is a hardworking woman who, with much effort, managed to start her own business--a small grocery store where she sells a variety of products. At first she had help from her husband, a farmer, because they had few economic resources. She's made the effort to get ahead, but sales have been low and she has little inventory. She requires capital to be able to buy daily needs products. The difficulty she faces is her leaking roof; for that reason she wants to buy new zinc (corrugated iron) to be able to improve her house and invest a little in the business in order to balance out the sales, which would be very useful and profitable.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of zinc (corrugated iron) for her leaky roof and to invest in her business

loans.name: Chhen

texts.en:
Chhen Y., 49, is married and resides with her husband and two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorian temples. 

Y. is a farmer and sells fish at the market for an income of $3 per day. Her husband is a farmer, earning an income of about $1.50 per day to help cover the family expenses. 

Y. is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase a cart to transport meatballs to sell. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house. This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a cart to transport meatballs to sell

loans.name: Merina

texts.en:
Merina is a single mother of six children, none of whom go to school. She does not take care of additional family members. Merina owns a retail shop in Kisaasi selling merchandise such as sugar, maize flour, washing and bathing soap, cooking oil, salt and bread. She works from her home and therefore doesn’t pay rent for her business premises. She has been in this business for ten years and she works seven days a week. Her customers are local people. Merina resides in and owns a four room house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and utilities.

Merina wants to use this loan to buy more merchandise such as bags of sugar, cartons of salt, bags of maize flour, jerrycans of cooking oil and cartons of baking flour. She shops once a week, using public transportation. Her business challenges are thieves and transportation of merchandise from Kampala to her shop in the Kisaasi Kulambiro zone. She hopes to see her business grow big and to own a fully stocked wholesale shop. She joined MCDT to boost her business by acquiring additional capital.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise such as sugar, salt, maize flour, cooking oil and baking flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair and improve his home.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor E. is from the town of Pangal Norte, Echague. He is 40 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. Victor owns and operates a business raising livestock, primarily pigs, for fattening and sale. Victor has been engaged in his business for over 1 year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month from it..

In 2010, Victor joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Victor is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Victor from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Savun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savun P. is a villager in Angk Prasat village in Takeo province and she is 50 years old. She is a farmer who owns a three-hectare plot of land where she cultivates rice to sell to support her family.

Her problem is that her field is infertile soil and it has a lot of insects. So to improve production, Mrs. Savun P. is seeking a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, and with the rest of the loan she will rent a plow machine to plow her field.

Her husband, Mr. Ham Chao, is a traditional medicine seller who is able to earn some money to support his family. They have a child who is studying in school. Her husband is shown in the picture with her.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide.

loans.name: Ludnila Eugenia

texts.es:
Ludnila Muñoz es una mujer muy creativa y así lo ha mostrado siempre, desde que escogió como su profesión la arquitectura, que ahora aplica a los hermosos diseños alimenticios que prepara y vende en su negocio de nombre “Mi Postre”; allí exhibe las delicias de pasteles, tortas y postres en todas las formas y en  todos los tamaños que con sus propias manos elabora y  que están llenas de su creatividad y de las mejores técnicas higiénicas y nutricionales.   
Ludnila se dedicaba a la docencia hasta el año 2007, e incursionó en la repostería como un hobbie, pero decidió perfeccionar esta actividad con mucho estudio técnico,  trabajando en una repostería, para aprender cada día mas, allí complemento su aprendizaje y se vinculó a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, obtener financiamiento y  comprar una nevera exhibidora de postres, con la que empezó aprovechando en el negocio de Internet de su hermano, desde donde se ha dado a conocer mostrando su gran potencial inspirada en su profesión de arquitecta, porque en su microempresa aplica mucho de lo que sabe, como las formas, la estética, la imagen y presentación de todo lo que hace, entre lo que se destaca, el postre de las tres leches, el muy deliciosos de banano y combinados con chocolate y deliciosas frutas, además de pudines y otras exquisiteces.
En la actualidad se postuló para dispensar sus productos en el bingo que ofrece la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo a cuatromil clientes en Barranquilla y Cartagena y fue seleccionada para comercializarlos  en la primera ciudad mencionada. De allí se deriva la solicitud de su credikiva, porque necesita comprar en un gran volumen materias primas, para responder al tamaño del evento y para la elaboración de su material publicitario,  como pendones tarjetas y sus propios catálogos.
Ludnila es una mujer digna de admirar por su gran compromiso de crecimiento de si misma,  de su negocio, por eso ella continuamente está capacitando tanto a nivel administrativo como técnicamente, por eso siempre ofrece lo mejor y a un nivel de calidad que hace de sus productos los mas apetecibles en su mercado objetivo.
texts.en:
Ludnila Muñoz is a very creative woman, and she has always shown this since she chose architecture as her profession, which she now applies to the beautifully designed foods that she prepares and sells in her business called “Mi Postre” (My Dessert). There she exhibits delightful cakes, tarts and desserts of all shapes and sizes that she makes with her own hands and that are full of her creativity and the best hygienic and nutritional techniques. Ludnila worked as a teacher until 2007, and she tried her hand at cakes and pastries as a hobby, but she decided to perfect this activity with much technical study, working in a pastry shop to learn more everyday. She complemented her learning there, and she joined Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to obtain financing and buy a new display refrigerator for desserts, with which she began taking advantage of her brother's Internet business. She has become known for showing her great potential inspired by her architectural profession because in her microbusiness she applies much of what she knows, such as in the form, aesthetics, image and presentation of everything she makes, among which standouts are the tres leches cake, the very delicious banana cake and combinations of chocolate and delicious fruits, along with puddings and other delicacies. At present she has applied to distribute her products at the bingo event that Fundación Mario Santo Domingo offers to four thousand customers in Barranquilla and Cartagena, and she was selected to sell them in the first city mentioned. From there she developed the application for her Kiva loan, because she needs to purchase a large amount of raw materials to respond to the size of the event and for preparation of her publicity materials, such as banners, cards and her own catalogs. Ludnila is a woman worthy of admiration for her great commitment to personal growth and growth of her business. For this reason she is continually training as much at an administrative level as technically. Because of this she always offers the best and maintains a level of quality that makes her products the most attractive in her target market.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase large amounts of raw materials for her desserts and prepare publicity materials

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es:
María Teresa  y su esposo es una pareja muy observadora de las oportunidades, por eso Maria  inició un negocio de vender repuestos eléctricos , aprovechando que su esposo trabajaba en un almacén que comercializaba esta mercancía y tenían la facilidad de sacar a crédito los productos, para surtir su pequeño almacén de  barrio; el éxito de esta idea permitió el crecimiento del negocio y hoy le compra directamente a  distribuidores autorizados; sus clientes son los taxistas, propietarios y conductores de motocicletas que trafican por el sector y que en la actualidad lo reconocen,  porque cuenta con un local visible y muy ordenado donde ellos encuentran de todo un poco.
El credikiva es su segundo crédito con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el primero la ayudó a complementar su capital de trabajo y ahora va a comprar mercancía traída de la ciudad de Cali,  como bovinas, motores de arranque, alternadores, bujías, focos , lujos y accesorios para vehículos. Su principal meta es tener una sucursal donde trabaje su familia y cumplir su sueño emprendedor.
texts.en:
Maria Teresa and her husband are a couple that is aware of opportunity. That's why Maria started a business selling electrical replacement items, taking advantage of the fact that her husband works for a wholesale distributor and they have the possibility of purchasing goods for their neighborhood shop on credit. This idea was so successful that today they purchase items directly from authorized distributors. Their customers are a taxi drivers as well as motorcycle owners in the area. The shop is known for its visible location and organized stock with a little bit of everything. This loan through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo is their second. The first helped increase their working capital and this loan will help bring goods from Cali such as horns, starters, alternators, spark plugs, lights and accessories. Her goal is to have a store where her family can work and fulfill her entrepreneurial dream

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase goods from Cali such as, horns, starters, alternators, spark plugs, and vehicle accessories.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
la señora Alba Luz H. tiene 42 años de edad,  es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos que dependen de ella, radica en la aldea El Comercio, tiene 26 años de vivir en dicha aldea en la cual se a desarrollado como comerciante elaborando pan, quesadillas, ojaldras, tustacas.

la señora Alba todos los dias se levanta muy temprano para preparar la venta del dia, como a las 9 de la mañana tiene preparada la venta y sale a vender en el mercado nuevo de San Lorenzo, todo los dias de lunes a domingo.
 
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de leña, maiz, queso, cuajada, dulce rapadura.
 
su sueño es comprarse una casa ya que en la actualidad renta y quiere darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus dos hijos.
texts.en:
Sra. Alba Luz H., 42, is a single mother with two dependent children.  She settled in the town of El Comercio 26 years ago and set up a business making and selling bread, quesadillas and baked goods.  

Sra. Alba gets up early every day to make the food that she will sell that day.  She finishes making her products by 9:00 so that she can go to the San Lorenzo market to sell what she makes.  She works every day from Monday to Sunday.
 
She will use the loan to buy firewood, maize, cheese, curd, and "dulce rapadura" (a sugar traditional to the region).
 
Sra. Alba'sdream is buy her own house--she rents now--and give her two children a better quality of life.

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business.

loans.name: Anselma

texts.en:
Anselma is old but strong, a mother who aims to become successful someday by developing her kaing- (small basket) making business and selling charcoal in the local community. Anselma is thankful to ASHI, for through the loan they have provided since 2008, Anselma has been able to maintain her two businesses by purchasing necessities, and she hopes to further improve her businesses in the future through hard work and the continuous assistance of ASHI and Kiva.

Lack of business capital encouraged her to ask for financial support from Kiva lenders. She will be glad should her loan request be granted, and she will utilize the loan wisely by purchasing the needed supplies for her ventures. Her hard work and perseverance are the groundwork for improving her life. Her long-term goal is to have her own booth for her products someday. Anselma hopes to maintain a long-term, sustainable kaing-making business.

loans.use: will support the maintenance of her businesses.

loans.name: Fousseni

texts.fr:
Né le 1er Mai 1969 à Sikasso Monsieur Fousseni T. est marié et père des 4 enfants résidant dans la grande famille traditionnelle élargie à Kaboïla II, le centre ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur T. après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès,  s’est initié à cette activité de sonorisation depuis plus de 5 ans dont il dispose à la fois un discothèque et une salle de jeu devant le domicile. Il est beaucoup  sollicité  surtout lors des cérémonies de mariages, baptêmes, anniversaires, etc. En plus de sonorisation, il dispose un téléviseur avec lequel les jeunes viennent se divertir avec le jeu Play-Station.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire cette clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a  une année environ avec laquelle il a bénéficié d’un premier prêt individuel. Il sollicite un deuxième prêt pour pouvoir améliorer ses prestations de services en achetant, au Ghana  d’autres matériels supplémentaires à savoir un ordinateur pour le graver des sons et images, TV,Mine Chaîne, DVD, etc. 
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 215 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour  contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born on May 1, 1969 in Sikasso, Mr. Fousseni T. is married and the father of four living in a traditional extended family in Kaboila II, a central district of the town of Sikasso (the third administrative region of Mali).

After trying many activities without success, Mr. T. went into the sound production business over five years ago. He has a discotheque and a   game room in front of his living quarters. He is very sought after for weddings, baptism, anniversaries, etc. In addition, he owns a TV set, and children come to him to play Playstation games on this TV.

In order to better meet the growing customer demand, about a year ago he decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and already obtained one individual loan in the past. He is now seeking a second loan in order to improve his scope of services and to purchase in Ghana other necessary equipment, such as a computer with a CD and DVD recorder, a TV, a mini Hi-Fi system, DVDs etc. With this loan, he plans to achieve a monthly revenue of 215,000 West African Francs, which will be used to contribute to the family budget, pay off the interest on his loan and reinvest the rest in his business.

loans.use: Purchasing electronic appliances

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta T. is from the town of Lopez Jaena. She is 55 years old. Julieta is widowed and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Julieta owns & operates a general store, primarily selling a variety of different products in the local community. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over 8 years and earns approximately 20,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2000, Julieta joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Julieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase new items to expand product offering. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 18000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This will be the 17th loan taken out by Julieta from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory & working capital.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is a 35-year-old businessman. He operates a retail shop in one of the Nairobi slums and employs one person. He has been operating this business for the last eight years and hopes to grow it into wholesale in five years time. He is requesting a loan of 60,000 Kes to add stock of sugar, rice, unga (flour), and cooking fat among other products. Joseph is married and a father to one child who is in school. He describes himself as hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To add stock of sugar, rice, unga (flour), and cooking fat among other products

loans.name: Lucina

texts.en:
Lucina A. is from the village of Maquilao in Tangub City. She is 43 years old. Lucina is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Lucina raises and sells fish. Lucina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1500 PHP a month from these activities.

In 2010, Lucina joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3000 PHP from GDMPC. Lucina is requesting a new loan of 4000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Lucina from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Carlos Cesar

texts.es:
Carlos vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos en el distrito de Wanchaq. El distrito de Wanchaq se encuentra ubicado en la provincia del Cusco del departamento del Cusco, llamada el distrito de las flores y localizándose a 5 minutos de la plaza de armas de la capital arqueológica de América del Sur (Cusco). Cusco es una ciudad encantadora que se remonta a los tiempos de los Incas, la ciudad del Cusco está construida en la base de la antigua ciudadela Inca.

Carlos se dedica a brindar servicios de transporte público en su propio taxi. Hace varios años que se dedica a brindar servicios de transportes y le va regular. Con su próximo préstamo, Carlos que espera recibir S/.1000 nuevos soles. Con este dinero desea utilizar para uso personal y desea comprar artefactos o electrodomésticos. 

Carlos pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Esperanza” de la Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal esta en el segundo año de funcionamiento y está bien administrado por la junta directiva.
texts.en:
Carlos lives with his wife and two children in Wanchaq district.  Wanchaq district is located in Cusco province and department.  It is known as the "District of Flowers" and is located 5 minutes from the Plaza de Armas of the archaeological capital of South America (Cusco).  Cusco is a delightful city that dates back to Incan times.  The city of Cusco is built on the site of the ancient Incan citadel.

Carlos provides public transport services in his own taxi.  He has been providing transport services for several years and his business is going ok.  He hopes to receive a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles which he would like to use for personal purchases.  He would like to buy electrical appliances.

Carlos is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Nueva Esperanza" (New Hope) community bank which is in its second year and is well run by its board of directors.

loans.use: For personal use.  To buy some electrical appliances

loans.name: Loeurng

texts.en:
Loeurng H., age 43, is married and lives with her husband and four of her children in Takeo Province. Since 2003, she has been weaving silk scarves to earn a living and is able to make about US $3.00 in profit every day. Her husband, Touch Nan, age 48, is a construction worker who builds houses. Two of their children are garment factory workers and two are in school. 

Loeurng H. is asking for a loan of US$1000 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike.

loans.name: Katagata Farmers Group-Bushenyi

texts.en: 54-year-old Eldard K. is affiliated with Katagata  Farmers group-Bushenyi.   This happily married father of 7 has been engaged in a cattle sales business in Katagata for the past 9 years. Eldard also has a side banana sales business. He says it has been through the savings from his banana trade that he was able to take root in this cattle business. Eldard says that his determination and tenacity have gotten him this far. Weekly, the cattle  business generates for him 100,000 shillings.  He says with this loan, he is going to purchase a young calf.

loans.use: To purchase a calf

loans.name: Ginalyn's Group

texts.en:
Ginalyn C. is from the village of Bacolod, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 29 years old. Ginalyn is the group leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Ginalyn is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she raises pigs for fattening and sale. She has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately $95 every three months.

In 2010, Ginalyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. 

Ginalyn is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. This will be her 2nd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support extended members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future

loans.name: Srey

texts.en:
Mrs. Srey S., 44, and her husband, Mr. Thon Chim, 51, live across the Mekong River about seventeen kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have three children - two sons and one daughter. One of their children is married (and lives outside of the family home) and other two attend school. 

As a farmer, Mr. Thon Chim grows rice and vegetables. He also buys surplus rice from fellow villagers to resell to a middleman.  Mrs. Srey S. sells beef at the local market and assists her husband with his farming business. Mrs. Srey S. is asking for her first loan of $700.  The loan will be used in her husband's business of purchasing surplus rice for resale.

loans.use: to purchase surplus rice for resale

loans.name: Marieli Cumanda

texts.es:
La Señora. Marieli I. es socia del banco comunal Damas Responsables, vive en el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es hermosa por su centro histórico, por sus 4 ríos que la bañan, su naturaleza, su gastronomía, su gente y sus tradiciones.

Doña Marieli tiene 35 años, está separada y ha concebido un hijo de 7 años de edad que estudia en una escuela de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
Ella se dedica a la compra y venta de sombreros de paja toquilla, esta actividad la inicio hace un mes.  Nuestra socia es toda una profesional ya que estudio para  auxiliar de enfermería y administración de empresa, pero por el momento no está ejerciendo.

Se encuentra en su primer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal al cual fue invitada por su tía. El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de sombreros para crecer en su negocio. Sus metas son estabilizarse económicamente, encontrar un trabajo para ejercer su profesión y comprarse un vehiculo.
texts.en:
Sra. Marieli I. is a member of the Communal Bank “Damas Responsables” (Responsible Women). She lives in central Cuenca, a beautiful city that is known for its historical center, the four rivers that surround it, its natural surroundings, its cuisine, its people and their traditions.

Doña Marieli is 35 years old, separated from her spouse, and has a seven year old son who attends school in the city. She does not own a home and currently lives in a rental property.

Marieli buys and sells Panama hats, a business she started a month ago. She is a professional since she studied nursing and business administration, but at the moment she is not pursuing either career.

This is her first loan with the Communal Bank after being invited to join by her aunt. The money from this loan will be invested in the purchase of hats to grow her business. Her goals are to become financially stable, find a job in her field of study, and purchase a vehicle.

loans.use: To purchase Panama hats.

loans.name: Selfha

texts.en:
Selfha S. is from the village of Kinura, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 38 years old. Selfha is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, soap and beverages in the local community. She is also selling vegetables like ampalaya (bitter melon) and bananas. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $175 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Selfha joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. 

Selfha is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods and snack foods. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and snack foods

loans.name: Go Before Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Go Before” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in order to invest in their businesses. 

Isatu C. is the leader of this group. Isatu is 65 years old and married, with five children. Three are in primary school and two are in secondary school. 

Isatu sells dishes, cups, pots, etc., and has been doing this business for 35 years now. With the help of this loan, Isatu will invest in her business by buying the above mentioned items in large quantity to add to her current stock.  

(Also included in the right of the photo is loan officer Zainab B. handing over the loan to the borrowers.)

loans.use: to buy dishes, cups, pots, etc., in large quantity to add to her current stock

loans.name: Samiya

texts.en:
Samiya, 26-year-old mother of five, lives in Israel's Negev region. She learned the art of sewing pillows and specialty Bedouin mattresses from her mother and grandmother. When young couples are married, it is tradition to help them furnish their homes with these pillows and mattresses. Samiya began her business of creating these pillows and mattresses from her home and has gained a reputation for creating beautiful products.

Samiya needed this loan to purchase raw materials such as wool, cloth, thread as well as additional gifts for customers to buy.

Through this loan Samiya has begun to branch out into additional gifts such as perfumes & cosmetics. She wants to continue to expand, add another sewing machine and in the next five years move to a central location outside of her home.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as wool, cloth and thread as well as additional gifts for customers to purchase.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing and fish-vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for the past three years. Aida also earns an income from running a general store. 

Aida has been sustaining her fishing business through her own efforts and with the help of loans from NWTF. She is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase fishing net and other fishing equipment. In the future, Aida hopes to save money to expand her business and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase fishing net and fishing equipment

loans.name: Cruz Carmelina

texts.es:
La Señora. Cruz es socia del banco comunal Mujeres Floreciendo, vive por la parroquia de Paccha, lugar en donde su gente se dedica a la cría de animales, agricultura y elaboración de artesanías, mucha de su población labora en la ciudad en diferentes áreas.
 
La Señora. Cruz tiene 56 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad, su primer hijo es  casado e independiente, su segundo hijo esta estudiando en el colegio, trabaja y le ayuda económicamente. Su esposo labora prestando sus servicios como guardia de seguridad, con el trabajo conyugal han logrado construir su casa propia.

Doña Cruz se dedica a la venta de bocaditos de dulce, a la venta de ropa y también cría pollo a los que los vende pelados a sus clientes. Todos sus productos los vende recorriendo la ciudad.

 En el banco comunal esta hace 8 años y todos los créditos le han beneficiado en sus negocios. Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de pollos, ropa y bocaditos de dulce.

Su sueño es viajar a las Estados Unidos de America.
texts.en:
Cruz is a member of the “Mujeres Floreciendo” (Women in Bloom) communal bank.  She lives around Paccha Parish whose residents raise animals, farm and make crafts.  Many of its residents work in the city in various jobs.

Cruz is 56 years old and has two adult children.  Her oldest son is married and independent and her second son is in high school, employed and helps her economically.  Her husband works providing security guard services.  Their joint effort has led to the construction of their house.

Cruz sells sweet snacks, clothes and she also raises chickens to sell dressed to her customers.  She sells all her products as a street vendor throughout the city.

She’s been in the communal bank for 8 years and all the loans have benefitted her business.  The new loan will be used to buy chickens, clothes and sweet snacks.  Her dream is to travel to the United States of America.

loans.use: to buy clothes, chickens and sweet snacks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase piglets and to construct a pig pen to hold them.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel trabaja atendiendo  en un snack de venta de te, café y masitas. El crédito lo requiere para la cancelación de pensiones  ya que ella estudia en un Instituto la carrera de Contabilidad. Vive en casa de sus padres  la misma queda ubicada en la zona de Villa Ingenio en la ciudad de El Alto, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en: Maribel serves in a snack bar selling tea, coffee and pastries.  She needs this loan to pay her tuition fees as she is studying for a degree in accountancy.  She lives in her parents' home which is in Villa Ingenio district, in the city of El Alto.  She is single and doesn't have any children.  This is the first time that she has obtained a loan from IMPRO.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees so that she can continue studying accounting

loans.name: Héctor Emilio

texts.es:
A sus 59 años Héctor trabaja diariamente hasta las 12 de la media noche para sacar adelante a su familia, es padre de 2 hijos y desde hace 20 años dueño de una salsamentaria muy reconocida en por los habitantes de su barrio y barrios aledaños, no sólo por los años de experiencia si no también por que Héctor siempre se ha preocupado por brindar un buen servicio ya que es conciente que así sus clientes serán fieles al negocio.

Héctor sueña con que su microempresa sea el legado que pueda dejarle a sus nietos, dándole a su familia estabilidad económica y mejorando generosamente su calidad de vida. Se siente orgulloso de su negocio pero está en una constante lucha por ser cada vez mejor, por que sus clientes lo prefieran y por que el servicio sea completamente satisfactorio, y expresa que hasta el día de hoy lo ha logrado, sin embargo en estos momentos su negocio presenta negocios en sanidad, motivo por el cual deberá realizar adecuaciones locativas que se le están exigiendo y que sabe son necesarias para el buen funcionamiento de su negocio pero en este momento el no cuenta con el capital para realizar dichas adecuaciones, y solicita un préstamo que le ayude a mejorar su situación actual.
texts.en:
Héctor, age 59, works every day until 12 midnight in order to get his family ahead.  He has two children.  He has had a cured meats shop for 20 years.  It is widely known by the inhabitants of his neighborhood and bordering neighborhoods.  It is well-known not only for his years of experience, but also because Héctor always concerns himself with providing good service.  He does this because he is aware that this way his customers will be loyal to his business.

Héctor dreams that his small business will be the legacy that he will give his grandchildren.  This will give the family financial stability and will generously improve their quality of life.  He is proud of his business, but he is in a constant struggle to be continually better.  He does this so that his customers will prefer him because his service is completely satisfactory.  He has now achieved this.  

Nevertheless, he has some health department requirements he needs to fulfill. He knows that they are necessary so that his business functions well.  However, he does not now have the capital to make said adaptations.  He is requesting a loan the help him improve his current situation.

loans.use: to make adaptations to his business.

loans.name: Burmaa

texts.en: Mrs. Burmaa, age 57, is a woman who is trying to make repairs to her apartment because of the old and dangerous living conditions. She lives with her husband and both are retirees. This borrower has worked as an accountant in a water management company and now she receives a grant amounting to only MNT 270,474 a month. It is not enough to make repairs to her home. Therefore, she is taking a loan to purchase some building materials to repair her apartment. She says ”Thank you so much for supporting me to improve my living conditions.”

loans.use: To purchase building materials to repair her apartment.

loans.name: Marylou

texts.en:
Marylou is 27 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with children. 

Marylou has a shop that sells T-shirts, blouses & underwear. She has had this business for three years. She requested a loan of PHP 13,000 to buy additional clothes & beauty products from NATASHA.

Marylou has been a member of HSPFI since 2010. In the future, Marylou hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy additional clothes & beauty products from NATASHA.

loans.name: Baasansuren

texts.en:
Baasansuren is 37 years old and a specialist of auto monitoring. She is a divorced woman and now lives with her two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Her older daughter Ganzaya is a college student, and her younger daughter is 5 years old and likes music very much.

Baasansuren has requested a loan equivalent to $1,200 USD. It will be dedicated as an additional funding to start a new beauty salon business. It takes a lot of equipment and products to start a beauty service. Currently she is almost prepared to open her salon, which is very clean and comfortable with modern scenery. 

She plans to hire some beauticians for her business. She has a little bit of a financial issue and currently she can’t purchase some necessary equipment and other commodities. She will use her loan to buy the equipment she needs to open a beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy the equipment she needs to open a beauty salon.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en:
Esi is a single parent taking care of three children. She makes millet porridge to sell. She serves it with fried doughnuts. Her business is about three years old. Esi will use the loan to purchase additional millet, sugar and others to cook to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Esi plans to reinvest back into the business. 

To prepare her porridge, she first gets her millet, removes unwanted particles from it, and washes it.  She adds local spices such as ginger and pepper to taste.  She sends the millet to the mill to be milled into powder.  After returning from the mill, she adds water to the resulting flour to make dough. She leaves it for a couple of hours before using the dough to make porridge. She heats water to the boiling point and mixes the dough into the water to get a porridge-like consistency. She gradually pours the dough into the heated water, stirring continuously to prevent it from forming lumps. The porridge only has to cook for a couple of minutes and then it is ready to be served. Millet porridge goes with bread of any kind and fried doughnuts.

loans.use: to purchase additional millet, sugar and other items to cook to sell.

loans.name: Moises

texts.es: El señor Moisés, se dedica a la producción de leche y también trabaja en la alcaldía como tractorista y sus hijos le ayudan con labores agrícolas. El crédito lo requiere para la comprar un par de vacas lecheras para así poder aumentar la producción de leche y sus ingresos. Vive en casa propia ubicado en la localidad de Achacachi  del departamento de La Paz;  es casado y tiene dos hijos. Es la Primera vez que solicita un crédito en IMPRO y en Kiva.
texts.en: Moisés is a dairy farmer and also works for the city as a tractor operator; his children help him with his farming chores.  He needs the loan to buy a pair of dairy cows to increase milk production and income.  He lives in his own house located in Achacahi, La Paz Department.  He’s married and has two children.  This is the first time he’s requested a loan in IMPRO and in Kiva.

loans.use: to buy a pair of dairy cows.

loans.name: Luis Roberto

texts.es:
Luis Roberto es un luchador que desde hace 20 años tiene su propio negocio de construcción donde genera 4 empleos directos. Es padre de 2 hijas y su mayor sueño es que a futuro ambas sean profesionales, para ello trabaja día a día con la ilusión de progresar y mejorar su calidad de vida.

Actualmente Luis Roberto necesita comprar una máquina para mezclar,  herramienta de trabajo básica para agilizar sus procesos de construcción, y mejorar la calidad de los proyectos terminados, pero no cuenta con el capital suficiente para esta inversión por lo que solicita un crédito con el cual dar un paso más hacia el progreso.
texts.en:
Luis Roberto is a tenacious man who has had his own construction firm for the last 20 years that generates four actual employment opportunities.  He’s the father of two daughters and his greatest dream is that in future both of them will be professionals.  He works daily with the dream of making progress and improving his quality of life.

At present, Luis Roberto needs to buy a cement mixer, a basic work tool that makes the construction process easier and improves the quality of his completed jobs.  But he lacks sufficient capital to make this investment and this is why he’s asking for a loan to take another step toward progress.

loans.use: to buy a small cement mixer.

loans.name: Sughran's Group

texts.en:
Sughran is married and her husband is an employee in a private company. His earnings are insufficient for the whole family and that’s why Sughran started clothes sewing business few years ago. She is very skillful and receives good number of orders every month. She has another business which is selling rice. She purchases rice from different cities and sells to her community customers and grocery stores for profit. 

She is the mother of 3 sons and a daughter. Her sons are college students while her daughter is studying in class 7th. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her rice selling business. She will invest the loan money in purchasing rice in a bulk quantity that will allow her to offer good quality rice to her customers which will increase her sales and profits. 

She is very much experienced in her business and has been operating it for past 9 years. She is confident that an investment will bring positive changes to her business and help her family to live a better financial life. 

She is a new loan applicant of Asasah and this is her first loan application. 
Note: "In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Sughran".

loans.use: to buy rice for selling.

loans.name: Marlon Antonio

texts.es: Marlon Antonio tiene su negocio que es la compra y venta de plátano. Desde hace mas de 4 años que tiene este medio de vida, surgió como una alternativa de trabajo para sobrevivir últimamente se ha incrementado las ventas de pues cuenta con su clientela, lo que le ha favorecido para poder incrementar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Marlon ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de platano, pues recientemente le han ofrecido un buen precio de este producto.
texts.en: Marlon Antonio buys and sells bananas. He has been doing this work for more than 4 years which came about as an alternative form of work in order to survive. Recently sales have increased as he has regular customers he can count  on to help improve his earnings and his family's quality of life. Marlon has asked for a loan to buy bananas as recently he has been offered a good price for this product.

loans.use: to buy bananas.

loans.name: Belen Group

texts.es:
DUO BELEN
Este DUO  está formado por María Ofelia, de 25 años es la lider de este duo ella es soltera y desde muy pequeña se dedicò  a la  venta de ropa típica ella nos cuenta que necesita el crédito  porque se acerca la temporada en la cual la venta de ropa es muy rentable,entonces ella nececita el credito para la compra de ropa tipica,y asi de la misma manera seguir con su negocio también està  doña María de Jesus, de 45 años, casada, tiene 3 hijos y ella vende refacciones los fines de semana en la Aldea donde vive y también vende ropa típica en el Mercado, desde hace 20 años, nos cuenta que solicita este crédito porque necesita invertir en su negocio, ya que la gente le está pidiendo y ella no tiene, además dice que   en el mes de septiembre ella puede comprar ropa porque después es màs difícil encontrar variedad,  ya no hay colores ni estilos porque la mayoría de gente compra para venderla en la época navideña por eso necesita el crédito ya que ahora encuentra a buen precio todavía la ropa y si no compra ahora pueda que después no encuentre o la encuentre muy cara, por lo tanto espera que FAPE pueda apoyarla a poder agrandar su negocio y poder tener ganancias en este buena época además necesita seguir apoyando a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
This pair includes María Ofelia who is 25 years old, single, and the group leader. Just a short time ago, she started selling traditional clothing. She says that she needs a loan because the upcoming season in which she sells clothes is the most profitable. Therefore, the money will be used to buy traditional clothing.

Likewise, Doña María Jesus wants to continue with her business. She is 45 years old, married, and has three children. María Jesus sells spare parts on the weekends in the neighborhood where she lives. She also has been selling traditional clothing at the market for 20 years. María Jesus says she needs this loan to invest in her business because people are requesting products she does not have. She says that is was easier for her to buy clothes in the month of September because afterwards it will get difficult to find a variety of colors and styles because many people are buying what they can to sell for the Christmas season. María Jesus needs a loan now while prices are still affordable. If she waits, then the products she wants will either not be available or be offered at a much higher price. For this reason, she hopes that FAPE will assist her so that she can expand her business and generate income during this good season. She also needs to continue supporting her children with their studies.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 27 years old and married. She has four children, two of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Maribel has a business buying and selling DVDs in the Philippines. Maribel requested a PHP 11000 loan through NWTF to buy more DVDs and CDs to sell to customers.

Maribel has been in this business for six years. In the future, Maribel would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more DVDs and CDs to sell to customers.

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en: Bakari is taking out another Kiva loan of KES 50,000 to boost her retail shop business. With the loan she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sacks of beans and wheat flour. Bakari is giving thanks to Yehu and Kiva Lenders for giving her loan to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sacks of beans and wheat flour.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.en:
In his native country, the Dominican Republic, Jorge worked at an electronics business where he was twice recognized as the most innovative employee at the company. He then moved to Mexico to study electronics and satellite systems before relocating to the United States in search of more opportunities. Jorge started working at a company that specializes in building alarm systems—this is where he got the idea to launch his own electronics business. 

Four years later, Jorge’s business offers five core services including security system installation, computer repair, POS system installation, soap distribution, and marketing services for small businesses through his television programs with two TV channels in Boston. Jorge’s son works with him part-time to install alarm systems at local businesses. Today, Jorge is growing his business to serve clients in additional neighborhoods of Boston and was recently recognized as Latino Business Person of the Year by the North Shore Business Association. The impacts of the recession on other businesses have encouraged Jorge to expand and innovate by trading services with other small businesses in his area.

After attending a financial management workshop with Accion USA, Jorge applied for a loan and is using it to purchase cameras, cables, screens and other equipment in bulk. Purchasing large quantities of inventory will help keep costs down, as well as help Jorge grow his business.

loans.use: To purchase cameras, cables, and screens.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 48 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Teresita is providing "motorela" or "habal-habal" (motorcycle transport) services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy tools for maintenance & pay for gasoline.

Teresita has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Teresita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools  for maintenance & pay for gasoline.

loans.name: Lerma

texts.en:
Lerma and her husband are farmers who live in Afusing Daga. They have been planting rice to sell since they got married 15 years ago. The income from the business was used for their daily consumption for meals and allowances for her three children. She would like to improve her sales so she is asking for an additional capital to buy farm inputs necessary in ensuring good crops. With the loan of P10,000 she is asking for, she will buy fertilizers, pesticides and insecticides used in farming. 

Someday, through their patience, hard work and unity, they will upgrade their family's poor living condition.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs for use in farming

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en:
Claudia is a 51-year-old married woman with four children. She and her husband are both farmers. They own and till a piece of land in their town in Trinidad, Bohol. According to Claudia, they have been growing and selling rice for 10 years. Each month, they earn 6,000 PHP per month doing this farming. Claudia does her best to support her family.

Claudia has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers and pay for labor. Claudia hopes to achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pay for labor.

loans.name: Mauricio

texts.es:
Mauricio se ha dedicado a la actividad de la reparación de motocicletas desde hace aproximadamente 15 años, gracias a que su familia se ha dedicado también a esta actividad, por lo que la aprendió desde temprana edad y esto le ha favorecido en la gran experiencia que tiene. Mauricio se encuentra casado y es padre de 1 hijo de 7 años, el cual siempre ha sido su motivación para trabajar fuertemente en su negocio todos los días. Mauricio tiene su negocio de reparación de motocicletas en una muy buena ubicación, lo que le permite atender a muy buena cantidad de clientes. Debido al poco espacio de su negocio, este comúnmente repara las motocicletas en la calle, lo que a veces le presenta inconvenientes con las autoridades del espacio público. Mauricio, debido a que montó su negocio con muy bajo capital, no ha podido comprar todas las herramientas que requiere, es por esto que espera que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de herramientas de mano, además de lubricantes, aceite y entre otros insumos más para su taller.

Mauricio espera poder obtener estas herramientas e insumos que requiere sin tener que hacer que sus ingresos mensuales se vean afectados. Además, Mauricio espera que su negocio le brinde la posibilidad de ofrecerle a su hijo el acceso a una ecuación de mejor calidad y en un futuro el acceso a una educación universitaria.

loans.use: Compra de herramientas de mano, además de lubricantes, aceite y entre otros insumos más para su taller.

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe est créé depuis juillet 2011.Il est composé de membres qui habitent le même village,elles ont comme activité l'agriculture,le commerce de marchandise comme le sucre.

Maguette qui se trouve à droite de la photo,habillée en blanc et levant la main,est la responsable du groupe,elle est mariée et mére de 04 enfants dont 02 filles.

Avec son prêt,elle compte acheter 05 sacs de 50kg de mil à 250f le kg,02 sacs de sucre à raison de 5500f le kg et 03 bidons de 20litres d'huile.

Son objectif est de renforcer son épargne et contribuer aux charges de la maison.
texts.en: This group was created in July 2011. Its members all live in the same village. Their main activities are agriculture and selling their produce, which includes sugar. Maguette, pictured to the right of the photograph, dressed in white with her hand raised, is the group representative. She is a married mother of two sons and two daughters. With this loan, she is planning on buying five 50 kg sacks of millet, costing 250 francs per kilo, two sacks of sugar, costing 5500 francs per kilo, and three 20-litre containers of oil. Her goal is to build up her savings and to contribute to her family's expenses.

loans.use: to purchase millet, sugar and oil

loans.name: Manit

texts.en:
Manit is a local villager who lives in the Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She is 19 years old and single. She has been growing rice for four years.
She has been with VisionFund for three cycles, through the previous it has help her lifestyle to be better. And she is looking for a new loan of 3,000,000 KHR. She will use this loan to purchase fertilizers and also spend a portion of it for gasoline to pump the water into her farmland. She hopes to make more crops from her farmland.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Diantoyerela 1 Group

texts.fr:
Les  7 membres du groupe  DIANTOYERELA 1sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 39ans, 3 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à  FALABA un des villages de Dogo 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur 4ème prêt de campagne avec l’institution.
L’arachide est la spéculation cultivée à l’image de  BINTOU, 3ème personne debout de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectares. 
La production est vendue au niveau de  FALABA après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice moyen de  75.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.

loans.use: Frais de labour, achat d’intrants et  de semence

loans.name: Marc

texts.en:
Marc is 26 years old. He is married with one child who has 3 years, not yet go to school. He is a farmer and he has been doing for the past 3 years. With the loan from kiva, he would like to pay the workers who harvested beans. The profits from the business will be used to improve in his business and buy food for home consumptions.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay the workers who harvested beans.

loans.name: Darling Nancy

texts.es:
Darling es propietaria de una pupusería, es casada, vive con su esposo y un pequeño hijo de 4 años de edad, su esposo es empleado, la pareja trabaja muy duro para salir adelante pues no tienen otro tipo de ingresos, su negocio inicio por la necesidad de más ingresos familiares, trabaja de cuatro de la tarde a ocho de la noche.
Ella está solicitando un crédito para tener un mejor inventario en su negocio, comprara aceite, verduras, maíz, harina, quesillo, etc., para preparar la venta de pupusas sin inconvenientes y satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes, ella pretende generar más ingresos para cambiar las circunstancias familiares.
Su objetivo es mejorar su negocio y atraer a nuevos clientes

loans.use: comprara aceite, verduras, maíz, harina, quesillo, etc., para preparar la venta de pupusas sin inconvenientes

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Mrs. Doris O. lives in a semi-urban area in Edo State, Nigeria.  She is married with two children and is 48 years of age. A dedicated LAPO client, she learnt her business for three months before opening hers in 1997. She asks for the above amount for the expansion for her business.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Donato would like to invest in fertilizer and pesticides for his rice and plantain farm as well as send his three grand children to school

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
My name is Margarita O. and I sell natural fruit ice bars and refreshments. I have had my business for about two years. Business is doing well since the city that I live in reaches very high temperatures and people usually eat ice bars and chilled natural refreshments. Mi goal is to increment inventory in order to have bigger sales. With the extra earnings I'll be able to cover my home's expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Mi nombre es Margarita O. me dedico a la venta de paletas y refrescos de frutas naturales, tengo mi negocio hace unos 2 años en el cual es muy bueno porque en la ciudad que vivo la temperatura es muy alta y la gente acostumbra a comer paletas y tomar refrescos naturales helados, mi meta es incrementar mi inventario para tener mayores ventas y con las ganancias que obtenga poder cubrir con los gastos de mi hogar.

loans.use: Purchase fruits, water, sugar, ice bars, artificial colors and flavors.

loans.name: Domingo

texts.es:
Business Description

Don José dedicates himself to the sale of encebollados, a traditional Ecuadorian dish, from his home and as a street vendor. He has 20 years of experience in this type of business , working every day of the week, from 6am to 11 am. His daughter takes charge of the business at home while he goes out to sell.

Loan Use

José needs the loan to improve his business at home and while selling as a street vendor by improving the aesthetics as a way to differentiate himself from the competition. As a result of his daily effort and due to the level of his customer base, José needs to upgrade his business.

Personal Information

José is 52 years old and lives with his wife and 3 adult children. His daughter is responsible for the business at home and his wife is a homemaker. His goals are to refurbish his home with safe and sound materials and to generate more income as a way to improve his family's well-being.

Descripción del Negocio

Don José se dedica a la venta de encebollados tanto en su domicilio como ambulantemente, teniendo como experiencia 20 años, trabajando en este tipo de negocio, abriendo el local muy temprano en la mañana desde las 6am hasta las 11am, todos los días de la semana. En la cual su hija le ayuda con la atención del negocio en el domicilio y José en la calle ambulantemente.

Uso del Préstamo

José necesita el préstamo para adecuar su negocio, tanto en su domicilio como el que tiene ambulantemente, ponerlo mas bonito y agregarle detalles que lo hagan diferente a la competencia. Además por el nivel de clientela que ha llegado a tener, José necesita adecuar el negocio, como resultado del esfuerzo realizado tras el día a día de trabajo.

Información Personal

En la actualidad José tiene 52 años de edad, en donde vive junto a su esposa y a sus 3 hijos pero todos de mayoría de edad, ya quien le ayuda en el negocio es su hija y su esposa es ama de casa. Los anhelos de José es incrementar su negocio y redecorar su domicilio con materiales estables y fuertes, a más de generar otros ingresos, por el bienestar de su familia.

loans.use:
Better the appearance of his business

Mejorar la aparencia de su negocio

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya O.  was born in the Xacmaz district. She is 61 years old and a mother of five children. Right now she lives with her family in Sumgayit city, situated in the east part of Azerbaijan. 

She started her business of selling industry goods with $300 in 2002.. At first, she was selling industry goods and earned little money. This money was enough for only some of her family's basic needs. She had difficulty in covering necessities such as medication, clothes, and school, etc. Now, she wants improve her business, increase her number of  clients, and increase her income.

Mariya needs a $600 loan. With this loan Mariya wants to buy men's suits to sell through her private trade located in the central market. This will help her expand her business. 

Mariya believes this change will expand and improve the living conditions of her family. She will repay the loan within 12 months and on a monthly basis. Mariya cherishes all the help she hopes to receive.

loans.use: To buy men's suits and industry goods to sell in the central market.

loans.name: Judite

texts.pt:
Judite Jacinto M. is married and has 5 children. The oldest son is 18 years old and the youngest 9. She was born on April 29th 1972 in the Boane District in the province of Maputo. She was raised by her parents and studied until the 6th grade. At the age of 16 she moved in with her husband and started a small business. She joined the Gueguegue and GGLS credit programs before, but they only offered loans to groups and group members were responsible for payments of others.

She was introduced to Hluvuku-Adsema through friends and requested a loan to invest on her business. With the loan of 15.000mt Judite plans to increase her inventory. She buys goods in Swaziland and sells them to the Burundese. She manages her business with her son. With income for the business she supports the schooling of her younger children. In the future, Judite plans on increasing her inventory and opening another store.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localizaçao : Bairro 03 Gueguegue Cliente : Judite Jacinto M. Actividade : Comercio Valor de empréstimo : 15.000,00 MT ( 600.00 USS) Aplicação : compra e venda de produtos alimentatres Inicio: 05-11-07 Fim: 27-02-09

Judite Jacinto M., casada maritalmente ,tem 5 filhos ,o mais velho tem 18 anos e mais novo 9 anos ,tem 35 anos de idade ,nasceu a 29 de Abril de 1972 no distrito de Boane ,província de Maputo ,viveu com os pais ate aos 16 anos ,estudou ate 6ªclasse e ainda com os seus 16 anos conheceu o seu marido e passou a viver com ele ,depois começou a exercer um pequeno negocio de venda de produtos alimentares como forma de ajudar nas despesas familiares. Teve o 1ºcontacto de empréstimo com as Associações de credito que funcionam no bairro vizinho de Gueguegue e outra, G.G.L.S, ambas ofereciam créditos em grupos, não tendo sido uma boa experiência porque para alem dos valores financiados serem menores tinham de assumir responsabilidade de pagar o empréstimo em casos de um dos elementos do grupo não efectuar o pagamento .

Conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema através das amigas tendo aproximado e solicitado o seu 1º empréstimo para ampliação do seu negocio . Com o credito de 15.000,00 mt pretende aumentar o stock dos produtos no seu negocio .Actualmente esta explorando um estabelecimento e as vezes vai a Swaziland comprar outros produtos e faz entrega aos Burundeses.Ela dirige pessoalmente o negocio e na sua ausença o filho é que tem tomado conta do mesmo e com os rendimentos do negocio suporta os encargos escolares dos seus filhos . No futuro pretende aumentar mais mercadoria e abrir outro estabelecimento comercial.

loans.use: To buy stock to increase her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase merchandise and improve her work space.

loans.name: Porfiria

texts.en:
Porfirio Patino is a 61-year-old woman who is married to Enriques Amarilla, a mason and bricklayer. His work helps with the income and covers the house expenses; however, his work alone was not enough to raise their two children. Porfiria took the initiative to begin her own business so that she too could earn money to raise her children. Together she and husband created a business plan and used some of her husband’s earnings to establish a simple grocery store with the basic necessities.

Since it was located in a neighborhood which lacked a grocery store, it began to grow. Today it is called Porfi’s Grocery and through great efforts it is now a profitable business venture, one which helped provide for their children. It is still the only grocery shop in the area and they have gained a great amount of clients.

Thanks to Porfirio’s dedication, the earnings of the shop have allowed her two children to attend high school. Porfirio and her husband have an image of what their children’s future should be and hope that they will also work hard and invest wisely. Porfirio is asking for a loan to invest in the shop. Merchandise like oil, sugar, flour, pasta, along with assorted breads and dairy products are needed to keep the business and their income growing.

loans.use: To buy goods such as oil, breads, pasta, flour, etc.

loans.name: Sahib

texts.en: Sahib K. is a 49-year-old farmer who lives with his wife and three children in the small village of Saatli region. He has eight years of experience in farming. Now he needs $1100 USD to purchase one cow for $600 USD and two baby calves for an estimated $250 USD each.

loans.use: To purchase one cow and two baby calves

loans.name: Lang

texts.en:
Mrs. Lang H., 56, is a mother of five children and lives with her husband in Bathambong province, Cambodia. She works making a local food called "nem" (a sour roll made of hashed meat (usually pork and fish) wrapped and cooked in green banana leaves), which is favored by the Cambodian people. With this business activity, she can typically make around $5 each day in revenue.

Her husband also helps to generate the family income by working as a carpenter and normally earns about $5 each day of income. Two of her children work with her, helping her to make nem. The other three are married and stay outside the family’s home.

Mrs. Lang H. has applied for a loan to expand her business. Another part of the loan is to repair her oven.

loans.use: To expand her business and repair her oven.

loans.name: Denia María

texts.en:
Denia María, 38 years old and the mother of five school-going children, sells shoes, pants, blouses and underwear in the Batey of Palavé community of San Cristobal.  
The entrepreneur explains that while it is hard to support five children, she hopes that her business’ growth will help her face all financial issues and proviD. a comfortable lifestyle for her family.
With her loan, Denia María will buy more goods to add to her stock in order to increase her sales volume and consequently her revenue.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing to resell in her community.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice G. is a fishmonger in Ghana.  She is a single mother with one child. Each day, she buys fresh fish from the fishermen and brings the produce home for processing.
