She then resells the fish to her customers. Because her business has been successful, Alice wants to increase her sales to meet the rising demands from her customers.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $525, which will be used to buy more fish for processing and resale.

loans.use: To buy more fish for processing and resale.

loans.name: Jhonny

texts.es:
Jhonny has three children who are in school or studying at the university. His wife has been working in Spain for the past two years. Jhonny and his family own the home they live in. He dedicates himself to fishing the local rivers, given he has several years of experience in this activity and he is knowledgeable of the business. He has two motorized boats with which he carries out his activities. There is not a lot of competition because to fish one must know the rivers and the area, in addition to being committed to the work. Jhonny’s success is based on his experience and dedication. Currently, he is a member of the Rio Yapacaní fishing association which grants him his fishing license. His loan request is to increase his capital so he can buy a Pentium-based computer, along with the necessary accessories (approximate cost is $700USD). He has a favorable loan history and only works with our institution.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn, Kiva Volunteer.

Jhonny tiene tres hijos de los cuales mantiene a sus hijas que se encuentran una estudiando en el colegio y la otra en la universidad, su esposa trabaja en España desde hace dos años. Jhonny y su familia viven en su casa propia. Se dedica a la pecas en ríos de la zona, ya lleva varios años de experiencia en esta actividad y sabe muy bien acerca del negocio, para este fin cuenta con dos motores y botes que le permiten desarrollarse en su actividad. La competencia no es mucha ya que para pescar se requiere de conocimiento del río y la zona, además de dedicación en el trabajo. El éxito de Jhonny se basa en la experiencia y dedicación. Actualmente es miebro de la asociación de pescadores Rio Yapacaní quienes le otrogan una licencia de pesca. La presente solicitud es incrementar capital para la compra de una computadora Pentium, con sus accessorios respectivos el costo aproximado es de $us. 700.-. Tiene buenos antecedentes crediticios y sólo trabaja con nuestra intitución.

loans.use: Purchase of a computer.

loans.name: Meri

texts.es:
Meri makes a living selling fruit. She and her husband watch out for the well being of their 6 children and together have been able get all of them ahead and take care of the smaller ones. Her husband works outside of the home but when he is home and has the time he helps Meri in whatever she needs, especially in work that requires physical labor. Meri wishes to get the loan so that she can purchase goods for the improvement of the space where she sells her fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva volunteer.

Meri se dedica a la venta de fruta, ella y su esposo velan por el bienestar de sus 6 hijos y juntos han sabido sacar adelante a todos y cuidar de los menores. Su esposo trabaja fuera de casa, pero cuando está y tiene el tiempo para hacerlo apoya en a Meri en lo que necesite, en especial en el trabajo de esfuerzo físico.Meri desea obtener el préstamo que solicita para la compra de mercadería, así como para mejorar el espacio donde conserva la fruta que vende.

loans.use: Funds to invest in her fruit sales business.

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.ru:
Mavjuda M. lives in the Vakhsh region of Tajikistan. She is married and has five children. Hers is a large and very happy and friendly family. Mavjuda manages a store where she sells national holiday costumes for boys. She also has wedding dresses which she rents out. Mavjuda has been managing the store for the last 3 years and would like to purchase additional wedding dresses as well as accessories for them. For this purposes she is planning to take out this loan which she will pay back in 8 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva volunteer

Мирзоева Мавджуда проживает в районе Вахш. Работает в магазине , где продает торжественные наряды для мальчиков . Кроме того имеет свадебные платья , которые cдает на прокат. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 3 года. Необходимо завезти новые платья , а так же аксессуары для нарядов . Но для этого нужно сначала получить кредит . Погашать кредит она планирует в течение 8 месяцев. У нее очень большая и дружная семья. Она замужем и имеет пятерых детей.

loans.use: Expanding inventory to increase sales

loans.name: Mai Thi

texts.vi: Mrs. Mai Thi L. is 34 years old. She joined TYM fund in 2004. She invested her first loan worth VND 1.5 million in trading and livestock raising. Since then, these businesses has brought about a stable income for the family. At present, apart from these businesses, she and her husband also work at local restaurants. With a income of VND 4.5 million/month, her family's economy is developing well. For the next loan cycle, she applies for VND 9 million to invest in trading and livestock raising.
texts.en:
Note: the original description is in English.

Translated from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to invest in trading and livestock raising.

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es: Celestina tiene 37 años, es natural de una zona llamada Capachica, es soltera y vive con su hijo Jhon de 14 años de edad.  La venta de golosinas es el trabajo al que se dedica, el cual viene realizando desde hace 20 años, pero hace 15 que logró poner su propio negocio.  Usualmente se levanta desde muy temprano para acomodar su pequeño puesto y comenzar la venta hasta las 7 de la noche, siendo muy productiva para ella. Lo que más le gusta, es la independencia que le da su trabajo, ya que ella decide a qué hora salir a vender, y retirarse si está muy cansada, no se le hace complicada su labor, la cual desempeña con alegría y buen humor.  Celestina quiere forjarle un futuro mejor a su hijo y que sea de provecho para la sociedad siendo un buen profesional.  Con el dinero obtenga con el préstamo, podrá comprar mayor mercadería para hacer que su negocio crezca y si Dios lo quiere, en el futuro, tener una tiendita de abarrotes.
texts.en:
Celestina is 37 years old, and she is a resident of the region called Capachia. She is single and she lives with her son Jhon, aged 14. Her business is selling sweets and snacks, and that has been her occupation for the last 20 years. But it was onl 15 years ago that she has had her own business. Usually she starts her day very early to set up her small stand before sales start and she keeps going until 7pm every night, she being a very hard worker. She says "What I like the most is the independence that her business gives me". She decides when she will go and start her sales and she can keep going until she is very tired. She doesn't find her work too difficult, in fact, she works always happily and with a good sense of humor. Celestina wishes to forge a better future for her son and she wants him to be a productive member of society, to be a hard working professional. With the loan she will purchase more merchandise to expand her business and God willing, in the future, she will have a convenience store of her own.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her inventory and with the earnings to set up a small convenience store.

loans.name: Baybala

texts.en: Baybala is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan's Fuzuli town and lives in the Fuzuli region's Zobcug village. He is 43 years old. This man has been in the tombstone business for 5 years. Baybala is married and has 3 children. Now he needs a loan of 800 AZN to buy materials for making tombstones.

loans.use: to buy materials for making tombstones

loans.name: Nul

texts.en:
Mr. Nul U. is a farmer in Trea village in Kandal Province. He owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. Pen Touch, is a rice middleman who buys rice to keep in stock and re-sell later at a better price. In her business, she usually pays a lot of money for motorbike taxi transport. Thus, Mr. Nul U. decided to request a loan to buy a motorbike for his wife’s business as transport to buy rice from the villagers.

He is 29 years old and the father of foU. children, two of whom are attending the local school, while the others are too young to work or study. His wife is also present with him in the picture.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for his wife’s business as transport to buy rice from the villagers.

loans.name: Jura

texts.en:
Jura A., a 47-year-old teacher by profession, is married with three children. Ten years ago, Jura saw a need for students to be able to buy used books and office supplies, so he opened a store which he operates with his loving family for this purpose. Jura has plentiful orders for a variety of books and office supplies, and now is applying to IMON for a loan to fulfill his orders. The well-being of Jura’s family and his business are in your hands, and they are sincerely grateful for your support.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes:  a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as  Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R. further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment, forcing hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia.  While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve the country’s agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. 

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients present a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase books and office supplies to expand the business.

loans.name: Pha's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is made up of four members, all residents in Sarikakeo Commune, Kandal Province. Mr. S. has been selected to be group leader by the group members. He is 29 years old and currently makes a living driving a motorbike taxi. He can earn an average of $3 per day from his business. He presently lives with his wife and his two children. Both of them are single and go to school, while his wife is employed as a garment worker.

To make additional income, S. is applying for a loan as capital to buy a trailer to connect to his existing motorbike and use it to transport fried meatballs to sell.

The other three borrowers are as follows:

S. earns a living by braiding mats for sale and she needs a loan to buy raw materials for her braiding.

S. is a mat maker and she is asking for a loan to buy more raw materials to make the mats for sale.

S. sells foods out of her home. She requests a loan for her husband to buy wood for his carpentry business.

loans.use: To buy a trailer

loans.name: Eang

texts.en: Eang S. is 47 years old (pictured here with her husband) and is a fish seller in a busy market. She has been operating this business since 2000 and is able to make $7 of profit every day. Her husband digs wells and makes $8 a day. Currently, she and her husband live with their two employed children. Eang S. is asking for a loan to create a new business selling spare parts. This will provide the family with additional income to raise their standard of living.

loans.use: setting up new business

loans.name: Mukamarhon

texts.ru: Мукарамхон активная клиентка Микроинвест. Получаемые ею займы и ее собственные деньги успешно оборачиваются в ее бизнесе и Мукарамхон довольна. Она по прежнему ездит за товаром  на дальние оптовые рынки. В ее бизнесе много трудностей, но Мукарамхон хорошо справляется. Она мечтает о тех временах, когда сможет накопить достаточно денег и приобрести маленький магазинчик и торговать там. Успешно погасив последний займ Мукарамхон решила обратиться за новым займом. Новый займ нужен для увеличения ассортимента легких летних тканей.
texts.en:
Mukaramhon is an active client of Microinvest. Cash flows thanks to the loans and her own money, which is why Mukaramhon is pleased. She still travels to faraway wholesale markets to purchase goods. Although her business isn't easy, she manages well. She dreams of the times when she would be able to save enough money for buying a small store. Having paid off her recent loan, Mukamarhon decided to apply for another loan, this time for increasing the assortment of light summer fabric.

Translated from Russian by Oksana Buranbaeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase light summer fabric

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda L. is a farmer. She raises pigs and grows rice. She is 53 years old and single. She is a strong woman and capable of doing hard chores like farming and harvesting. When she is not busy in her piggery and rice farm, she works as a photographer. She is working very hard to save money for her needs.

She wants to avail herself of a loan of Php 5,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy feed for her pigs. She will also use some of her loan to buy fertilizers for her farm. The loan will truly help her grow her pig business and improve the soil condition of her farm. In that way, she believes, she will have more harvest on her farm and better income from her pigs.

Merlinda is shown in the photo with her pigs. Some people may mistake her as a man because she dresses and behaves in very masculine manner.

CEVI is a nonprofit organization that helps people, especially the poor, to start and maintain their own business. CEVI provides their clients credit, training and insurance coverage to help their small businesses grow.

loans.use: To buy pig feed and fertilizer

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es:
La señora Isabel Cristina S. G. tiene 36 años vive en Asentamiento Humnao Aurora Díaz, distrito de Salaverry, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió hasta 3ro. de secundaria, abandonò los estudios debido a que se dedicò a trabajar para apoyar a sus hermanos menores. Tiene 03 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
Isabel se dedica a la venta de jugos, sándwich y gaseosas, al principio vendía marcianos, pero dejo el negocio para dedicarse a la venta de jugos en un triciclo, luego fue ampliando a la venta de sándwich y gaseosas, con las ganancias que obtuvo compro un kiosco de madera y una vitrina . Su negocio los desarrolla en el deposito de petróleo de Salaverry.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal “Las Auroras en Acción II”, lo invirtió en la compra de gaseosas.
Con el crédito de 400 soles, que será cancelado en  4 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de galletas y gaseosas .
Isabel sueña con terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Ms.Isabel Cristina S. G. is 36 years old and lives in the Aurora Díaz settlement, Salaverry district, Trujillo province, department of La Libertad, Perú. She studied until the third year of high school but abandoned her studies because she was dedicated to work to support her younger siblings. She has three children who are economically dependent on her. Isabel is dedicated to selling juices, sandwiches and soft drinks. At first she sold marcianos (fruit ice cream treats) but left the business to sell juices from a tricycle, then she increased the sale of sandwiches and soft drinks. With her earnings she purchased a wooden kiosk and a display case. Her business is located in the oil deposit of Salaverry. With the first loan of 300 soles that she received from the communal bank “Las Auroras en Acción II”, she invested in the purchase of soft drinks. With a credit of 400 soles, which will be repaid in 4 months, she will invest in the purchase of cookies and soft drinks. Isabel dreams of finishing the construction of her house.

Translated from Spanish by Helen Smith, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cookies and soft drinks

loans.name: Sou

texts.en: Sou S. was born in 1966 and is the mother of five children; all of whom are still single and work in different jobs. She currently sells a few soft drinks and cooked ingredients in the village. Mostly her clients are neighbors who live near her house. Her husband helps feed the family by working as an requirement worker. Recently, S. sold all her inventory so she is looking for a loan as capital to increase the quantity of inventory items to sell.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of inventory items to sell

loans.name: Maria Salvida

texts.en:
Maria Salvida lives in the rural village of Monguia Dupax Del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya with her family.  She is married to Rodrigo and gifted with two children: Mark Paolo - 7 years old and Allysa - 4 years old. As a parent, she believes that it is their responsibility to provide their children a better living and a good education.  For this, she and her husband are working hard to sustain their needs.

Salvie patiently raises ducks as their source of income.  Her business is good enough to meet their needs, but it requires a lot of time to take care of the birds.  She is now in need of additional capital of PHP 5,000 that she will use in providing feed for her ducks.  Furthermore, she would like to save for the future of their children through her business and doing her best.

loans.use: To buy feed

location.town: Monguia, Dupax Del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Sou

texts.en: Sou T., 45, is a village farmer who has been farming for more than nine years. Her husband, Duch Em, age 50, works with her in this sector. This couple has been blessed with four children: two are married and have already started new family homes, while the others are single. This coming rice-cultivating season, after the rains fall, Sou T. is applying for a loan as capital to grow a rice crop.

loans.use: To grow a rice crop.

loans.name: Geneveth

texts.en:
Geneveth V. is 29 years old, married with one child, and presently resides at Taguima, Tudela, Misamis Occidental.

Geneveth, with the help of her husband, is engaged in a barbecue and snack-vending business. She needs additional capital to purchase ingredients in order to meet the demands of her customers, mostly students of a nearby school. So she applied for a loan from Paglaum MPC amounting to Php 9,000. She plans to have a concrete store with enough capital and to have a decent house, too.

loans.use: To use as additional capital for her barbecue and snack-vending business

loans.name: Mirzofarid

texts.ru:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand”
      “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan. 
Мирзофариду 27 лет. Он женат имеет сына.  Жена домохозяйка,занимается пошивом женских платьев  на дому.Он имеет доход с услуги частного таксиста. Его машина марки Opel. На запрашиваемый кредит он хочет заменить чехлы сидений и провести ремонт мотора.
texts.en:
MLF “MicroInvest” is one of the leading microfinance organizations, rendering credit services to the population of Tajikistan. Following step of its development, MLF “MicroInvest” sees in transformation into Microloan Deposit-taking Organization. Therefore in October, 2008 MLF “MicroInvest” together with LLC “Frontiers” have founded Limited Liability Company Microloan Deposit-taking Organization “Arvand” “Arvand” being assignee of “MicroInvest, continues to carry out its mission which is to improve the standard of living of the population and create new opportunities for social and economic development by providing qualitative financial-technical services to entrepreneurs of Tajikistan.

Mirzofarid is 27 years old. He is married and has a son. His wife is a housewife, she sews women's dresses at home. He earns income from providing taxi services. He has a car which make is Opel. He wants to use the loan to change the covers of the seats and repair the engine.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair the car

loans.name: Benkadi 4 De (Benkadi Fofodiana) Group

texts.fr:
Les dix membres du groupe BENKADI 4 sont  des femmes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de 53 ans et 7 enfants. Elles vivent la plupart dans des familles polygames dans le village de FOFODIANA, commune de Tingolé, sous préfecture de FANA, 2ème région administrative du Mali.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso dans le but d’avoir un soutien financier pour la réalisation de leurs activités hivernales. Leurs activités sont axées sur la culture du sorgho de l’arachide et du haricot. Elles sont à leur cinquième expérience avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été remboursés à temps.
Ce nouveau prêt servira à acheter de l’engrais, de l’herbicide, des petits matériels agricoles et payer les frais de sarclage et de labour pour entretenir 22 hectares.
Une partie de leur production est auto consommée et l’autre partie est vendue sur les marchés de Tingolé, de Marka-Coungo et de Fana  à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 50 000FCFA après la campagne.
texts.en:
The ten members of the group BENKADI 4 are married women who average 53 years of age and 7 children.  The women live for the most part in polygamous families in the village of FOFODIANA, in the community of Tingolé, sub-prefecture of FANA (2nd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They are collaborating with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso with the goal of obtaining financial support to carry out their winter-time work, which revolves around growing sorghum, peanuts, and beans.  They are on their fifth experience with the institution.  The past loans were repaid on time. This new loan will be used to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and minor farm supplies and equipment and to cover the cost of weeding and labor for maintaining 22 hectares. A portion of their production is for their own consumption.  The other portion is sold to customers composed of men and women at the marketplaces of Tingolé, Marka-Coungo, and Fana. The group members plan on realizing an average profit of 50,000 francs CFA after the planting season.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Labor, fertilizer, herbicide, weeding, and sundry farming supplies and equipment

loans.name: Leab

texts.en:
Mrs. Leab S. is a farmer in Kgnauk Pong village in Takeo province. She owns a small piece of land on which she cultivates rice. Aside from this plantation, she sells Bro Houk in the local market (Bro Houk is a local spelling of "prahok" - crushed, fermented fish paste that is used as a condiment).

Mrs. Leab S. is a 41-year-old widow with four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others three are attending the local school. She is requesting a loan to buy pig feed and four piglets which she will raise to earn more income to support her family living. She hopes to increase her income and improve her family living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy four piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Andrew's Group

texts.en:
Andrew K. is the leader of his lending group in Jinja. He is 35 years old and married with two children, aged 6 years and 18 months. He has had a business running a computer café on Kutch Road in Jinja for one and a half years from which he makes 180,000 Ugandan shillings as weekly profits. In addition to providing Internet services, he offers photocopying, scanning and training services, hence making more profits. When Andrew was first employed, it was in this business. That is when he got the idea of starting his own business and it’s working for him. 

He needs a loan to help buy a photocopying machine for his business since this will continue to diversify the range of services he offers. He has a goal of expanding his business by buying more computers and building his family house and owning a farm. He is a hardworking and friendly man, which helps attract more customers to his business.

loans.use: Buying a photocopying machine for his business

loans.name: Marie Egidia

texts.en:
Egidia K. is 40 years old, married and has 6 children aged between 18 and 5 years old. Egidia has been in a business of a restaurant for 7 years and she employs 6 people in her restaurant working from 7h00 A.M to 9h00 P.M

After realizing that her investment is too low to get more profit, Egidia is requesting her first loan from Vision Finance Company s.a   for expanding her restaurant qualitatively and quantitatively. 

By receiving and using this loan, Egidia hopes to get more profit then with that profit, she hopes to help her husband to buy a house and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: For purchasing more foodstuff

loans.name: Josephine Akoth

texts.en:
Josephine is married to Samson and they have no children yet.

Josephine has been in the tailoring business for fourteen years. She was introduced to KADET through existing clients and she has no previous credit history. Josephine will use her loan to purchase additional fabric so that she can make more clothing and maximize her profits. 

The client's customers are mainly from the rural areas, and sees most of her customers on market days. With the extra profits she will develop a piece of land. Her hopes are to become a landlady. She believes she is hardworking.

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Josephine will use her loan to purchase additional fabric so that she can make more clothing and maximize her profits

loans.name: May

texts.en:
May is engaged in vending cooked snacks such as  fish balls, kikiams, hotdogs and refreshment drinks in their village. Aside from snacks, she also sells frozen foods like longganisa, tocino, hotdog and so on.  She is requesting a loan of PHP5,000 from the KIVA lenders to further expand her business. According to her, she will use the loan in purchasing more frozen foods and different snacks to sell.  This amount will help her make her business profitable.  

May is 26 years old.  She is married to Abraham, who works as a steel man in Manila.  She hopes that someday her husband will find a good job near their village.  May and her two children live in the village of Palattao, Naguilian, Isabela.

loans.use: Additional capital to expand her frozen food and snack food business.

loans.name: Mrs. Mach Chea Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Mach C. is a group leader of six members who all live in Ta Koam village in Takeo province.

Mrs. Mach C. is 26 years old and the mother of a child who is just 2 years old. Her husband, Mr. Chan Chorn, is a construction worker.

Mrs. Mach C. is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. She is also a pig breeder.

Since her pig breeding business is going well, Mrs. Mach C. wants to expand it by purchasing more piglets for breeding to earn more income.

loans.use: To buy more piglets to breed to earn more income.

loans.name: Marialie

texts.en:
Marialie B. is from the village of Salvacion , Kadingilan Bukidnon. She is 31 years old. Marialie is married and has 3 infant-aged children. To make a living, Marialie owns and operates a tailoring business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing specialty tailoring services to local community members. Marialie has been engaged in her business for over 3 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Marialie joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marialie successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles and thread. Marialie is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Marialie from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To expand her tailoring business

loans.name: Adenike

texts.en: Adenike sells foodstuffs at retail prices to her customers in her house. She is happy because she does not have to pay for stall rent. This is the high season for sales and she hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She has been in this business for a long time. She lives in Lagos state, Nigeria. Adenike is happily married with seven children. She is 33 years old. She hopes for a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Angela Teodora

texts.es: Ángela Teodora tiene 44 años de edad, tiene dos hijos a su cargo su actividad económica es la venta de bloques, hace más de seis años que se dedica a este negocio la ubicación es en su vivienda en donde ofrece tres tipos de bloque de los cual los ofrece por cantidades considerables, ya que anteriormente ella era docente y su salario no era lo suficiente para cubrir los gastos de su familia por lo que realizo muchos sacrificio para establecer este negocio ya que los financiamiento han sido de gran apoyo. Ella solicita este financiamiento para arena, cemento, piedrín. El sueño de Ángela es ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Ángela Teodora, 44, has two dependent children. For over 6 years now she has sold various types of cement blocks/bricks. She runs her business from her home and sells three types of block in large quantities. Previously, she was a teacher but her salary was insufficient to meet household needs. Through much sacrifice and effort she was able to set up this business; the financing was of great help. She is requesting this loan to buy sand, cement, gravel. Ángela's dream is to expand her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Guldane

texts.en: Guldane I. is a 55-year-old retired accountant. Ten years ago, Guldane started keeping poultry, and her geese and chickens are most popular in the area where she’s living.  Guldane is married and has three children. She works hard to provide them with the best education and make savings from all her income. But it is very hard to cover the basic needs of her family and at the same time put some money aside. Her profit is small and just enough for food. Guldane applied for a 1200 AZN loan to purchase more poultry and increase her income. Let's do our best to help this hard-working woman.

loans.use: purchase more chickens and geese to increase profit

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en:
Dolores R., 44, is making sure that her family has enough provisions for their daily needs. Married to Rolando R., a pedicab driver, they are blessed with one child. Dolores makes sure that she helps her husband earn an income so that their family can have a better life.  She has been selling ready-to-wear clothes and assorted cosmetics for two years.

Dolores has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation* (CCT) for more than seven years now. She regularly attends their weekly fellowship meetings and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with previous loans, she has been able to borrow 20 times from CCT’s Cooperative.  She is consistent in paying her dues because she uses the money she borrows to buy added stock for her business.   Her two businesses let her earn a profit of PHP 10,000 per month.  

Now with your help, she would like to apply for a PHP 24,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital to her expanding businesses by buying assorted clothes and cosmetics products.

She dreams that her businesses will continue to grow so that they can help in providing for her family’s increasing needs. 


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: buying assorted clothes and cosmetics products for her business

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 25-year-old single man who lives with his mother and eight brothers and sisters. He works with them to generate a good income for the family and provide a better standard of living. He has been involved in the agriculture sector, working as a farmer, for the past 12 years. Today, Ali is asking for a loan of $1,200 USD to buy agriculturA. supplies.

loans.use: To buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a hardworking man of age 49.  He has been operating a taxi business for fifteen years.  He was previously employed in a restaurant.  He is a member of Kiva field partner Faulu Kenya and previously took a loan of 15,000 Kenyan shillings.

He says that since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has been in a good position to save his money.  He has five children in school, hence he has requested for a loan of 47,750 Kenyan shillings to pay school fees for them.  He hopes to open a restaurant in the future.  He sees himself being financially independent.

loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Afde N°28 Group

texts.fr:
L’Association des Femmes pour le Développement de l’Entreprise (AFDE) est une organisation de femmes commerçantes de petite échelle travaillant dans Thies, une ville environ 70 Kms de Dakar. L'association a été fondée en 1993 par vingt femmes entrepreneurs pour augmenter leur pouvoir d'achat par le biais  d’une tontine (système de financement tournant dans lequel chaque membre cotise périodiquement une somme convenue et qu’on verse à tour de rôle aux différents membres). 
Cette politique ne permettant pas de financer au même jour tous les membres, elles décidèrent d’adhérer à l’IMCEC afin de s’octroyer du crédit sans des demandes de garanties. C’est ainsi que les membres sont divisés en  sous groupe de 5, avec une présidente désignée et une trésorière pour chaque sous groupe. Ces sous-groupes, au nombre de 63 en ce moment, peuvent être le même pendant de nombreuses années, mais changent souvent de membres selon le financement des besoins et d'autres considérations.
 L'AFDE organise des réunions de membre mensuellement où tous les sous groupes sont conviés et dirige une coopération pour ses membres, en leur permettant d'acheter du riz et d'autres produits à de meilleurs prix.
 L'AFDE est dirigée par une Présidente du nom de Madame Mame Diarra MAR et une trésorière Madame Ndeye Ndella Diouf toutes habitantes de Thiès. 
La présidente de l’AFDE 28 est Madame Bineta S.. Agée de 46 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle s’active depuis 3 ans dans la vente de poissons fumés et séchés, de l’huile de palme au marché Grand Thiès. Avec le crédit, Madame S. veut se réapprovisionner à Mbour et Diaobé deux localités où les produits sont au bon marché. 
Elle est dans ce groupe avec Madame Ndeye Sokhna D. Trésorière vendeuse de produits cosmétiques, de Madame Amy T. vendeuse de thé et de kola, de Madame Fatou F. vendeuse de légumes et de poissons frais chez lui et de Madame Aïssatou S. vendeuse de carottes, choux et de navets au marché Grand Thiès. Elles sollicitent toutes 5 un montant de 250 000 FCFA qu’elles vont partager à part égale pour financer leurs activités.
texts.en:
The Association des Femmes pour le Développement de l’Entreprise (AFDE) is an organization of women in small-scale commerce working in Thies, a city about 70 km from Dakar. This association was founded in 1993 by twenty women entrepreneurs to increase their purchasing power by way of a tontine (a revolving credit system in which each member periodically pays a suitable amount and which funds its various members by turns). This policy does not allow every member to be financed on the same day. The members decided to join IMCEC in order to award loans without guarantee requirements. Thus, the members are divided into sub-groups of five, each with a designated president and a treasurer. These sub-groups, which currently number as many as 63, can be the same for several years but often change their members according to the financing of needs and other considerations. The AFDE organizes member meetings each month, when all the sub-groups are invited. It facilitates cooperation for its members, enabling them to buy rice and other goods at better prices. The AFDE is lead by a president by the name of Ms. Mame Diarra MAR and by a treasurer, Ms. Ndeye Ndella Diouf , both residents of Thiès. The president of AFDE 28 is Ms. Bineta S., aged 46, who is married and the mother of four children. She has been active for three years in selling smoked and dried fish and palm oil at the Grand Thiès market. With the loan, Ms. S. wants to get supplies in Mbour and Diaobé, two towns where goods are cheap. She is in this group with the treasurer Ms. Ndeye Sokhna D., a retailer of cosmetics; Ms. Amy T., a retailer of tea and kola; Ms. Fatou F., a retailer of vegetables and fresh fish at her place; and Ms. Aïssatou S., a retailer of carrots cabbage, and turnips at the Grand Thiès market. All five group members are requesting an amount of 250,000 francs CFA that they are going to share equally for financing their businesses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Stocking up with merchandise

loans.name: Erdenechuluun

texts.en:
Erdenechuluun is 40 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Tuv province, Mongolia. He and his family live together in a house which belongs to his parents. His two children, ages 18 and 11, both attend a local secondary school.

Erdenechuluun operates an auto repair and spare parts trading business in his town. He gained experience in his business by previously working in Japan between 2004 and 2009. He helped his brother import Japanese jeep tires to sell back home in Mongolia. Since coming back to Mongolia and starting his own business, he has worked hard to establish himself and support his family. Erdenechuluun has made quick progress over the last year and attributes his success to his good communication skills. He is optimistic about the future and says, “I would like to expand my business and improve my family's quality of life.” He is requesting a 2,000,000 tugrug loan to purchase more jeep tires from Japan for his auto parts business.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi de l’association Allachon est composé 8 de femmes   mariées de la ville de San région de Ségou, quatrième  région administrative de la république du Mali. Elles  vivent dans des familles traditionnelles et ont en moyenne 42 ans et au moins 6 enfants. Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et parenté.
Depuis environ 20 ans ces femmes du groupe Benkadi font la vente de condiments, d’encens et de produits cosmétiques.
Parmi ces femmes se trouve une,  qui est très sollicitée par ses clients pour la qualité de son encens,  Hawa Mallé alias ‘’éternelle beauté’’. 
Hawa s’approvisionne à Bamako et compte acheter, 3 kg de magnokisseni, 12 bouteilles de parfums différents et 1kg de djekalani. Elle mélange tous ces ingrédients en un jour et la ferme pendant une semaine. La semaine suivante elle procède à la mise en  embouteille pour les vendre à une  clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes et certain homme qui achète  pour leurs femmes. Madame Hawa vend en espèce et  quelques fois à crédit. 
Elle espère réaliser 25.000FCFA de bénéfice par mois et les autres membres du groupe envisagent avoir 21.000FCFA de bénéfice. Ces bénéfices leurs  permettrons de rembourser leurs prêts et subvenir aux dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group, part of the Allachon microcredit association, is made up of 8 married women from the San region of Ségou, the fourth largest region in the Republic of Mali. They live as part of traditional families and are of an average age of 42 with at least 6 children each. They met through neighbourly and parental links. The Benkadi group have sold condiments, incense and cosmetics for the past twenty years. There is one lady within the group that is very sought after for the quality of her incense; Hawa Mallé, aka 'eternal beauty'. Hawa sources her goods from Bamako and intends to buy 3kg of 'magnokisseni' (an incense ingredient), 12 bottles of different fragrances and 1kg of 'djekalani' (another incense ingredient). She combines these three ingredients on the same day and lets the mixture rest for a week. The following week she bottles the mixture and sells it to a customer base made up of women and men buying it for their wives. Mrs Hawa takes cash, and occasionally credit, sales. She hopes to generate a 25,000 FCFA profit every month, and the other group members envisage generating profits of 21,000 FCFA. These profits will enable them to repay their loans and meet their family's needs.

Translated from French by Danielle Treharne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing ingredients for the production of incense

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more VCDs to sell

loans.name: Brenda Janeth

texts.es:
La señora Brenda Janeth V. está muy agradecida por su cooperación en el anterior crédito con el cual pudo dar la diferencia que le faltaba para que le entregaran su vivienda, don están viviendo ella y sus hijos.
Solicita nuevamente un préstamo para poder construir un cuarto de madera ya que la casa es pequeña y no hay suficiente espacio para los niños. Ya que le están pidiendo su propio espacio en la casa.
Planea pagar el crédito con los ingresos que obtiene de su trabajo en una fabrica en el departamento de producción.
texts.en:
Brenda Janeth V. is very appreciative of the help provided to her with the previous loan, which allowed her to make the difference she needed to acquire her home, where she is now living with her children. She is currently requesting another loan in order to build an additional room out of wood. The house is small and there is not enough space for the children; they have been asking her for their own space in the house. She plans to repay the loan with the income she receives from her work in the production department of a factory.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building an additional room out of wood

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua A. is married and has three children. She has been through junior high school.  Ekua bakes bread to sell at Abura. Her husband works with the information service.  Ekua uses her income to help her husband pay school fees and utility bills.  Ekua will use the loan to purchase more ingredients to bake bread to sell. With the new earnings from her extended business, Ekua plans to save to build a house.

loans.use: To purchase more ingredients

loans.name: C2150 Tuzamurane Group

texts.en:
Hirariya is 27 years old and married with four children who are 1, 3, 4 and 7 years old. Hirariya is the leader of a group called "Tuzamurane". This group is well known in the clothing business. This is their second successful year in the business and they work every day.

Hirariya and her team realized that the capital they had would not allow them to expand meaningfully. For that reason, they are requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company so that they can purchase additional styles of clothing. With the additional styles, Hirariya and her team will earn more profit which in turn will allow each member of the team to save and improve on the living conditions of their own families.

loans.use: To buy different styles of clothes to sell

loans.name: Felipa

texts.es: Felipa, de 49 años, es una mujer luchadora, que enviudó hace 18 años, ella vive en una casa alquilada junto a sus 3 hijos, quienes son la razón de su vida.Su vida es significado de esfuerzo constante, más aún cuando el motor que la impulsa son sus hijos, por esta razón lleva 15 años dedicada  al cultivo de alverja, papa y gladiolos. También se dedica al negocio de venta de diferentes tipos de verduras, que compra en las chacras, las cosecha y las traslada al mercado mayorista de su ciudad, y también a  la selva  donde las comercializa a los mayoristas, a buenos precios. Obtiene buenas ganancias económicas de sus ventas que son seguras, gracias al  apoyo de su hijo mayor, y lo que más le gusta de su labor es observar como crecen sus sembríos, que serán presagio de buenas cosechas. Para más adelante tiene planeado incrementar su productividad de verduras, arrendando terrenos, pues todas sus chacras propias están produciendo muy bien para su satisfacción.Es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP, y está feliz de continuar laborando junto a los integrantes de su banco comunal, a quienes aprecia mucho, pues comparten todas sus experiencias durante las reuniones mensuales.Felipa tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la compra de  varios sacos de semilla de papa de buena calidad, además de varios sacos de abono, que le permitirán  mejorar la calidad de su producción.
texts.en:
Felipa, 49, is a strong woman who has been widowed for 18 years. She lives in a rented house with her three children, who are the meaning of her life. Her life is marked by constant effort, even more so when the force that drives her are her children. For this reason, she has worked for 15 years farming peas, potatoes and gladiolas. She also sells different types of vegetables that she buys from farms, collects them and brings them to her city’s wholesale market as well as to the rain forest where she sells to wholesalers at good prices. Felipa earns good income from her sales which are steady thanks to the help of her eldest son. What she likes most about her work is watching how her crops grow, portending good harvests. For the future she has planned to increase vegetable production by leasing land since all of her own crops have been producing satisfactorily. This is the second time that Felipa has a loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and she is happy to continue working together with the members of her community bank, whom she greatly appreciates. They share all of their business experiences during their monthly meetings. Felipa has planned to invest the requested funds in the purchase of various sacks of quality potato seed, and several sacks of fertilizer which will enable her to improve production quality.

Translated from Spanish by Samantha Cerone, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Fertilizer for Crops

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her working capital

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en: Mary Ann U. is from the village of Pinoma, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 32 years old. Mary Ann is married and has a school-aged child. To make a living, Mary Ann operates a direct-selling business. The main source of income for the business comes from selling personal-use products, such as lotions, perfumes, talcum powder and make-up kits, in the local community. Mary Ann has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 2,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2007, Mary Ann joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Ann is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the third loan taken out by Mary Ann from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Novelita

texts.en:
Novelita V. is from the town of Banga. She is 43 years old. Novelita is married and has a 14 year old child. To make a living, Novelita owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Her husband is also a farmer and they work together to keep their farm productive.

Novelita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Novelita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Novelita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase general farm supplies & equipment. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Novelita from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of the borrower's family.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies & equipment.

loans.name: Manantial Group

texts.es: Doña Julia C. de treinta y nueve años de edad, curso el segundo grado de primaria, ella es viuda su esposo falleció hace 6 años y tiene cinco hijos tres mayores de edad y la mas pequeña de 8 años, se dedica a la Crianza de Animales (Cerdos Y Pollos) para colaborar con los gastos de su familia, tomando en cuenta que sus hijos mayores colaboran con algunos gastos y cuenta con 14 años de experiencia en ésta actividad,  solo que ahora con mayor producción. Contando con entusiasmo, deseos de superación y la ayuda de unas vecinas  organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El Banco Comunal se denomina MANANTIAL, el nombré fue elegido por todas las integrantes. El grupo cuenta con 15 integrantes mujeres, quienes se dedican a diversas actividades entre ellos podemos mencionar; la crianza de animales, venta de Helados, Consumo Diario y ropas típicas.  El préstamo ella lo utilizará para compra de Cerdos, y de esa forma incrementar su Producción y así generar más ingresos. Ya que el sueño de ella es que su producción crezca, pero por falta de capital, no ha podido, pero con este crédito crecerá su producción y de esta forma generar mas ingresos para su desarrollo personal y familiar.
texts.en:
Julia C. is thirty nine years old. She has a grade 2 education. She is a widow, her husband passed away 6 years ago. She has five children, three are independent and the youngest is 8 years old. She raises livestock (pigs and chickens) to contribute to the family's expenses, keeping in mind that her eldest children help out with some expenses. She has 14 year’s experience in the business, only now her production is improved. With great enthusiasm, dreams of improvements, and with the help of one of her neighbors, she has organized a group to request a loan together. The community bank is named "Manatial", a name chose by all the members. The group is made up of 15 women and they each have their unique business, such as: farmer, ice cream sales, grocery store, and traditional clothing store. The loan will be used to purchase pigs to increase her production and improve her earnings. Her dream is to see the production grow even more but with limited capital funds she has not been able to see this happen. This loan will help her increase production and generate a better income, for her personal advancement and for the well-being of her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Hadidja

texts.en:
Hadidja is 30 years old. She is married and she has one child, age 11, who is in school. Her husband is a driver.  

For the last four years, Hadja has been buying ladies’ and men’s clothes in Uganda and selling them in Rwanda. She will use this loan to buy more clothes. She plans to reinvest the profits back into her business and within a year, she hopes to be able to open a shop.

loans.use: Clothes to sell

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Félix, de 63 años, es un hombre pícaro y soltero, que vive en compañía de su hermana Eutemia de 52 años; en su propia casa ubicada en la localidad de Progreso. A pesar de su edad, él es un hombre fuerte y con muchas ganas de vivir, desde niño trabajó en los terrenos de cultivo; ahí aprendió a cultivar y cosechar los sembríos. A pesar de no tener familia, no se siente solo, ya que; apoyar a su hermana en la crianza de sus hijos, es el mayor regalo que la vida le pudo haber dado; fue por ellos que comenzó a invertir en la agricultura; sembrando maíz, arveja y papa. El tiempo y la experiencia le enseñaron a  vender sus cosechas en el mercado central de su ciudad; aquí amplio su mirada y se llenó de varios objetivos; uno de ellos es comprar ropa para venderlo en la selva central, “en esa parte del país no existe mucha variedad de prendas de vestir y la innovación traería muchas ganancias”, asegura. Es el décimo crédito con MFP y agradece los años de apoyo, éxitos y gratificaciones que obtuvo gracias a su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá comprar abono y semillas de papa, ya que tiene dispuesto a sembrar en estos días.
texts.en: Felix, 63, is a mischievous single man who lives with his 52 year-old sister Eutemia in his own home, located in the town of Progreso.  In spite of his age, he is a strong man with a strong desire to live.  He has been farming ever since he was a child, when he learned to cultivate and harvest the crops. Despite having no family, he does not feel alone, since to support his sister in the upbringing of her children is the greatest gift that life could have given him.  It was for them that he began to invest in agriculture, sowing corn, peas and potatoes. Time and experience taught him to sell his harvested crops in the central market in his city.  There he widened his view and expanded his goals to include buying clothing to sell in the central rain forest, where, according to him, "in this part of the country there is not much variety of clothing, so it is an opportunity to generate profits."  This is his 10th loan with MFP, and he is grateful for the years of support, and for the successes and rewards that he has obtained thanks to his communal bank.  With the loan he requests, he will buy organic fertilizer and potato seeds, since he is now ready to plant.

loans.use: to buy potato seeds and bags of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Salim

texts.fr:
Monsieur SALIM M. est âgé e de 49 ans, marié et père   de 4 enfants.  Il  vit dans une famille nucléaire au  quartier Pelengana Sud de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Technique d’électricité de profession, parallèlement à cette activité, il tient une quincaillerie en face de l’hôtel Indépendant de Ségou. Il a appris ce commerce auprès de sa mère qui avait une quincaillerie. Les soirs et les jours où il n’y avait pas classe, il gérait ce petit commerce qui l’aidait à comprendre  les rouages du commerce de quincaillerie. Une fois dans la vie active et nostalgique de ce secteur, il ouvre une quincaillerie. 
Dans le dessein d’augmenter son fonds de commerce, afin de réaliser plus de bénéfice et de faire face à la demande clientèle qui est de plus en plus grande, il fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso avec qui  il est  à son 1er   prêt individuel,  qu’il compte utiliser pour acheter, 2 cartons de clous et 10 cartons de peintures à Bamako. Monsieur SALIM M. vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Avec ce prêt, il envisage de réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000FCFA. Ce bénéfice lui permet de payer sa location et de prendre en charge les dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Mr. SALIM M. is a 49-year-old married man with four children. He lives in a nuclear family in the Pelengana neighborhood, in southern Ségou (fourth administrative region of Mali).

Mr. M. is an electrician by trade, and he also runs a hardware store across the street from the Independent hotel of Ségou. He learned the business from his mother who had a hardware store. He used to spend evenings and off-school days managing the small shop, which helped him understand the mechanics of the hardware business. Once in the workforce, he started to miss it and opened a hardware store of his own.

Hoping to bolster his working capital to boost his profits and meet the needs of a steadily increasing customer base, he turned to the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution for his first individual loan, which he will use to buy two boxes of nails and ten cartons of paint in Bamako. 
He sells for cash or credit to a clientele consisting of women and men. 

With this loan, he expects to make a monthly profit of 150,000FCFA. This will allow him to pay his rent and cover the family’s expenses.

loans.use: To purchase hardware store items

loans.name: Nenisa

texts.en: Nenisa D. is currently in the business of selling fish, cooking oil, and tomatoes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more onions and jerry cans of cooking oil to sell. Nenisa is 28 years old and is married, with a husband that is a businessman. She has four children, three of whom go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: To stock more onions and jerry cans of cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more dozens of body creme and head-tie

loans.name: Criselda

texts.en:
Just like any loving mother would, Criselda C., 50, gives all her best to make sure her family stays together happily. Criselda only finished high school, but despite that, she strives to excel in everything she puts her hands into. Criselda is married to Roman, who presently has no work. For now, Criselda takes the responsibility of earning money to meet the needs of their children. Together, they presently live in Pasay City, Philippines.

Criselda has managed a sari-sari (variety) store for 10 years now. Alongside her variety store is a small food stall where she basically sells rice and viands (tasty dishes) for her neighborhood. The fact that her store stands near a cemetery in Pasay City speaks of her determination to keep her small business running. Training and Bible studies in CCT* enable Criselda to stand firm on what she knows is right and profitable in business not just for herself but also for others around her. Family members assist Criselda in managing the sari-sari store and food stall. Every month, they earn an average of 7,000 Philippines pesos (Php).

To further help her grow her business, Criselda applied for a Php13,000 loan. She intends to use this money to add more items to her store and make sure her customers, who are mostly visitors to the cemetery, will find what they need in her store. Definitely, Criselda desires to make her business grow and see to it that it would be profitable for her and her family's benefit.

The times when the store has low sales challenge Criselda, as well as debts from her customers that have yet to be paid. She is also worried about her children, who get naughty and need some discipline. Nevertheless, she is determined to overcome these trials and emerge better than she was before, and higher from where she was before. Because, more than a driven entrepreneur, she is a persistent mother who dreams of seeing her children grow as good, responsible citizens. Above all, she prays for a family that stays happily together no matter what.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: As a means to increase store sales

loans.name: Una Luz Al Desarrollo Group

texts.es:
La Alcancía Comunal  "Una Luz Al Desarrollo" consiste en 9 vecinos y amigos que quieren mejorar sus vidas económicamente.  El grupo lleva tres años juntos y la presidenta es Eloyda.
Eloyda tiene 29 años de edad y es madre de dos hijos- de 12 y 3 años de edad.  Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa por pedidos en su barrio.  En esta temporada navideña, tiene muchos pedidos de ropa y zapatillas para niños.  Con el préstamo solicitado a EDAPROSPO, comprara más  mercadería para vender a sus clientes.  En el futuro, Eloyda sueña con tener su propio puesto en un mercado donde podría vender ropa.
texts.en:
The community bank named "Una Luz al Desarrollo" is made up of 9 neighbors and friends with the common goal of improving their finances. The group has been together for three years and their leader is Eloyda. 

Eloyda is 29 years old and she is the mother of two, aged 12 and 3 years old. she sells clothing by taking orders in her neighborhood.  During this Christmas season she has many orders for children's clothing and shoes. The loan she has requested from Edaprospo (Kiva Field Partner) will be used to purchase merchandise to offer her clients. In the future Eloyda dreams of having a stand in the market from where to sell her clothing.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and shoes for the Christmas season.

loans.name: Victor Enrique

texts.es:
Victor de 58 años, es un hombre trabajador que siempre le ha gustado tener su propio dinero por eso que hace 6 años comenzó con su negocio de la papelería para así ayudar a su familia a mantener su hogar. 

Viviendo en una zona urbana llamada Guasmo ahora trabaja en su propio negocio desde las 07h00am hasta las 22h00pm atendiendo a los clientes. Vende en su papelería plumas, juguetes, cuadernos, accesorios etc. Aunque uno de los problemas que tiene es la delincuencia que hay en el sector por donde vive sigue trabajando para poder asegurar su vejez. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar juguetes y cuadernos para su negocio para que sus clientes tengan más variedad al comprar. En el futuro quiere agrandar el negocio y tener mas clientes.
texts.en:
Victor is 58 years old.  He is a hard-working man who has always liked having his own money.  For this reason, 6 years ago he started his stationery business so that he could help his family and support his household.

Victor lives in an urban area called Guasmo.  He works in his own business from 7.00am to 10.00pm, serving his customers.  In his stationery store he sells pens, toys, exercise books, accessories, etc.  Although he faces problems with the crime in his area, he continues working so that he can guarantee his old age.

Victor would like to use his loan to buy toys and exercise books for his business so that his customers have more variety when they come to make their purchases.  In the future, he would like to expand his business and have more customers.

loans.use: To buy toys and exercise books

loans.name: Berha Clemencia

texts.es:
Bertha de 60 años, tiene una tienda con mercadería muy surtida en la parte delantera de su casa. Ya que le ha dado una buena administración al negocio ha tenido la oportunidad de brindar los servicios de venta de viveres en el sector donde vive. 

Tiene muchas aspiración con su negocio por eso se levanta desde las 07h30 a atender los clientes hasta las 23h00pm para cerrar el local. Quiere continuar con su negocio por eso quiere comprar con el préstamo ropa para surtirlo con otro estilo de mercadería y algunos viveres. En el futuro quiere continuar con su tienda para asegurar su vejez.
texts.en:
Berthan is 60 years old and she has a well-stocked general store located in the front section of her house. Through sound business administration she has had the opportunity to have a grocery store in the neighborhood where she lives. 

She has great plans for her store, which is the reason why she starts work at 7:30am and she closes the shop at 11pm.

She wants to keep up with her business and with the loan she wants to purchase clothing in a different style and some grocery items. She wants to keep her store in the future to secure her old age.

loans.use: To purchase clothing and grocery items for resale.

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es: Zoila, de 49 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Abilio de 49  años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Con mucho esfuerzo Zoila ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva plátano y café, productos que luego lleva a vender a la ciudad de Pichanaki, donde las vende al por mayor. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Para más adelante, espera mejorar sus cultivos y poder así tener mejores ingresos. Este es el sexto crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono e insecticidas, con lo cual espera mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Zoila, 49 years old, is a very personable and hard-working woman, who lives in her own house with her husband Abilio, 49, and their 3 beloved children, whom she wants to give a better quality of life. With much effort, Zoila has managed to work her lands and make them very productive. She grows plantains and coffee, which she then takes to the city of Pichanaki, where she sells them wholesale. 

Her crops have given her the income necessary to support her family, and so she wants to put all her efforts into getting ahead in this business. What she likes most about her work is caring for her crops; she has spent 20 years doing so. The most difficult part is transporting her goods to the market, since the bags she carries are very heavy and tire her very much. Eventually, she hopes to improve her crops and thereby improve her income. 

This is her sixth loan with MFP; she has been very punctual with her previous loans and hopes to be so this time as well. She is a very active member of her communal bank and is always aware of the agreements of the others in her group. With the 1000 soles ($375) requested, she will buy composted manure and insecticides with which she hopes to improve her crops.

loans.use: Purchase bags of manure and insecticides.

loans.name: Sor

texts.en: Sor S., 51, is married and resides with her husband and child in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia, an area known as one of the largest rice-producing regions in Cambodia. S. is a housewife while her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 5 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 30 on food and USD 10 on other necessary expenses. S. is requesting a loan of USD 500 to purchase rice to stock and sell when the price is good. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy rice to stock for sale

loans.name: Munkhgerel

texts.en: Munkhgerel is 41 years old and lives with her husband and a daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live in a one-bedroom studio apartment which they rent. Her husband is Japanese, who recently married her. Her daughter attends a Raffles International Institute. Munkhgerel has been operating a body- stocking (garment) retail business since 2005 by renting a stall at the Narlag market and selling a variety of socks and tights for the last seven years, and she has gained much experience. She is one of our reliable customers and a very hardworking person who is responsible for paying her daughter’s tuition fee.  This is her second loan through Credit Mongol, and this time she is asking for a loan to increase her business profits by purchasing more products.

loans.use: to increase her business profits by purchasing more products such as socks and tights for sale

loans.name: Ermelinda

texts.es:
La sra. Ermelinda, cliente  joven y emprendedora, cuenta con 27 años, está comprometida hace 10 años con el sr. Edgar Rodriguez, quien trabaja como chofer en una empresa comercial, ellos tienen 2 hijos de 10  y 8 años respectivamente y ambos van  a la escuela.
La titular tiene su negocio desde hace 4 años, y anteriormente sólo se dedicaba a ser ama de casa, y su esposo era el que trabajaba, pero con el tiempo decidió abrir una despensa aprovechando que en su barrio no había muchos lugares para comprar comestibles ni productos de primera necesidad, y fue así que empezó vendiendo primero artículos de primera necesidad, y más adelante tener un surtido de mercaderías hasta venta de carnes y bebidas.
El crédito que solicita es para invertir en la compra de más variedad de productos (yerba a granel, arroz, carnes, productos enlatados, etc.).
texts.en:
Sra. Ermelinda is an enterprising young client. She is 27 years old and has been in a ten-year committed relationship with Sr. Edgar Rodriguez, who works as a driver for a commercial business. They have two children, ages 10 and 8 respectively. Both of them attend school.

Ermelinda has owned her business for four years. She previously devoted herself as a full-time homemaker while her husband was working, but she decided to open a food pantry to take advantage of the fact that there were no other places in her neighborhood to buy groceries or basic necessities. Ermelinda started out selling essential items and later increased her assortment of merchandise to include meat and beverages.

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of a variety of products (herbs in bulk, rice, meat, canned goods, and other items).

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as herbs in bulk, rice, meat, canned goods, and other items.

loans.name: Sanh

texts.en:
Sanh C. is a 46-year-old married woman and mother. She lives with other family members in her own small family home in Kompong Thom province. 

She owns a piece of land that she inherited from her grandmother. She grows different kinds of crops on her land, such as rice and corn, which she sells to buyers every two or three months when the plants mature. Her husband grows these crops with her. 

The couple is married and has five school-aged children. Because their farm is outside a watering system, Sanh C. would like a loan to buy a pumping machine for irrigation.

loans.use: to buy a pumping machine for irrigation

loans.name: Korkine Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the "Korkine" group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profits, and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Mohamed L.. Mohamed is age 40. He is married to a businesswoman and the couple has three children. Mohamed has been a businessman for six years now. He sells spare parts for bikes. He has requested this loan in order to buy spare parts in larger quantity to add to his business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts in bulk

loans.name: Nieves Liliana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “OLLANTAY DE WAYRACPUNCU”; Este banco está ubicado en la Provincia de Ollantaytambo  y  departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nieves; es conviviente; La socia tiene 29 años de edad; ella tiene 1 hijo de 6 años de edad, la socia tiene su tienda de abarrotes, la socia tiene la tienda en su casa en la planta baja y ella misma administra su tienda y todo lo que tiene invierte en la implementación de su negocio ella se abastece cada vez que puede para seguir teniendo a sus clientes felices, la socia ahora desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de aceite, sal, arroz, la socia desea invertir el préstamo en la implementación de sus tienda.

La socia está muy agradecido por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de dicho préstamo de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “OLLANTAY DE WAYRACPUNCU” cooperative bank.  This bank is located in the Ollantaytambo province in the department of Cusco.

Her name is Mrs. Nieves and she is in a common-law marriage.  She is 29 years old and has one 6-year old child.  She has a general store on the bottom floor of her home.  She herself manages it, and reinvests everything she has into expanding the business.  She supplies it every time she can in order to keep her customers happy.  She now wants to invest the loan into the purchase of cooking oil, salt and rice.  She wants to invest the credit into supplying the store.

She is very thankful for the loan, and commits to making the payments for said credit in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: buy cooking oil, salt and rice to supply her store.

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is 42 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks to sell like sugar and other groceries.

Erma has borrowed and paid 13 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from food vending and pig fattening.

Erma aspires to save to expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy additional stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Mrs. Mao is a hard-working woman who has spent her life cultivating crops for ten years in Kompong Cham Province. She learned this skill from her grandparents when she was single. Every year, she plants her rice crop at least twice a year, rainy season and dry season, and she can make a profit around US$ 2 per day. In order to generate more income, Mrs. Mao’s husband is employed as a construction worker in the field and earning about $2 a day. They have three children; one is a former construction worker while the other two are still enrolled in school. 

Mrs. Mao will be using her loan to mend her old house because most parts of it are broken. She wants to repair it, but she doesn’t have sufficient money to do that. This is the reason why she is seeking a Kiva loan. Mrs. Mao is pictured in the photo with her husband in front of their house.

loans.use: to mend her old house.

loans.name: Adecel

texts.en:
Adecel is married with four children. She is 35 years old and lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines.

Adecel is a farmer and grows different kinds of vegetables in her vacant backyard to earn an income. It has been a hobby of Adecel's to plant in a small plot in her backyard for daily consumption. But her hobby has turned into a business. Adecel is enjoying the process of watching something grow, harvesting the product and earning income from selling vegetables. She has been doing this for more than two years with a monthly income of PHP 4,000.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and planting materials for vegetables

loans.name: Bidii Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mubila, trésorière du groupe d’affaire « Bidii »,  est entrepreneur, âgée de 46 ans, mariée, mère de 7 enfants, tous étudient et d’autres ont déjà leurs propres foyers. Elle est  pétrolière,  (vendeuse de pétrole en détail). Son mari est un mécanicien indépendant. Elle vend ses marchandises devant sa porte, près de son domicile. Il y a 20 ans révolus qu’elle exerce cette activité. Cependant, elle vient de réaliser  8 cycles avec le crédit de Hekima. Ce nouveau crédit doit lui servir  de s’approvisionner  avec  10 bidons de pétrole.  En plus, elle ambitionne scolariser ses enfants et construire confortablement une maison.  La cliente remercie Hekima pour  ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes exclues de banque classique. Il sied de signaler que le groupe d’affaire « Bidii» est majoritairement féminins.
texts.en:
Our client Mubila, treasurer of the business group « Bidii », is an entrepreneur of 46, married and the mother of seven children, all having been enrolled in school, some of whom are already established in their own homes. Mubila is a kerosene retailer. Her husband is an independent mechanic. 

She sells her wares in front of her door, near her home. She has been in this business for a full 20 years. However, she has just completed her eighth loan with Hekima. This new loan will serve to allow her to stock up on 10 jerrycans of kerosene. 

Besides her business, her ambition is to have all her children complete school and to build a house comfortably. This client thanks Hekima for its work on behalf of poor women who are excluded from conventional banking. Please note that the  business group called « Bidii» is made up predominantly of women.

loans.use: to buy 10 jerrycans of kerosene.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.es:
Don Carlos tiene 49 años, está casado con la Sra.Rosa de 38 años, tiene  un  hijo,  ellos viven en casa propia.
