El Sr. Carlos se dedica a la venta y producción de hortalizas, está en el ramo hace más de 20 años, actualmente cuenta con muy buena producción de tomates y de melón. Aprendió el arte del cultivo de su padre y luego de casarse se independizó de él, realizando los cultivos en su finca con muy buena producción.
Actualmente cuenta con clientela formada pues los compradores vienen a llevar sus productos de su chacra pues posee muy buena calidad de los mismos.
El solicita el credito para la compra de semillas y químicos para la preparación del suelo.
texts.en:
Carlos is 49 years old.  He is married to 38 year-old Rosa and has a son.  The family live in their own home.

Carlos produces and sells vegetables.  He has been in this line of work for 20 years.  He currently has a very good tomato and melon production.  He learned the art of farming from his father and, after he got married, he started working independently from his father, growing his crops on his farm with a very good production.

Carlos currently has an established customer base.  His buyers come to collect the products from his farm as they are very good quality.  He is requesting a loan to buy seeds and chemicals for preparing his soil.

loans.use: to buy seeds and chemicals to prepare his soil

loans.name: Doudedji Group

texts.fr: Le groupe DOUDEDJI est formé de trois personnes qui habitent toutes ensemble dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupe, nommée Lucienne est celle dont la main est levée sur la photo. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé en vue d’élever le niveau de leur activité. Lucienne est âgée de 52 ans et vit au Bénin. Lucienne est mariée à un cuisinier du nom de Bernard et est mère de deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à sa charge. Lucienne vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Il y a juste un an que Lucienne a commencé la vente d'ustensiles en plastiques, de chaussures et des friperies de façon secondaire ; ce qui lui permet de répondre sans grande difficulté aux besoins de sa famille et de subvenir à ses besoins. Lucienne s’approvisionne au Bénin. Dans le souci de mieux répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle, Lucienne désire augmenter le stock de ses produits. Pour ce faire, Lucienne sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe DOUDEDJI, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en: The Doudedji group comprises three people who live together in the same area. The group representative, named Lucienne, is the one whose hand is raised in the photo. This is the second time this group is seeking financial support from ALIDÉ in order to raise the level of their businesses. Lucienne is 52 years old and lives in Benin. She is married to a cook named Bernard and has two children, both in school and in her care. Lucienne lives together with her husband and children. Just about a year ago, Lucienne began selling plastic kitchenware, shoes, and second-hand clothing on the side; this allows her to respond to her needs and those of her family without too much difficulty. She gets her supplies in Benin. With the goal of better responding to the demands of her clientele, Lucienne wants to increase her stock of products. To do this, she and the other members of the Doudedji group are seeking a second loan through ALIDÉ.

loans.use: To buy plastic kitchenware and bales of second-hand clothing.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en:
Filomena, age 46, is a rice farmer. She and her husband Rodrigo plant and harvest rice and offer it for sale to traders. They have been engaged in this business for 15 years. They usually earn P21,000 for their yield during the month of May and November. The income is put to use for daily expenses and financing their children's studies. They have three children to educate. 
 
Filomena has the drive and attitude to succeed despite poverty. She was not financially stable originally, but with the help of her family members, she has faced her challenges with strong determination. She is now requesting a loan of P12,000 in order to buy farm inputs, such as fertilizers and insecticides. Filomena is confident that this will help her achieve an abundant harvest and allow her to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy essential farm inputs, such as fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is 49 years old and supports five members of her family. Her children are 25, 23, eighteen, fifteen and eight years old.

Leah sells new clothes in the Kabisaga trading center in Kapsabet and has been in the business for twelve years, earning a monthly income of 10,000 KES.

Leah has been given 40,000 KES from KADET LTD as her third loan after repaying the previous two successfully. She hopes to use this money to add more new clothes to her business. The profits will be used to meet the daily basic needs of her family.

Her dream is to own a wholesale shop in the town.

loans.use: to buy new clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en:
Nieves is a 52-year-old woman who lives in the town of Veruela, Agusan Del Sur. She earns a living through farming. Nieves primarily grows rice crops to sell. She has had a farming business for 20 years now.

Nieves requested this loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies. Nieves hopes to own a bigger farm in the future.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Cyprien

texts.en:
Cyprien is a father and he has been a farmer for the past 25 years. He has 3 children. He learned this type of farming from his parents. He will use his Kiva loan to support labor costs during rice production: nursery, transplanting, field management, guarding birds, and later for harvesting activities.

With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to pay for rice farming

loans.name: Matilde Flora

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal José Cesario Reyes se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Matilde, tiene 59 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cinco hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, uno de ellos aun vive con ella. Su esposo trabaja en el Municipio de Montecristi.

Nuestra amiga es un ama de casa que para ayudarse y lograr algo por su cuenta tiene desde hace tres años un local en su casa donde da el servicio de copias y también vende de helados, jugos, gaseosas, golosinas, etc. Trabaja todos los días en su negocio y nos cuenta que son muchas las personas que a diario se dan cita en su local ya sea para sacar copias o para disfrutar de sus deliciosos helados.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más papel para copias, gaseosas y helados para surtir su negocio. Está desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que les brinda la institución. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio y en su vida personal.
texts.en:
The José Cesario Reyes communal bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi Canton which is known for its rich pre-colonial culture and for its crafts that are famous both nationally and internationally; it’s where the famous straw hats come from.

We met Matilde, 59, here.  She’s married and has five children who are all adults now although one still lives with her.  Her husband works for the city of Montecristi.

Our friend is a housewife who, in order to help herself and accomplish something on her own, opened a space in her house three years ago where she provides photocopying services and also sells ice cream, soft-drinks, snacks, etc.  She works every day in her store and she tells us that she has many people come by daily to either make copies or to enjoy her delicious ice cream.

This loan will be used to buy more paper for the copier, soft-drinks and ice cream to stock her business.  She’s been in the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because of the benefits the institution provides.  Her dream is to continue forward both in her business and in her personal life.

loans.use: to buy copier paper, soft-drinks and ice cream.

loans.name: Enkhjargal

texts.en: Enkhjargal is 28 years old and divorced. She lives with her son in a ger, a nomadic Mongolian traditional tent, on her brother’s owned land. She sells shoes in the bazaar. She has been running this business for one year. She and her son used to live in her relative’s house before. She is a very hardworking and independent woman who is diligent about making her life better. She is requesting a loan to cover the fee of renting one more bulk container to expand her business. It is very important to raise her earnings in the future.

loans.use: To cover the fee of renting one more bulk container to expand her business.

loans.name: Lady Marilin

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Girasoles esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad, se la conoce como el sector de la cárcel ya que en esta zona queda la cárcel de mujeres de Portoviejo.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Lady, tiene 51 años, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene  cuatro hijos, tres mayores y una menor de 17 años que estudia en colegio y es la que aun vive con ella. Su marido es mecánico. Ella aprendió corte  y confección hace muchos años atrás.

Es modista y tiene un pequeño taller de costura en su casa en el cual  confecciona todo tipo de ropa pero lo que más le gusta  hacer es ropa de mujer y de niñas, trabaja todos los días desde las 7h00 hasta las 21h00 y en ciertos casos hasta más tarde, ella les cose a personas que llegan hasta su local y que requieren de sus servicios aunque  también elabora prendas que luego  vende a clientes del lugar. Lleva con su negocio  más de 18 años y siempre le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar telas, hilos, botones, cierres y otros materiales para la costura. Es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal, se desempeña como fiscal de pagos del Banco y  le gusta porque  los créditos son de gran ayuda para su negocio.
 
Su sueño es terminar su casa.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the 'Girasoles' (Sunflowers) community bank meets in El Progreso neighborhood, in the city of Portoviejo.  This is a very densely populated, poor, urban area of the city which is known as 'sector de la cárcel' (the prison sector) as it is home to Portoviejo's women's prison.

Here we meet Lady.  She is 51 years old, married, and has four children.  Three of her children are grown up and her youngest daughter is 17 years old.  She is in high school and still lives with her.  Lady's husband is a mechanic.  She learned dressmaking many years ago.

Lady is a dressmaker and she has a small sewing workshop in her home where she makes all kinds of clothes.  However, what she most enjoys is making women's and children's clothes.  She works every day, from 7.00am to 9.00pm, and in some cases even later.  She sews for people who come to her premises and need her services though she also makes garments which she then sells to customers in her area.  She has been in this business for more than 18 years and has always done very well.

Lady will use this loan to buy fabric, threads, buttons, fasteners and other sewing supplies.  She is a founding member of her community bank and is in charge of collecting members' payments.  She likes her community bank because the loans are a great help to her in her business.

Lady's dream is to finish building her house.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads, buttons, fasteners and other sewing supplies

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine lives in Malindi, Kenya. She has been operating a tailoring business that has enabled her repay her first loan at Milango. She also sells fuel wood to supplement her income. She is married and has four children, three of whom are in school. 
Christine is applying for a loan of Ksh 60,000 to enable her to restock her business with clothes and materials in readiness for December celebrations. Many people buy new clothes during this time and Christine believes she can make enough sales to save enough for her children’s next year school fees.
She has a vision of opening up a boutique in the future.

loans.use: To buy new stock of clothes and materials

loans.name: Leofredo

texts.en:
Leofredo is always aiming for better yields and a larger profit with every crop. He strives to attain his aims. He doesn’t want his children to experience what he has had to experience. Leofredo did not finish his elementary education because his parents were not able to send him to school, even though he wanted to attain a higher level of education.

Leofredo is 43 years old, married, and has four children. The three of his children who are currently in school are in high school and college. One of his children is already finished and pursued a degree with his profits from farming. Through farming and planting rice in his field, Leofredo is able to send his children to school.
 
Leofredo’s goals push him to continue improving his farming techniques. He is requesting a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy hybrid rice seed, fertilizer, insecticide, and herbicide that he will use in rice farming. He hopes that the loan will help him to improve his farming techniques.

loans.use: to buy hybrid rice seed, fertilizer, insecticide, and herbicide that will use in rice farming.

loans.name: Narynkul

texts.ru:
Нарынкуль  57 лет, замужем. Основная деятельность  семьи Нарынкуль – животноводство и полеводство.  В 2005 году, Нарынкуль решила расширить свою деятельность за счет откорма и перепродажи скота, вложив в первоначальный закуп скотины 2,000 сом (KGS). 
На сегодняшний день,  хозяйство Нарынкуль насчитывающее 10 баранов и одну корову, приносит ежемесячный доход в сумме 6,000 сом. Также, Нарынкуль возделывает 3,20 поливной земли, где выращивает пшеницу, ячмень, клевер и картофель. Доходы от бизнес - деятельности Нарынкуль позволили дать образование ее детям, ставшими преподавателями. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Нарынкуль обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита Нарынкуль планирует направить на реконструкцию сарая для скота.  В будущем, Нарынкуль также хочет расширить свою деятельность за счет открытия продуктового магазина в своем селе.
texts.en: Narynkul is 57 years old and married.  Animal husbandry and farming is the primary business of Narynkul's family.  In 2005, she decided to start her own business of fattening up and reselling livestock and investing an initial amount of 2,000 som (KGS) into the purchase of livestock.  Today, her business has 10 sheep and one cow and yields a monthly income of 6,000 som (KGS).  Narynkul also has 3.2 hectares of arable land, where she grows wheat, barley, clover and potatoes.  Earnings from this business allowed her to provide education for her children, who became teachers.  In order to further grow her business, Narynkul requested a loan in the sum of 50,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to purchase sheep.  She plans to use the income from the loan to repair a barn for livestock.  In the future, Narynkul also wants to expand her business by opening a food market in her village.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Cecilia Gladys

texts.es:
Cecilia Gladys tiene 53 años de edad vive en unión libre tiene 3 hijos, vive con el esposo y con los hijos de 35, 32 y 24 años de edad en el Cantón Ventanas provincia de los ríos.

Es integrante de la VRC LAS PALMAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto campo Alegre, Pertenece al Cantón Bab se dedican a labores Agrícolas.

Cecilia se dedica a la Agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz hace 20 años.
Las compras y las ventas lo realiza en ventanas. Solicita el crédito para seguir trabajando en la siembra y compra de abonos agrícolas.

Con la ayuda del préstamo podrá comprar los insumos a tiempo.
No se le ha presentado ningún tipo de problema. En el tiempo libre le gusta ir de visita donde los familiares.
texts.en:
Cecilia Gladys, 53, lives in a common law relationship and has three children.  She lives with her husband and children who are 35, 32 and 24 years old in Ventanas Canton, Los Ríos Province.

She is a member of the “Las Palmas” communal bank located in Recinto Campo Alegre belonging to Bab Canton; they are farmers.

Cecilia has been growing corn and rice for twenty years.  Her purchases and her sales take place in Ventanas.  

She is asking for the loan to continue to work in farming and to buy manure.  With help from the loan she will be able to acquire the supplies in time.  She’s had no type of problem and in her free time she likes to go spend time with her relatives.

loans.use: to continue working in farming and to buy manure.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline is a 39-year-old married woman with 10 children. The oldest child is 19 years old. Evangeline’s husband is a carpenter.

Evangeline has been making baskets for five years. She is able to help support her family through her business. She requested this loan to purchase rattan and other materials for making baskets. Evangeline hopes to have a progressive business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase rattan and other materials for making baskets.

loans.name: Toch

texts.en: Toch, 57, is widowed and resides with a son in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She raises pigs at home. Her son is employed at a garment factory in the city of Phnom Penh. Toch is requesting a loan of USD 350 to purchase more piglets to feed in order to sell them when they gain weight. In the future, she would like to expand her business and renovate her house.

loans.use: to purchase more piglets to fatten and sell

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a thirty-eight year-old hard working man with five children living in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goals are educating his children, buying a car, and building a permanent home. He has been a farmer for the last three years; the major hardships are seasonal weather and inadequate capital to purchase farming equipment. However, he has a vision of diversifying his farming business to include hiring employees to help expand the the farm, and buying more cattle. The purpose of the loan is to buy cattle for rearing.

loans.use: to buy cattle for rearing.

loans.name: Paola Andrea

texts.es:
Paola es una emprendedora que siempre se ha caracterizado por su espíritu de lucha y trabajadora. Paola es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de 2 hijos de 2 y 9 años, quienes siempre han sido su motivación para trabajar fuertemente en su negocio. Paola se dedica a la producción y venta de alimentos como arepas de chócolo, panes, galletas, pan de queso, torta, arequipe, entre otros; además, comidas especiales y refrigerios los cuales los hace por encargo. Paola, gracias a esto, genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de sus 2 hijos, y así les puede ofrecer una mejor educación una mejor calidad de vida. Con el ánimo de realizar su actividad con mayor productividad, Paola busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de un quemador industrial, el cual le permita hacer de su negocio mucho más productivo. 

Paola espera que de esta manera sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente, además, espera que con ingresos superiores pueda ofrecerles a sus hijos una mejor educación. Paola tiene el gran sueño de que su negocio se convierta en un gran proveedor de alimentos de muchos negocios, y que sus hijos en un futuro tengan acceso a una educación universitaria y sean grandes profesionales.

loans.use: Compra de un quemador industrial, el cual le permita hacer de su negocio mucho más productivo.

loans.name: El Progreso Group

texts.es:
El comité El Progreso está situado en la colonia Araujokue, de la ciudad de Curuguaty,  cuenta con 10 integrantes todas cuentan con actividades productivas, Formaron el comité con el compromiso de trabajar en  conjunto y ayudarse las unas a las otras para poder dar a sus familias todo lo que ellas no tuvieron. La Señora Mariana es una de las integrantes del comité tiene con una despensa y quería ampliar su despensa y decidió formar para su comité, accedió al crédito y empezaron a trabajar. Ella también se está dedicando en la venta de producto de limpieza  mediante la fundación que le brinda capacitación y le provee los productos a precio más bajo para poder obtener más ganancia, gracias a las microfranquicias que le ofrece.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de Kits de limpieza, el cual es una de las microfranquicias, y también para la compra de insumos para su despensa con lo que podrá seguir trabajando y cumpliendo con los pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The El Progreso (Progress) communal bank is located in the Araujokue colony, in the city of Curuguaty.  It has 10 members, all of whom have productive jobs.  They formed the communal bank with the promise of working together and helping each other to be able to give their families all that they didn't have.

Señora Mariana is one of the communal bank members.  She has a small grocery store and wanted to expand it so she joined the communal bank, accepted credit, and began to work.  She also makes a living selling cleaning products at the foundation where she gets her training, and she offers them at a lower price in order to get more profit, thanks to the micro-franchising they offer.  She is asking for this loan in order to buy cleaning kits, which are one of the micro-franchises, and also to buy supplies for her small store so that she can continue working and fulfilling her customers' orders.

loans.use: to buy kits and supplies for her small grocery store.

loans.name: Aida Silvia

texts.es: La Sra. Aida 71 años es viuda y vive en casa propia.Ella es pensionada y en ocasiones ayuda en servicios a la comunidad. La Sra. Aida tiene el sueño de ver su casa remodelada y en buenas condiciones porque quiere heredar este patrimonio en un futuro a su hija que se encuentra viviendo en otra ciudad. Anteriormente le ha hecho mejoras con ahorros y apoyo que le hemos brindado, en este momento agradece y solicita nuevamente la ayuda por medio de kiva para construir una barra en la cocina..
texts.en:
Sra. Aida is 71 years old, widowed, and lives in her own home.  She is a pensioner and occasionally helps out with community service.  

Sra. Aida dreams of seeing her house remodeled and in good condition because she would like to pass on this asset in the future to her daughter, who is currently living in another city.  She previously made improvements with the use of her savings and the support that Credituyo provided.  At this moment, she expresses her appreciation and would like to request a new loan from Kiva so that she can build a bar-top counter in her kitchen.

loans.use: to build a bar-top counter in her kitchen.

loans.name: Nonvignon Womey Group

texts.fr: Le groupement NONVIGNON Womey est composé de cinq personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante du groupement, nommée Amelée Yvette (Celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) âgée de 34 ans. Amelée Yvette est mariée à un photographe du nom de Ange. Le couple a deux enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Amelée Yvette vit avec son mari et ses enfants. Les diverses charges de la famille sont supportées par le couple. Pour cette raison, Amelée Yvette vend des mèches et des produits cosmétiques par la méthode de distribution. Amelée Yvette s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer son activité Amelée Yvette ensemble avec les membres du groupement NONVIGNON Womey sollicite pour la quatrième fois un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Les prêts antérieurs ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des mèches et des produits cosmétiques.

loans.name: Pajoca 1 Group

texts.es:
Catarina (la primera del lado izquierdo en la fotografía  de blus blanca) es una mujer de 43 años de edad, es casada con una linda familia de tres hijos de las edades entre siete y catorce años, está humilde familia vive en una comunidad  del caserío Pajoca.
Catarina es una madre de familia que le preocupa el bienestar de su familia y para que no le haga falta nada ella trabaja en la producción de café, con esta actividad lleva 20 años, gracias a sus años de experiencia ha logrado  obtener muy buenas cosechas.
Catarina sabe que esta producción requiere de mucho capital por esa razón solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para el mantenimiento de café, pues en estas épocas ya es muy necesario brindarle mantenimiento para obtener una buena cosecha. Ella tiene toda la esperanza puesta en este crédito que lo ayudara a obtener una buena cosecha. Su esperanza de vida es  mejorar los ingresos económicos de su familia.

loans.use: Mantenimiento de café

loans.name: Iva

texts.en: Mrs Iva T. is a 62 year old lady that joined SPBD in April 2006. Iva is the only lady in the wheelchair in SPBD’s program in Samoa. She was in her wheelchair in her late thirties, due to mistreating at the hospital. She was awarded second price in our savings progam in 2006. Iva ia a happy lady like any other normal lady, but with the fact that she can’t walk no more, she is not giving up in trying to develop her family. I’ve visited Iva’s home up the mountain, and from there, It had a clear picture of Iva when she was strong. She’s got a beautiful garden in front of her house, and a vegetable garden at her backyard. Due to the fact that she can no longer work in her gardens, she decided to start a business that she can do, which she chooses Elei Printing. Elei printing is a man made Samoan type of  printing that is highly demanded by Samoan staying in Samoa and especially the Samoans staying overseas. After 4 months of starting her business, Iva realized that her business was becoming really successful, due to more demand from her local customers, because of the good quality and neat printings.

loans.use: Loan was used to buy materials, fabric paint and glitters, brushes, carved timber for printing.

loans.name: Penina

texts.en: Penina is married with children and lives in the village of Vailoa-uta.  Penina’s family depends on her as the sole income earner.  Penina is seeking a loan to enhance her small business, through which she is able to cover the expenses of her family.  She operates a flea market stall and caters to the tourist market selling Samoan decorative arts and handicrafts, traditional jewelry, and traditional island clothes.  Penina hopes to draw more customers by increasing the quality and supply of her goods and so will use loan funds to purchase more and better materials to stock her flea market stall.

loans.use: Purchase more materials to stock her flea market stall, e.g. tanoa, beads, necklaces, bracelets, leis

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es:
Lorena is a very hard-working woman who doesn’t mind struggling to reach her goals. She is 31 years old. She is married and a mother of 2 beautiful girls who are 3 and 10 years old. Her husband is in the public transportation business. His salary doesn’t take care of all the family’s necessities. Due to this, Lorena started selling cosmetics about 3 years ago. Fortunately, she has found some clients and her orders have increased.

In order to offer more of a variety of products to her clients and to provide a better service, Laura needs a loan in the amount of $375 USD which she will use to buy more merchandise. With your help, you can contribute to the growth of this business and to the well-being of her family. They greatly appreciate it!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Lorena es una mujer muy trabajadora que lucha siempre por lograr sus metas, ella es casada, tiene 31 años de edad y es madre de dos preciosas hijas de 3 y 10 años de edad. Su esposo es concesionario de transporte público, pero había ocasiones en que su salario no cubría las necesidades de su familia, ante la necesidad de un ingreso extra, Lorena inició con la venta de cosméticos hace tres años, afortunadamente ha logrado tener más clientes y sus pedidos cada vez son mayores.

Para poder ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos y mejorar la calidad de su servicio, Lorena necesita un préstamo de $ 375 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía, ella se compromete a devolver esta cantidad en un lapso de 4 a 8 meses. Con tu ayuda puedes contribuir al crecimiento de este negocio y mejorar el bienestar de esta familia, ellos te lo agradecerán.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina is a very hard-working and enthusiastic woman. She is married and has 3 daughters and one son of 21, 18, 9 and 4 years of age. Her husband is a salesman but his salary cannot cover all of the family’s basic needs. For this reason Marina decided to start her own business selling clothes, belts and some basic foods. Bit by bit her business picked up and thanks to the good service that she offers her clients, it has grown.

Right now, Marina needs a loan of $200 to buy merchandise so that she can offer a wider range of products to her clients so that they will continue to buy from her. She promises to repay this amount over a period of 3 months. Contribute to the growth of this business. Marina and her family thank you very much for your trust and support.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Marina es una mujer muy trabajadora y entusiasta, está casada y tiene tres hijas y un hijo, de 21, 18, 9 y 4 años de edad. Su esposo labora como vendedor pero su salario no alcanaza a cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, es por esta razón que desde hace dos años Marina decidió iniciar su propio negocio con la venta de ropa, cintos y algunos articulos de abarrotes, poco a poco ha estado surtiendo mejor su negocio y gracias al buen servicio que ofrece sus clientes se han incrementado mucho.

En estos momentos Marina está solicitando un préstamo de $ 200 dólares que utilizará en la compra de mercancía para ofrecer a sus clientes una mayor variedad de productos y continuar con su preferencia, ella promete devolver esta cantidad en 3 meses. Contribuye al crecimiento de este negocio, Marina y su familia agradecen mucho la confianza y apoyo que les brindas.

loans.use: To buy buy merchandise/Compra de mercancía

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
Maria Luisa sells chickens from her brother's home, as she does not own her own home. She sells every day and her customers are housewives from the neighborhood. She is 30 years old, has two children, and belongs to the San Felipe 2 group. With her loan she intends to air condition the place where she displays her chickens, thereby increasing sales, and with the earnings she hopes to improve the economic situation of her family and in the future own her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

MARIA LUISA se dedica a la venta de pollos, este negocio lo tiene establecido en la casa de su hermana ya que por el momento no tiene casa propia. Ella vende todos los días y sus clientes son las amas de casa de su comunidad. Ella tiene 30 años, dos hijos y pertenece al grupo llamado San Felipe 2. Con su préstamo pretende acondicionar el lugar para exhibir los pollos y de esta forma aumentar las ventas, ya que con las ganancias espera mejorar la situación económica de su familia y en un futuro adquirir una casa propia.

loans.use: Improve facility for selling chickens

loans.name: Aun

texts.en:
Mrs. D. Aun and her husband Pich Thach got married in 1979 and have eight children: six daughters and two sons. She learned to weave silk from a neighbor in 2004 and started her own silk production business in the same year. Her husband is a fisherman. Two of her daughters also weave silk, one son is a security guard, two are married and the rest are still in school.

Mrs D. has borrowed money from MAXIMA four times already. She is now requesting a $1,200 loan to purchase silk materials and sewing thread, pay fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom and to buy a new loom for her daughter.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials and sewing thread, and paying fees for selecting and preparing silk on the loom.

loans.name: Jany

texts.en:
Jany R. G. from Morales in San Martin has a business cooking and selling barbequed meat from her home. Jany is 39 years old and has 3 children and a terminally ill husband. She started the restaurant in August of 2007 with an old grill, and it’s currently the family's only source of income. She has experienced steady growth and demand for her delicious meats, which she attributes to her location and product. She always buys the best meats to cook, and her home is located on the corner of the busy town plaza. With the disposable income she has earned, she has reinvested in the business and bought a new grill, plates, and utensils.

The barbeque business has come naturally to Jany as she has experience managing other businesses. Jany is happy to work from home where she gets to spend time with and take care of her family. She is a hard worker who wakes up early and goes to bed late to balance her many duties.

Jany, a member of the Community Bank Mujeres Rumbo Al Desarrollo, is seeking a $675 loan to improve the main dining room and the bathroom. She is confident that these improvements will attract new clients and further improve the family's economic situation. In addition to improving her restaurant, Jany dreams of owning telephone booths, another lucrative business.

loans.use: To improve her restaurant

loans.name: Ilgar

texts.en: Ilgar Y. lives in Beylagan, a small city in Azerbaijan. He is 44 years old, married, and has four children. He owns and operates a small car repair store in Beylagan. He started his car repair business seven years ago. He needs a loan in the amount of $475 to buy spare parts and to earn more income to improve his living. This is his first loan.

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en:
Miss C. Sopheap, 32, is single and lives with her widowed mother. She is the oldest daughter and has one sister and six brothers. Her sister is selling flowers while four of her brothers are farmers. The other two brothers are studying in the local school. Her mother raises pigs. Sopheap started her business of selling flowers in 1990. She purchases flowers from a farmer in her village to sell in Phnom Penh.

Miss Sopheap and her family live along the Tonle Basac River, a tributary of the nearby Mekong approximately fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. She hopes that her business will enable her brothers to continue their studies to the highest level possible.

Miss Sopheap is requesting her second loan in the amount of $1000. She will use this money to purchase a motorbike to travel to Phnom Penh and sell her flowers.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike

loans.name: Chin

texts.en: Mrs. Chin Y., 50, is a widow and has four children. Her husband passed away many years ago, so she is the one who take care of and covers all of her family’s expenses. Starting in 2000, she opened a stand in front of a primary school selling biscuits, snacks and sugarcane juice. She is able to earn around $8 each day of income. In order to lessen her family’s financial cost, Mrs. Chin Y. is taking a loan from CREDIT MFI in the amount of $400 to purchase piglets to breed on her piece of land. She expects to earn income from this breeding in six to seven months.

loans.use: To purchase piglets to breed

loans.name: Asha's Tulivu Group

texts.en:
Asha is 29 years old and is single with 1 child, aged 9. Asha sells charcoal, which she started doing in 2005. She works from 7 am to 6 pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $50 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members Rehema and Salma, who have businesses of owning a shop and food vending.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
Angelina S. G. has a business making cheese in the town of Mache high in the mountains of the La Libertad region of Peru. She’s been making her cheeses for 7 years and sells her product in Trujillo, the capital of the region. She also raises animals, such as pigs, sheep, and chickens, to sell at a local market.

Angelina is 48 years old and has 6 children. She loves her businesses, because, without them, she wouldn’t have any other way to survive. She works hard to save and help her family as much as possible.

A member of the Mujeres de Mache community bank, Angelina is requesting a loan of s/3000 ($1100 USD) that she will repay over 4 months. She will use the loan to buy ingredients for her cheeses.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for her cheeses

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia A. is married with four children who are currently in school. She is fifty two years old and has been a seamstress for twenty years. She sews all forms of female clothng in various kinds of styles that suit the tastes of her customers like kaba and slit, wedding dresses, funeral clothes, etc. She wants to use the loan to buy increased supplies of sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc. in order to increase her output and efficiency. She hopes to raise sufficient income to provide her daughter with a quality education. She is a member of the community group called “Asempa kanea” Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee one another as social collateral to access loans, and peer pressure to repay. Cecilia’s photograph was taken during her group meeting.

loans.use: To buy increased supplies of sewing material like linen, threads, thimbles, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Mambo from Mbeya, Tanzania! This is 35 year-old Maria M.. She is married, and has two children aged 7 and 18. In 2005 Maria established her crops business. Working six days a week, and nine to twelve hours a day, she earns about US $60 every month from this business. Maria requires a loan in order to buy more crops in bulk. She thanks you for your support.

SELFINA is engaged in economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through leasing and leaseback facility as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed not-creditworthy by financial institutions as they lack tangible collateral assets. This leads to poor financial support hence poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes.

SELFINA buys and leases equipment to women. Where a client needs working capital SELFINA buys equipment from said client, extending a loan to her, then leasing back the same equipment – a process called a sale and leaseback arrangement

loans.use: To buy more crops in bulk.

loans.name: Sugran M.ameen's Group

texts.en:
Sugran baji is a wife of M. and lives in a small city named Kasur, Pakistan. She has been living in this city for the last 25 years. She is the mother of four children: one daughter and three sons. Her elder son makes embroidered dresses. The next eldest to him has a lathe job. Her husband is a teacher and teaches the students about Islam (Muslim religion). Sugran baji is a hardworking lady, and she teaches her children to be hard workers. She is a housewife but she has a thread-making business. She buys sweaters and removes the threads from them. After washing it, she sells the thread in the market and earns a profit. She successfully completed her two loans from Asasah (a microfinance institute of Pakistan). Now she is applying for a loan to buy material (thread, cloth) for her elder son who is in the decorative embroidery profession.

She is joined in her loan group by a few more members. Khursheed baji wants a loan to buy a lathe machine. Nazia baji wants a loan to material (lentils, cooking oil, rice) for her grocery shop. Parveen baji and Naziran baji each want a loan to buy supplies (chair, mirror) for her beauty salon. Zareena M. wants a loan to buy material (thread, cloth) for her embroidery business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy material for embroidery business

loans.name: James B.

texts.en:
James B. A. is married and has 2 children; they live in Elmina. He has received schooling through first degree level. James is a chemical seller but a teacher by profession. His monthly income as a teacher is not enough to meet the family's financial needs so he had to engage himself in the selling of chemicals after teaching to earn additional income, which he has done since 2002. His wife is a merchant.

James uses his income to pay for the children's school fees and utility bills. James will use the loan to add to his capital to increase the chemicals at the store to meet his ever-increasing customers' needs. With the new profits from his expanded business, James plans to pay for his children's schooling.

loans.use: to add to his working capital to increase the chemicals at the store

loans.name: Vilma Rosa

texts.es: Comenzó vendiendo frutas en el mercado de Masaya  con su mamá, en la actualidad ella ya tiene su negocio propio, debido a que esta actividad se ejerce solo por la mañana; ella buscó otra alternativa para ofertar por la tarde como es la venta de elotes y yoltamales, los cuales ella elabora y oferta en su comarca. Manifiesta que los créditos de adim le han ayudado mucho por que tiene capital para trabajar. Se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer emprendedora, es madre de 3 niños, los que asisten al colegio de primaria. Con mucho esfuerzo logró construir un cuarto cerca de la casa de su mamá. Su mayor ilusión es de construir su propia casa para tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
She started selling fruit in the Masaya market with her Mum and now she has her own business. As she only does this during the mornings she looked for another activity to do in the afternoons, like selling sweetcorn on the cob and 'yoltamales' (a sweetcorn dish made with milk that is cooked then solidified), which she makes and sells in her region. She states that the credits she has received from ADIM have helped her a lot as she now has capital to work. She is a very industrious woman, she has 3 kids who are in primary school. It was with a lot of effort that she managed to build a room near the house for her mother. Her dream is to build her own house to have better living conditions.


Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Work capital/Capital de Trabajo
